Name: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: What does a Business Intelligence Analyst do for Allegiant? Translates data into persuasive insight that answers key business questions. Understands and assists in the development of reporting, analysis and visualization of business data, metrics and measures in order to allow staff to align and track against overall business strategies, goals and objectives. Drives innovation, insight and decision making. What are some of the daily duties of a Business Intelligence Analyst?Design, develop, implement and maintain new reporting functionality and analytic applications across multiple business units using various business intelligence toolsCollaborates with business users and subject-matter experts to establish technical vision and analysis with regards to business usability and performance requirementsEnhance and maintain existing reports and analytical applicationsBuild predictive models and forecastsInteract with the DBA and Development teams for building of solutions, system maintenance, and report/application developmentAdministrates reporting services applications and ensures accurate and timely automated reportingAssists with implementation of data quality improvement processes and initiativesUnderstands the development of ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Loading) processes to acquire data from internal and external sourcesDevelop and maintain repeatable, systemic processes while finding ways to make internal team processes more efficientOther duties as assignedWhat are the minimum requirements to be a Business Intelligence Analyst?Degree Requirements: Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics and/or EngineeringExperience using MS Excel, R, and Tableau preferredExperience writing and interpreting SQL requiredSome experience with relational database and large, complex datasetsWhat other skills, knowledge, and qualifications are needed to be a Business Intelligence Analyst?Results-driven; accepting responsibility for individual performance and contributions to team projectsAbility to work with cross-functional groups in a collaborative environmentManages time effectively in order to meet timelines across multiple projectsStrong systems skills, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)Ability to learn quickly and translate data into clear and actionable results, and strong organizational skillsTableau or SQL experience a plusExcellent critical thinker and effective problem solver with creative solutionsDetail oriented and highly organizedStrong oral and written communication skills, ability to present to senior managementDeals well with and finds ways to decrease ambiguityMust pass a background check and pre-employment drug screenMust have authorization to work in the U.S. as defined by the Immigrations Act of 1986What are the physical requirements of a Business Intelligence Analyst?Must be able to work in a high-pressure environmentMust have ability to safely perform the essential functions of the position Allegiant is an equal opportunity employer and will not unlawfully discriminate against qualified applicants or Team Members with respect to any terms or conditions of employment based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, creed, marital status, military service status, union/non-union activity, citizenship status, or other characteristic protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. This includes compliance with all federal, state and local laws providing for nondiscrimination on the basis of disability in all aspects of the employment process and the requirement to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with those laws.

Name: Business Systems Analyst III - IT

Applies technical and business knowledge, skills, and judgment to problem solve system issues. Provides on-going user business system support. Operates under general supervision.Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesEnsures the integrity of operations and maintenance of business systems as well as interfaces into other systemsConducts high-level and detail analysis for moderately complex system enhancements, prepares associated business requirements specifications, designs, plans, tests, and implements modifications and enhancements to systemsDiagnoses and resolves system related problems and questions with respect to both maintenance and development activities. Works with team to develop milestones and timelines. Works with other team members to project timelines are met. Specialized Knowledge and Skills Specialized Knowledge and Skills Demonstrated knowledge of the related complex business systems and processes. Demonstrated understanding of business system enhancement and modification principles. Demonstrated skills in planning and coordinating enterprise grade projects. Demonstrated interpersonal, analytical, and communication skills. End-user interaction and support experience.  Experience with enterprise grade CAD & GIS systems is highly preferred.  Utility industry experience is highly preferred Equipment and Applications PCs, word processing, Excel, project, presentation, spreadsheet and database software Work Environment and Physical Demands General office environment. No special physical demands required.CompensationAnnual Salary: $71,200 (Min) to $91,500 (Mid); Up to 10% Short Term Incentive Plan opportunity at the discretion of the company. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Link Technologies is currently seeking a contract -Business Analyst with a high-profile client in Las Vegas, NV. The primary responsibility of the Business Analyst is to consult with business subject matter experts and technology resources to identify, prioritize, document, and manage business requirements. The Business Analyst is expected to lead and facilitate requirements gathering workshops and discussions with the requesting business units. These resources are also expected to analyze and document business processes, review and validate test plans, support user acceptance testing, and track/manage requirements traceability throughout the development lifecycle.Responsibilities•Capture and review impacted business processes, working with business stakeholders to identify and make business process improvements that result in cost savings, quality improvements, increased efficiencies, reduced risk, and shorter cycle times.•Manage requirements traceability throughout the systems development lifecycle.•Deliver on assigned project tasks within time, cost, and quality constraints.•Manage stakeholder expectations and understanding of the implications of changes to existing applications, systems, and/or processes.•Facilitate cost and effort estimation sessions with developers and third-party solution providers.•Support QA and UAT processes through validation of test planning and execution.•Leading and mentoring junior and mid-level business analysts on larger projects that demand multiple BAs.•Leading and facilitating requirements gathering workshops and discussions with IT and various corporate business stakeholders.•Analyze and document current business processes and functional requirements.•Conduct Enterprise Analysis activities such as defining the business need in the context of specific project, prioritizing related initiatives and working with senior stakeholders to make decisions on how to address them.•Develop a clear set of requirements that are complete and understood by technology resources and business stakeholders; Manage requirements and associated changes to the requirements through the project lifecycle.•Identify and understand business problems and the impact of proposed solutions on the operations of the organization•Document solution scope including objectives, added value and benefit expectations.Minimum Qualifications•Minimum 5 to 8 years’ experience as a Business Analyst.•Demonstrated experience in process mapping, business requirements analysis and documentation, data mapping and test planning.•Knowledge and understanding of Agile, BPMN, UML, and user interface design.•Working knowledge of database concepts and query tools.•Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience.•Ability to confidently take on complex, high profile projects involving multiple systems, stakeholders, and project resources.•Ability to work independently and to effectively manage and execute multiple initiatives concurrently.•Experience working on projects spanning multiple domains, and ability to handle new business domains effectively and with a high level of confidence.•Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences, both verbally and in writing.•21 years of age.•Proof of authorization to work in the United States•Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline.•Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both in spoken and written form

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Verve-BIAnalyst-LasVegas - Business Intelligence Analyst - Data ProWhat skills will you need most? This role will require someone to be especially strong in these areas: Problem solving and analytical abilities: the ability to understand a problem, break it down and execute to provide the answer. Beyond analyzing the problem in its own right, you must be able to triage incoming problems and discern the relative importance and urgency of new and existing problems in order to prioritize your work effectively.Working with complex SQL statements and LookML files.Proactive communication.Salesforce is used extensively, so you'll need to be well-versed with manipulating this CRM.If you've done APIs in Python or with other back-end languages such as Java or C++, such skills are highly desirable.We'd definitely like to talk if you've used Looker or similar BI tools. If you've read this far and know this is exactly the kind of career challenge you long to tackle, please apply on line today for our careful consideration. (The recruiter is Liz Klein, 469-223-4900.)  Is playing with data and teaching business stakeholders how to use it effectively your idea of a fun career? As our Business Intelligence Analyst at Verve, your main focus will be to design, implement, and document a business intelligence system for our fast-growing sales teams. As the sole BI Analyst based in our Las Vegas office, you will join a small, agile, and geographically-dispersed BI team in facilitating a company culture of better decision-making. You will work cross-functionally with managers, team leads, and data-hungry employees to provide digestible, impactful, and actionable business insights for our rapidly-expanding Student Services group.  Your mission is to cultivate an expert familiarity with our distinct business processes and flows, with the ultimate goal of empowering employees with the insights necessary to excel. Combining your business acumen with your unparalleled knowledge of our multiple underlying data models, you will build flexible reports and dashboards. These tools will be optimized to serve most day-to-day business needs and will ensure that our deliverables meet the highest possible caliber of data integrity. Intrigued? Read on for more details. What will you achieve in the next 12 months?Observe data needs and usage across departments and keep your colleagues informed of the latest improvements in our data reporting systems. By doing so, you will be the eyes, ears, and voice of Business Intelligence in North America for our Student Services group.Build, maintain, and improve upon models and dashboards in Looker, ensuring that every team feels confident in finding what they need and is informed in their decision-making. Consistent and thorough documentation of key fields and tables will be essential for driving engagement within the organization.Prepare comprehensive reports and analyses in response to ad hoc data and insight requests and as part of your own explorative curiosity.Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that data and reporting in  our systems is accurate and effective. Verve is building a platform which enables our global network of advocates to sell products and services they love to their friends in exchange for unique experiences and rewards. We've established a beachhead in live entertainment and work with some of the biggest events in the world, and are rapidly expanding our festival and event portfolio across the U.S., UK, Europe, and Australasia. As we continue to expand rapidly within this market, we’re also developing and launching exciting new technology for events to connect directly with their biggest fans. At Verve we believe in a culture of freedom and ownership.  We empower you to own the value you create and impact on our future success. And we believe that to act as an owner you should be empowered to work in the way that enables you to deliver the best results – how and when you do is up to you. You choose your hours, where you work, the meetings you attend and the amount of holiday to take in order to create the most value and be at your best.https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/jobs/#/candidate-experience/jobs/459729718&sourceType=29

Name: Business Analyst
Description: PetFlow is a digital retailer that sells dog and cat food & supplies and has relationships with customers all over the country. Our values are simple - we believe in good foods and good deeds. We believe in cultivating a strong sense of compassion and karma by doing good deeds for pets across the country, and by providing pet parents with the best possible choices for their furry family members.  Its an extremely exciting time to be joining the team, as weve recently migrated our headquarters from New York to Las Vegas. With that comes great growth potential and a great opportunity to learn. Our company holds among its principal values being a great place to work, and we do this by being transparent with one another from the top down, setting and achieving our goals, providing a great experience for our customers, and by having a ton of fun doing it! Anyone that is brought on board is expected to believe in and be fully committed to embracing these values. About the Role PetFlow is seeking an Analyst to join our operation and report to the General Manager. This unique position will leverage data and strong analytical skills to create intelligent business models and decisions, focusing on customer segmentation, margin profiles and overall operational excellence. This unique opportunity will provide invaluable exposure to the strategic components that enable an eCommerce company to run profitably at scale. This role is expected to help the team manage and complete a mix of daily core functions, routine analysis work and ad-hoc projects. In this role, youll have the opportunity to have a real impact on our bottom line from day one. Who Were Looking ForBachelors degree in business-related or analysis-heavy concentration -OR- strong experience in an analytical, startup or finance role.Advanced knowledge of excel, SQL, and other data analysis toolsExperience using GA to surface site behavior insights, or eager to learn how!Excited about solving problems, digging into complex data sets, and building sensitivity modelsAttention to detail, and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to summarize analysis results and recommendations concisely and clearlyBonus: Experience working in ecommerce, or a company with diverse user-profiles, large merchandise selection, marketed across multiple channelsResponsibilitiesAssist all departments with regular data analysis, including Customer cohort insightsMarketing channel performanceSite analytics (demographics, page performance, technology tendencies)Product margin analysis & trendsAssist merchandising operation with developing and maintaining a pricing strategyModel ROI templates and worksheets for strategic projectsOwn our BI tool, RJ Metrics Data importsReport/dashboard building as requiredRun ad-hoc reports and data requests as needed through SQL, RJ Metrics or otherSurface insights into customer behavior and tendencies to help drive product decisions On-site activityOrder modification tendenciesLeverage data & insights to coordinate product development with our product managersWhat Youll GetYou'll be a core member of our team, with the ability to add creative input and drive change from day 1.A bright and sunny office in the Southwest Vegas valley Ping-pong loving and dog-friendly!Spending time with great people is a value for us, and we think its a huge part of having fun at work. We strive to create an environment that thrives on intellect and encourages thought.Competitive payFull time benefits plan, including medical/dental/vision/pet insurance and paid time offTeam outings, bagel Thursdays and ad-hoc catered lunches!

Name: Business Analyst

We need creative minds who get a thrill out of solving the issues facing merchants and consumers. We provide a competitive pay structure commensurate with experience. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: ApplyDescriptionABOUT LOYCO Las Vegas has figured out something that the rest of the world hasn’t. It’s about what it takes to entice travelers to visit a destination. It’s about stimulating consumers’ emotions and imaginations. It’s about motivating behavior with aspirational experiences, not with discounts and deals. It’s about building loyalty one memory at a time. It’s about providing amazing value to the consumer, while doing the same for the business.  We’re a Las Vegas crew, so this is in our DNA. It’s what we do. Meanwhile, most companies are still stuck in a world of 2% cashback, punchcards and Groupon. It’s maddening, but we see this as an opportunity and we’re exploiting it.  We’re assembling a group of people who are passionate about bringing these ideas to the rest of the world, people who want to create a rewards program that actually rewards people with memorable moments, people who get the power of forging connections for consumers between great experiences and their favorite brands. We’re a startup within Playstudios, so it will be scrappy and fast-paced. There might be some long hours. It’ll be an uphill battle most of the way. But this could be huge.  If that’s you, contact us. JOB DESCRIPTION We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. We’ve recognized that we need to be masters of data. We need to be testing and iterating. We need the right answers at our fingertips. We also need to present the results to executives and to our strategic B2B partners. There’s only one problem - we don’t have a business intelligence function. Yet.  That’s where you come in. RequirementsPRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESBe a business intelligence one-person departmentPut a bass drum on your back, cymbals on your feet, and a computer around your neck.The bad news: You’ll be asked to wear many hats. To multitask. To take on a potentially uneven workload.The good news: You’ll get to take the lead on designing and building the architecture, look and feel of our data and reporting.LoyCo’s data ecosystemHelp drive the strategic direction and implementation of the data architecture and data warehouseEnsure the tools and systems are collecting, storing, and displaying back the right data based on the business needsEnsure the accuracy and completeness of the data - be the data quality champion for LoyCoEnsure data consumers have access to the data and reporting they needOwn all of LoyCo’s reporting and analysisCollect internal and external customers’ data and reporting needs and prioritize its throughputCreate presentations for and present to peers, LoyCo executives, and LoyCo B2B strategic partnersTranslate customer needs into useful, actionable data and analysesBe a data evangelist and liaison both internally and externallyAid product and business owners with best practices and strategic thinking around how to best analyze data, measure success, and frame testsPlay a strategic/data role in the customer survey programDesign and deploy automation & self-service tools into reporting processPREFERRED EXPERIENCEPrior start-up experiencePrior experience in business intelligence/data scienceUX, data visualization, data presentation skillsMust be part-artist, part-scientist, part-scholar, part-comedian, part-executiveFOUNDING PRINCIPLEPeople deserve great value for their loyalty, and reciprocal relationships with their favorite brands. Customer rewards needn’t be a zero-sum game. There’s almost always a way to find a win-win.BENEFITS AND PERKS100% Health Benefits coverage for you and your dependents!Employee-driven entertainment, game nights, and team-building events throughout the yearCatered lunches throughout the weekOpen, creative office spaceCasual startup-like environmentFlexible vacation policy A great place to work. Come by to find out for yourself!

Name: Business Systems Analyst IV - Finance
Description: Responsibilities Basic Purpose Conducts analysis, prepares associated business requirement specifications, designs, plans, tests and implements modifications and enhancements to financial planning systems. Applies technical and business knowledge, skills, and judgment to problem solve system issues. Provides on-going user business system support. Performs analysis to predict outcomes and recommends possible solutions to meet business operational needs. May be required to work on special projects or to provide work direction and technical assistance to less experienced staff. Operates under minimal supervision. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Ensures the integrity of operations and maintenance of financial planning systems as well as interfaces into other systems. Conducts detailed analysis for all system enhancements, prepares associated business requirements specifications, designs, plans, tests, and implements modifications and enhancements to financial planning systems. Coordinates version upgrades of financial planning systems on at least an annual basis. Diagnoses and resolves system related problems and questions with respect to both maintenance and development activities. Ensures that system controls are adequate for compliance with relevant company policy, including managing system and user security roles, change management policy, and scenario management policy. Leads all systems projects. Works with team to develop milestones and timelines. Works with team members to ensure project timelines are met. Identifies and manages project issues to resolution and escalates issues to management as needed. Maintains knowledge of current system technology and investigates current developments in systems and assimilates functional experience with new software technologies to improve business processes. Acts as business system advisor to the organization including functional users, occasional users and other work management teams. Completes documentation in accordance with Change Management and Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) policies and procedures. Communicates with users to gather requirements, discusses system solutions, answers questions and describe system changes. Interfaces with vendors, primarily financial planning software, for projects and production system issues. Interacts with Information Technology and system users in this effort. Performs analytics using various sources of data to predict/forecast possible outcomes. Based on analysis performed, recommends strategies to address possible outcomes and/or to meet business operational needs. Performs daily operational tasks in the financial planning production systems. Performs hands-on training and prepares training materials and user documentation for functional users. Ensures all compliance aspects of position are known and followed; understands and complies with all policies, codes and regulations applicable to position and company. Performs related duties as assigned. Requirements Essential Education, Skills, and Environment Education and Work Experience Bachelor s degree in Business, Information Systems or related area from an accredited school and 6 years of related experience. Candidates that do not possess a bachelor s degree must have a minimum of 10 years of related work experience. Specialized Knowledge and Skills Demonstrated knowledge of: Financial planning systems and processes. Understanding of business system enhancement and modification principles Skills such as: Planning, coordinating projects, analytical, interpersonal and communication. Prefer experience working with Utility Planner Software Equipment and Applications PCs, word processing, Excel, project, presentation, spreadsheet and database software. Work Environment and Physical Demands General office environment. No special physical demands required. Compensation Annual Salary: $81,500 (Min) to $105,200 (Mid); Up to 10% Short Term Incentive Plan opportunity at the discretion of the company. This is a non-represented position. Benefits Medical Dental Vision Life Insurance Wellness Flexible Spending Accounts Tuition Assistance 401(k) with a Company match provision Retirement and more, visit our Corporate website for detailed information EEO/AA NV Energy is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, gender, national origin, ancestry, religion, physical or mental disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, or any other factor protected by anti-discrimination laws. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at our company, please contact Human Resources via email at *************************** or call our HR Help Desk at ************** and select '0' or Fax your request at **************. TTY Sensory Impaired - 711 Note Depending on qualifications of applicants, this position may be filled at a lower level than that which is posted such as Business Systems Analyst III - Finance .

Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst
Description: American Homes 4 Rent As one of the country's fastest-growing property management companies of single-family rental homes, American Homes 4 Rent has an exhilarating and fluid start-up culture and permanency of a well-founded corporation, rich with diversity. As pioneers in the industry, solidified by our place on Wall Street, American Homes 4 Rent (AMH:NYSE) is currently looking for qualified candidates. With a culture of unprecedented growth, quality and innovative collaboration, we are seeking personalities to complement our attributes.  The Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst (BIRA) codifies business logic using SQL and produces visually appealing business intelligence for end users to consume. The BIRA works with business stakeholders to identify reporting requirements necessary to improve visibility into their performance and areas of improvement. The Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst will interact regularly with internal business customers to capture and understand reporting and data service requests, they will help define and clarify requirements, propose, define, and develop appropriate solutions, and provide feedback to the reporting team. They will perform quality review of developed solutions and ensure proper user acceptance. This essential position provides the necessary feedback to grow our business and gain efficiencies. meet reporting requirements for all areas of operationsCollaborates with business unit owners to constantly improve work product, debug erroneous logic, and create new features in existing report packagesUtilizes relational database and data warehouse design skills to create an effectivedata model for efficient and robust historical and real-time reportingElicits requirements when necessary of documentation.Logs, tracks, and manages issues and requests in JIRAHandles various other duties as delegated by the Business Intelligence Reporting ManagerRequired Skills:Requirements -Bachelor's Business Intelligence, Analytics or Data Warehousing technologies requiredMinimum of three (3) years of experience utilizing proven requirements gathering and business analysis techniques required Must have a complete understanding of the business intelligence development life cycle including the ability to conduct interviews and gather the needs for desired outcomes for the BI solutions being builtMinimum of three (3) years of experience developing and maintaining relational databases (SQL Server preferred) requiredAdvanced Microsoft Excel experience required: Writing and using advanced functions and formulas (e.g. lookup & reference, nested logical expressions, aggregation, etc.)Advanced Excel features (e.g. conditional formatting, data validation, pivot tables, external data connections)Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word) and JIRA requiredMaster's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Management Information Systems or a related field preferredThree (3) years of experience working in real estate environment preferredWorking knowledge of Tableau highly preferredExcellent verbal and written communication and problem-solving skillsStrong business/financial analysis skills and technical aptitudeMust be able to multi-taskWork where you feel right at home - If you are a versatile professional who values culture, a constructive environment and the potential for exponential growth, we want to work with you! Apply now and someone from our Talent Acquisition team will reach out to you soon! Name: Business Analyst - Information Technology (IT)
Description: Located in Las Vegas, the business analyst is responsible for analyzing and modeling existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. A thorough understanding of the current state of the organization is necessary prior to recommending changes related to implementing a new business solution.  The business analyst uses modeling tools to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state. The business analyst is responsible for the knowledge transfer of business implications to the application/database developers and project managers. RESPONSIBILITIES The business analyst works closely with the business and is a major contributor to the requirements specification deliverable, writes the business and functional requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.  This person understands the business and ensures that there is synergy between the business and IT. Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The business analyst understands development processes SDLC and is very analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues. Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Verve is looking for an operationally-minded analytical guru to join its Operations team to help scale its travel business. The Operations Analyst will be critical in ensuring we grow our business responsibly and profitably. You will work closely with the sales team to ensure they’re tracking towards targets and provide critical insights and guidance to help measure and ensure success. The Operations Analyst will closely monitor customer demand and behavior as well as monitor emerging pricing trends to ensure our travel packages are competitive but profitable. You will partner with the sales and inventory teams to ensure we’re fully leveraging available inventory and that we’re optimizing contracts with supply partners.  This is a high-impact role that will be crucial to the long-term success of the company. You will have the ability to make immediate contributions and help build the framework that allows this company to continue to successfully scale. What will you achieve in the next 12 monthsEnable the sales management team to ensure their teams are hitting targets by providing analytical support and insights; track actual versus projected sales and provide guidance and recommendations as needed.Provide support on the commission planning and forecast process to ensure sales targets are aligned with the budget and that territories are setup optimally.Own the pricing process for all travel packages; using market and historical data, ensure products are always priced to be competitive while still driving meaningful margin for the business.Oversee inventory reporting and insights. Partner closely with the inventory and sales teams to ensure we’re maintaining optimal levels of inventory across all destinations based on trending sales. Provide recommendations and strategy adjustments to minimize risk and optimize margin.Play a critical role in ensuring we convert prospective travelers into paying customers by monitoring and helping to shape our deposit and payment plan processes. Work closely with the community and finance teams to ensure travel groups are converting as anticipated and adjust inventory strategy as needed.Requirements3+ years’ experience as a finance, pricing, or operations analystExcel and Google Sheets junky – proven ability to build models that help drive key decisionsAbility to manipulate large sets of data with extreme attention to detail; experience transforming large datasets into meaningful storiesExcellent communicator and able to manage stakeholders across multiple departments/functionsHighly motivated and able to work independently and manage priorities effectivelyBenefits About Verve:  Verve is building a platform which enables our global network of advocates to sell products and services they love to their friends in exchange for unique experiences and rewards. We‘ve established a beachhead in live entertainment and work with some of the biggest events in the world, and are rapidly expanding our festival and event portfolio globally. As we continue to expand rapidly within this market, we’re also developing and launching exciting new technology in the Sports and Travel verticals.  At Verve we believe in a culture of freedom and ownership. We empower you to own the value you create and impact on our future success. And we believe that to act as an owner you should be empowered to work in the way that enables you to deliver the best results – how and when you do is up to you. You choose your hours, where you work, the meetings you attend and the amount of holiday to take in order to create the most value and be at your best.

Name: Senior Analyst – Business Intelligence (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:The Senior Analyst will support leaders in executing MGM Resorts International’s enterprise-wide Business Intelligence (BI) strategy within the Enterprise Analytics (EA) organization. The Analyst will work through specific BI initiatives provided to the broader organization interfacing closely with the Business as well as with the IM and IT organizations with respect to BI tools. Collaborates with the Information Management and Information Technology organizations, as well as EA and the Business on an enterprise wide basis to execute on the ongoing strategy to assess BI tools.Evaluates and tests BI tools and works with leaders to plan and execute the roll out of BI tools to EA as well as the Business.Understands the upstream and downstream impacts and takes initiative to effectively implement the tools for business transformation.Monitors and reports on effectiveness of BI tools in production.Delivers the BI dashboard strategy, including strategic, tactical, and operational dashboards, subject area analysis, and support of performance management methodologies.Identifies and leads execution of process improvement opportunities.Recommends and implements corrective actions to resolve issues associated with BI tools.Reviews findings and makes recommendations with senior team members.Works with the VP Business Intelligence and the business in the development of functional design and requirements (define, design and prioritize) to enable BI capability. Perform other job related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Finance, or related fields.At least 2 years of experience with Business Intelligence, Analytics/or Information Management discipline.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Master’s Degree in Finance Business Management, Information Management or a related field.Experience in hospitality operations.Bilingual, English as the primary or secondary language.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Why CJ Pony Parts? We truly believe that where you work matters. CJ Pony Parts is one of the fastest growing aftermarket parts company in the automotive industry. Explosive growth through eCommerce has created great career opportunities for hard working, friendly, and reliable individuals that embody our Core Values: Teamwork, Respect, Customer Service, Integrity, and Innovation. We provide our team members with competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO, life insurance, short term disability, company-funded events and activities, and more.  Do you have what it takes? Apply now and find out! Who are we? Founded in 1985 by two friends and their passion for a cool, classic Mustang to drive, CJ Pony Parts is all about the love of the automotive restoration and performance hobby. Our ongoing mission: The improvement of the automotive communities' ability to enjoy their hobby is accomplished with an easy-to-use and function-rich website backed by some of the best professional automotive enthusiasts in the business that are working 24/7 to ensure the best quality and customer service!  CJ Pony Parts, Inc. has been named on the Inc. 5000 list for the last eight consecutive years and has been on the CPBJs Top 50 Fastest Growing Companies list. We are looking for hard working, friendly, and reliable people to work in a fast-paced environment. How to know if you are ready for this role: CJ Pony parts isnt just a job, it's a career. Expect to put in the necessary hours each week to get the job done and to tackle problems and find innovative solutions. If youre looking for a challenge and a career you can grow with, apply now! Basic Purpose: The Systems Analyst is responsible for maintaining, upgrading, developing, and ensuring operating functionality of all aspects of CJ Pony Parts business system, data, and application architecture. Responsibilities may include system design, reporting analysis and modifications (working in conjunction with the Senior Business Analyst), training users, researching new technologies, testing software, application administration, installation of appropriate upgrades, and patches for CJs Business System and additional systems. Essential Functions:Responsible for performing advanced technical analysis and support in areas including but not limited to: database reporting, database administration, systems administration, or related hardware/software needs.Work with Executive Team members and the Senior Business Analyst to identify and assist with automation to enhance user department experience and adoption of the system.Manage and maintain the companys business system, data infrastructure, and application architecture.Work alongside Senior Business Analyst to develop, maintain, upgrade, and adapt business system reports, data exports, data cross comparisons, and imports.Utilize Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Access, Crystal Reports, and Amazon AWS Data Platforms.Work with user departments to enhance training and usability of all applications, reports, data, and systems.Independently complete assigned short and long-term department projects.Handles all facets of support for the business, data, and application architecture.Manage support tickets/request and research resolutions, either internally or externally, with the business system vendor or Senior Business Analyst.Utilize department ticketing web tools to research, assign, troubleshoot, and resolve internal staff support concerns.Assign technical support tickets as necessary to the appropriate staff member based on the problem and subject matter.Handle general IT request and assists in other IT projects as needed.Formulate, interpret, implement, and enforce department policies and operating procedures.Develop department goals, strategies, and projects that directly affect general business operations.Oversee technical support on all existing business systems, data, software, and system functionality.Responsible for timely responses and corrections of business-critical systems, software, application, and outages in emergency situations.Research, analyze, test, and recommend system, software, and hardware enhancements for department progression for future company technology planning.Maintain the work area and equipment in a clean and orderly condition and follows prescribed safety regulations.All other duties as assigned.Job Specifications:Education: Bachlers degree or equivalent from a four-year college or technical school minimum.Experience: Five plus years related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Specific Skills: Experienced and proficient in: Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook, Crystal Reports (or comparable reporting tool) and Amazon AWS Data Platforms. Ability to consult with internal customers to understand their reporting needs. Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions. Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment when addressing technology-based emergency situations. Specialized Knowledge, Licenses, Etc.: None.CJ PONY PARTS IS AN EOE.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Position Description  Are you ready to level up your career? At Scientific Games, we are committed to making the best games, platforms and systems in the world. We are looking for smart, passionate and creative people to join our team and help us transform the gaming world. We are a global, industry-leading gaming technology company that embraces challenge, fosters an inclusive culture, values integrity, innovation and winning, and is committed to developing and supporting its people.  Whether you are a member of our award winning game studios, our industry leading systems group, product management, manufacturing group, services or any of our other amazing Gaming teams, you will be creating compelling games played around the world. We are dedicated to being the industry’s only COMPLETE global solutions provider with products that will enhance the entire gaming operation, both on the casino floor and behind the scenes.  If you are ready to play…Come join us and let’s make games! Job Summary: For the Supply Chain Anayst/Sr. in our Supply Chain Analytics team, we are looking for a motivated and detail oriented individual with program management and data systems experience to help drive development and implementation of our Supply Chain Analytics program. Key responsibilities include but not limited to the coordination of cross-functional teams members to meet program schedule and deliverables, prepare and deliver standardized reporting to the broader organization at all levels on a weekly basis. Typical projects will mostly require working directly work with Planning, Procurement, Sourcing, Production to define relevant performance reporting, predictive analytics reporting on shortages (STBL), Inventory projections & reporting, Transportation costs and other expenses effected by the planning team. The role also enables the candidate to influence and innovate up from current supply chain planning processes, and make the case to adopt the latest planning practices.  Position Requirements Essential Job Functions:Summarize and publish reports for measuring supply chain operational performanceEstablish a weekly or more frequent cadence to communicate the results in a scorecard format and drive results with the operational teams.Analyze and set system parameters to optimize inventory and meet service level goals and minimize costs.Assist with the maintenance of MRP master data for planning parts at various plants. Also responsible to initiate Engineering Change requests based on material life cycle.Run what-if simulations to optimize material/capacity constraints while minimizing impact to customer satisfaction.Work closely with internal partners such as commodity, platform planners and factory production teams to ensure sufficient capacity and materials to meet supply requirements.Communicate Short To Backlog (STBL) measurements and proactive shortage reportingAnalyze shortage data to identify main issues and key areas for improvementSupport Oracle project core team with migration and other projectsBroad range of supply chain data analysisQualifications: Education: Bachelor Degree in Supply Chain management, Engineering or Finance. Masters Degree preferred. Required Experience:2-5 years of relevant experience, preferably in Supply Chain management or Global ProcurementExperience with ERP systemsKnowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Undergraduate degree and 3+ years relevant experienceDemonstrated skillset in SQL, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI, or comparable tools and languages – or demonstrated proficiency/eagerness in learning new tools.Extensive and in-depth knowledge of planning, data analysis and data modelling.Analytical skills to resolve ad-hoc issues and adjust to the dynamic requirements of our customer and supplier base.High level of proficiency is required in spreadsheet and database analysis tools, specifically MS Excel & PowerPoint.Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.Must be a team player, have the ability to be flexible, be able to develop in the role and develop relationships across the business.Very detail oriented, able to identify anomalies and errors in data, and to capture trends to apply to planning model.Strong ability to move between tactical and strategic aspects of businessKnowledge of Oracle ASCP highly preferredHigh energy and a desire to work in a results-oriented, fast growth environmentIntellectual curiosity, passion for problem-solving and comfort with ambiguityAble to assess a variety of information, draw similarities and compile actionable recommendationsStrong interpersonal skillsPhysical Requirements: Office environment Work Conditions: May require weekend and evening hours. Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The Sr. Business Systems Analyst will act as a key contributor in MGM Resorts International’s Business Solutions organization through functional and technical requirements capture and design collaboration. Core responsibilities include capturing high-level customer functional and technical requirements, analyzing business processes, and supporting design / build / test execution of related Business Solutions demand. The Analyst collaborates with all technology disciplines, business, vendors, and customers to analyze, define, and develop requirements to ensure solutions are developed in support of the business. Act as liaison between end-users, application architects, project team members, and information technology cross-disciplines, business stakeholders etc., to ensure what is being deployed will successfully deliver on the business goalsLead workshops and discovery sessions to capture requirements, analyze and assess current state capabilities, and analyze business and IT processes by gathering input from a variety of sourcesMake recommendations for the business systems analyst standards, procedures, templates, and best practicesMentor and train members of the business system analyst teamTranslate captured requirements into detailed requirements documentation to ensure clear and complete requirements for solution delivery and testingDocument/Create “To Be Process” using various tools as appropriateUnderstand existing MGM Resorts applications by line of business and the interaction of applications individually and as they relate to other applications across lines of businessAct as an application subject matter expertArticulate how requirements map to and impact the application/sCollaborate with Application Architects, Business Solutions Executives, delivery leads, and end users to design appropriate solutionsCreate and maintain workflow diagrams, data flow definitions, functional design documentation, requirements/traceability deliverables, technical documentation, application documentation, and training documentationAssist in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, regression, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testingParticipate in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the testing output, POCs, Pilots, and other identified work products to ensure they fulfill the requirementsComplete cost benefit analysis, ROI, and other financial analyses for related business lines related to system upgrades, replacements, and changesCreate Business Case for related business lines to support system upgrades, replacements, and changesIdentify and support execution of process improvement opportunitiesPrioritize requirements and create conceptual design documentation of completed processAdhere to enterprise standards, guidelines, and methodologiesIdentify risks and issues and escalate as appropriateRequired:Bachelor’s degree in a related field, or equivalent education and experience.At least 4 years of experience as a Technical/Business/Business Systems Analyst or equivalent.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms.Preferred:CBAP Certified.At least 7 years of experience as a business analyst, architect, or developer.At least 5 years of experience in an IT delivery organization.At least 5 years of experience in a Hospitality, Gaming, or related field.Previous experience in hospitality or related industry.

Name: Finance Business Development Analyst
Description: If you love crunching the numbers and doing analysis, but you have a love of research and strategy- then we have the job for you!  It doesn’t hurt that we are one of the most fun, dynamic and exciting places to work in Las Vegas! We are looking for a detailed financial analyst. Our Business Development Analyst will be support retail business development efforts at casinos and airports nationwide by developing new store projection models based on industry data compilation and benchmarking analysis. We offer: Incredible Environment and Team!Health Insurance!Dental and Vision Insurance!FREE Life Insurance!Amazing Employee Discounts at all of our retail locations!401k with great match!Career Advancement!Business Casual AttireAnd so much more!Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, accounting, or a related field (MBA a plus)Minimum 5+ years of experience in financial and/or operational analysisRetail or multi-unit experience is strongly preferred (real estate development experience a plus)Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office especially Excel and WordStrong technical, analytical and problem solving skillsMust have a satisfactory Credit, Drug and Criminal Check Related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. Marshall Retail Group is America’s largest, independent specialty retailer in the casino-resort and airport marketplace. For 60 years, MRG has provided clients with a portfolio of attractive, successful brands that turn pedestrians into window shoppers, window shoppers into buyers, and buyers into loyal, repeat customers. The premiere retail development company currently operates more than 160 stores across the United States and Canada.  APPLY TODAY at http://marshallretailgroup.com/careers/ WE CANNOT WAIT TO MEET YOU!ADA/DFW/EOE Job Requirements

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Who we are and why you should join us Unique opportunity for a Technical Business Analysis in Las Vegas, NV. with interest in working with a Start-Up company that is leveraging AWS to build a revolutionary MMO mobile/web-based video game from the ground up. As part of the experience, you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies as key support member of a talented and experienced team.  With a suite of products, supported by offices and teams across the globe, United Power offers a culture that is both exciting and diverse. We provide a highly competitive pay structure, industry leading benefits, as well as the possibility of profit sharing in the future. In order to maintain our strong office culture, we do require that you live in or be willing to relocate to Las Vegas (full relocation package available). Job Summary This role gathers requirements, writes user stories, groom the stories and develops dashboards.  The Technical Business Analyst acts as a liaison between IT and the business to elicit, document, analyze and validate requirements for enhancement of existing systems. Analyzes business processes/problems to be solved with automated systems. Identifies gaps and provides expertise in business requirements for system specifications and scales new systems, processes and procedures in a cost-effective manner. Job ResponsibilitiesManage and deliver solutions for a backlog of user request.Create requirements documents such as wireframes, workflow diagrams, and functional specifications to clearly communicate the solution to the users.Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.Job Skills & QualificationsRequired:Minimum Bachelor's degree in IT (or related field) or equivalent business experience.Experience in an agile development environment and the tools that support Agile.3+ years experience with client relations activities in software environment, including discussions with client about issues, desired outcomes, and solutions.2+ years experience documenting requirements gathering sessions, processes, procedures, and outcomes.Ability to communicate technical and non-technical issues and requirements with technical staff.Engaging and enthusiastic personality with a strong desire to learn through both structured formal education and self-directed activities.Experience working on web-based projects that have progressed through the full Software Development Life Cycle processAdditional Information United Power's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. Applicants for U.S. based positions with United Power must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.

Name: Business Analyst/ Software Developer (Applications Analyst II)
Description: Bachelor’s degree in a computer related field and 2 years' progressive related experience, or equivalent training and experience.An object oriented programmer, preferably in C# ASP.NET, APEX, or JAVA.The candidate needs to understand the fundamental features and concepts associated with the Model-View-Controller architectural pattern.Knowledge of technical principles, theories, standards, practices and procedures in software development is a must.Knowledge of SQL Server and Oracle relational databases is a must.Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast-paced, changing environment.Must possess strong analytical skills, and good testing and debugging skills.Good communication and interpersonal skills.We are looking for a person who is a team player and has experience developing and supporting applications.Ability to establish and maintain strong and effective customer relations.Computer skills to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.  MSTS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. MSTS is a background screening, drug-free workplace. Candidate will write program code from internal specification documentation or outdated application code and prepare test plans, test data, runs tests, observes results and correct program code to resolve any differences from specifications.Candidate is expected to support existing in-house developed applications.Candidate is expected to also support existing in-house developed applications and commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) applications including support for users, translating business requirements into enhancements; configuring and testing changes; maintaining and monitoring system security and permissions; and coordinating activities with other team members, the application owner, and Information Technology.If you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place! At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We’re dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Join us!  MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

Name: Analyst
Description: Position Description  Develop and deploy supply chain initiatives that help drive improvements in supplier quality, delivery, and cost. Provide Supply Chain with analytical, technical, and financial expertise in support of overall operations. Individual will assist with managing enterprise-wide supply policies and procedures and will leverage third party tools and vendor resources to ensure expenditures are optimized. Individual will be responsible for leading Scientific Games (SG) required analysis and reporting requirements including but not limited to; Spend analysis, Supply Chain Dashboarding, Conflict Minerals analysis & reporting, Supplier Scorecards, 10K and SEC reporting requirements, Compliance reporting requirements, etc. This position will play a critical role in issue resolution, supplier management, goods/services receipt issues, and PO and Non-PO invoice processing support across both Oracle and MAPICS/IntelliChief. Additional duties may include: Assisting in the creation of supply strategies to optimize cross-divisional purchases;Take a leadership role in managing corporate-wide spend analysis;Assisting with corporate Supply Chain KPI metrics analysis;Performing analysis of SG expenditures to evaluate total cost of ownership.Maintaining a high level of interpersonal and communication skills to promote positive working relationships inside and outside of SG.Essential Job Functions:Manage third party vendor expenditures analysis and reporting.Collaborate across the enterprise to evaluate and optimize expenditures.Utilize Supply Chain system technologies to reduce the total cost of goods and services.Assist in the development of Supply Chain tools, optimization models, and data analytics to help drive the team's strategic directionLead business process re-engineering initiatives to increase productivity, quality and effectiveness of procurement.Assist with leading cross-functional teams executing strategic sourcing projects.Assist with supplier selection and negotiate contracts for key strategic initiatives.Direct the formation and maintenance of strategic alliances with key suppliers to create a highly automated and efficient supply chain system.Must be a key contributor to improve day-to-day interaction with vendors.Drive internal customers to identify and implement business process improvements.Conduct business dealings with the highest level of integrity and regard for legal issues.Assure internal controls are adequate and followed in order to protect SG assets.Ability to travel as necessary. Position Requirements Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in business, finance, computer Science or related field. Experience working with ERP systems (preferably Oracle) and related business data warehouses. MBA or advanced degree preferred.Required Experience:3-5 years of analytical experience using data to create and analyze reports.Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Excellent analytical, mathematical, computer skills.Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.Excellent planning and forecasting abilities.Excellent oral and written communications skills required.Strategic thinker, with sound knowledge of strategic purchasing methods.Proven negotiation skills.Demonstrated ability to implement creative solutions while working under pressure. Physical Requirements: Office environment  Work Conditions: May require weekend and evening hours  The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst - Loyalty & Rewards
Description: ABOUT LOYALTY & REWARDSLas Vegas has figured out something that the rest of the world hasn’t. It’s about what it takes to entice travelers to visit a destination. It’s about stimulating consumers’ emotions and imaginations. It’s about motivating behavior with aspirational experiences, not with discounts and deals. It’s about building loyalty one memory at a time. It’s about providing amazing value to the consumer, while doing the same for the business.  We’re a Las Vegas crew, so this is in our DNA. It’s what we do. Meanwhile, most companies are still stuck in a world of 2% cashback, punchcards and Groupon. It’s maddening, but we see this as an opportunity and we’re exploiting it.  We’re assembling a group of people who are passionate about bringing these ideas to the rest of the world, people who want to create a rewards program that actually rewards people with memorable moments, people who get the power of forging connections for consumers between great experiences and their favorite brands. We’re a startup within PLAYSTUDIOS, so it will be scrappy and fast-paced. There might be some long hours. It’ll be an uphill battle most of the way. But this could be huge.  If that’s you, contact us.  We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. We’ve recognized that we need to be masters of data. We need to be testing and iterating. We need the right answers at our fingertips. We also need to present the results to executives and to our strategic B2B partners. There’s only one problem - we don’t have a business intelligence function. Yet.  That’s where you come in.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESBe a business intelligence one-person departmentPut a bass drum on your back, cymbals on your feet, and a computer around your neck.The bad news: You’ll be asked to wear many hats. To multitask. To take on a potentially uneven workload.The good news: You’ll get to take the lead on designing and building the architecture, look and feel of our data and reporting.Loyalty & Rewards data ecosystemHelp drive the strategic direction and implementation of the data architecture and data warehouseEnsure the tools and systems are collecting, storing, and displaying back the right data based on the business needsEnsure the accuracy and completeness of the data - be the data quality champion for Loyalty & RewardsEnsure data consumers have access to the data and reporting they needOwn all of Loyalty & Rewards reporting and analysisCollect internal and external customers’ data and reporting needs and prioritize its throughputCreate presentations for and present to peers, Loyalty & Rewards executives, and Loyalty & Rewards B2B strategic partnersTranslate customer needs into useful, actionable data and analysesBe a data evangelist and liaison both internally and externallyAid product and business owners with best practices and strategic thinking around how to best analyze data, measure success, and frame testsPlay a strategic/data role in the customer survey programDesign and deploy automation & self-service tools into reporting processPREFERRED EXPERIENCEPrior start-up experiencePrior experience in business intelligence/data scienceUX, data visualization, data presentation skillsMust be part-artist, part-scientist, part-scholar, part-comedian, part-executiveFOUNDING PRINCIPLEPeople deserve great value for their loyalty, and reciprocal relationships with their favorite brands. Customer rewards needn’t be a zero-sum game. There’s almost always a way to find a win-win.BENEFITS AND PERKS100% Health Benefits coverage for you and your dependents!Employee-driven entertainment, game nights, and team-building events throughout the yearCatered lunches throughout the weekOpen, creative office spaceCasual startup-like environmentFlexible vacation policy A great place to work. Come by to find out for yourself!

Name: Business Systems Analyst 3
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements gathering and functional design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Partners with the business line to develop requirements. Works with the application development team to create functional designs. Participates in testing, training, and implementation of applications. Analyzes and evaluates user needs. Develops and maintains a complete and accurate understanding of how a business unit impacted by an assigned application conducts their business. Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective. Assists business lines in use of new and existing capabilities of a system. Works with internal business groups to document, analyze, and redesign business processes. Partners with business representatives to identify, refine, and document detailed business needs. Joins clients and technical staff to investigate, analyze, and resolve application problems related to system functions. May be point of contact for user support and problem-solving. Occasionally manages small projects. Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. Works with technology and application development teams to design functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs. Reviews, coordinates, and executes test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.**Qualifications:****Basic Qualifications**-Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience-At least 5 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications.**Required Skills/Experience**- 5 years SEI Trust3000 experience- 5 years SEI Trust3000 BIS experience- 5 years finance experience**Preferred Skills/Experience**Basic understanding in:-IT project management-Information managementWorking experience in:-IT environment-IT standards, procedures, policy-Business assessment-Business process modeling-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-System testing-System development life cycle-Workflow analysis-SQLExtensive experience in:-Problem Solving-Writing Skills-Communication Impact-Requirements analysis-Drive and Results Orientation-Listening-Teamwork and Collaboration-System Testing**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** United States**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180039485U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Financial Planning Analyst
