Name: Analyst – IT Risk (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The IT Risk Analyst assists in ensuring that MGM Resorts International’s Information Technology (IT) Risk Management Program provides effective risk management coverage to the Information Technology area to reduce risk, costs and losses to the company. This includes, but is not limited to, researching risk areas, analyzing potential risk, reporting risk levels, providing metrics, driving risk discussions, making decisions and recommendations relating to reducing risk overall in the Information Technology environment. All duties and responsibilities are to be performed in accordance with MGM Resorts International policies, practices and procedures. Maintain the application inventory and inventories of sensitive data locations up to and including mapping data ingress, egress points.Perform application vulnerability assessments and driving projects to reduce risk.Drive requirements gathering for data governance criteria, thresholds and reporting.Monitor and report data governance metrics and trends to data owners and executives.Co-ordinate and ensure data destruction efforts are implemented.Collaborate with project managers for incorporating data governance principles, standards and processes in project life cycles and all new business integration activities.Participate/support data audits, collaborating with IT, and initiate corrective actions to ensure data meets defined standards.Escalate data management and security risk, breaches, quality, performance, gaps and delivery issues / risks as required.Collaborate with IT and Business teams to ensure compliance with internal data controls.Manage Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules and thresholds with IT and Business Partners.Facilitates meetings and drives agendas.Conduct reviews of Data assets and controls as part of monitoring capability and leading to improvements in data management practices.Perform other job related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.At least three 3 years of experience in Information Technology.Previous experience in project management.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Experience or exposure in working with auditors.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Staffigo is seeking current students who anticipate graduating from college at the end of the 2017-2018 academic year, interested in careers in the Information Technology field. Staffigo is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career!  Our Entry-Level Business Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and could be doing a number of different tasks. Business Analyst (Entry level/Experienced) The Business Analyst will be responsible for a variety of IS and business project activities in order to implement approved system/application requests from various business groups.  The EDI Business Analyst will be responsible to partner with business and technical teams to gather and assist with completing requirements, coordinate test plans, participate in testing activities, provide necessary documentation and ensure that quality business processes are implemented on time. Job responsibilities:Conducting requirements gathering team meetings with business users and technical team and capture the requirements and use cases.Detailed documentation preparation for requirements, use cases, ERD, functional, non-functional requirements.Well versed with UML modelling.User Interface prototypes development.

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Name: Business Analyst, Treasury & Finance in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionPosition SummaryThe Business Analyst will act as a liaison between Treasury & Finance and stakeholders, the bPMO Department, and technical professionals to develop requirements or complete action items on internal or enterprise-wide projects. The position is not a project manager, but may act in that capacity when representing Treasury & Finance. Must be familiar with the project management life cycle (PMLC) and initiate projects sponsored by Treasury and Finance by following internal PMLC guidelines.Summary of Essential Job FunctionsRepresent Treasury & Finance on all projects sponsored by Treasury & Finance or for which Treasury & Finance is a stakeholder: Initiate project (cost analysis, ROI & impact studies).Develop and document project requirements.Provide recommendations during requirements gathering, acting as a subject matter expert (SME).Facilitate meetings between the business users and stakeholders.Write test scripts, perform user testing, and document and manage the results.Develop and manage project timelines and deliverables for Treasury & Finance.The candidate will be expected to act as a SME for certain critical functions within Treasury & Finance, identifying areas for process improvement.The candidate must have excellent communication skills and should be able to convey technical information to non-technical and technical professionals.Maintain progress reports on projects for IT and bPMO departments.Provide routine updates to the Treasury & Finance Officers (to include but not limited to project timelines and/or Gantt charts).Perform other duties as assigned. Have excellent communication and organizational skills and be proficient in all Microsoft Office products to include Excel and Word. Preference given to candidates with strong analytical skills or experience in the treasury & finance function.

Name: Information Technology Systems Analyst
Description: Navarro Research and Engineering, Inc. is recruiting for an Information Technology Systems Analyst in North Las Vegas, NV.  Navarro is a premier contractor providing high-quality technical services to DOE, NASA, and DOD. Navarro’s success is based on our customer service focus and our well-known responsiveness and innovation. In all we do, either in corporate management or in our services to our clients, we seek for the most effective and efficient approaches to deliver the best value to our clients.  We are recruiting for a systems person that can help in different areas and mainly the following, in priority: SQL Server administration, SQL programming, and data integration.System and application integration and support.Microsoft SharePoint, both client and server sides.Some programming to help support a legacy information system (Classic ASP, ASP.NET, Web Forms, HTML, XML, JavaScript, VB.Net, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), and PowerShell);Anything else such as network administration and cyber security is a definite plus. This position provides support to internal customers and external project participants for both custom developed and COTS applications and tools. Other major responsibilities are database management and administration, programming, and special system projects. This includes: Support and provide enhancements to the Environmental Management Information System (EMIS) and to the Radioactive Waste Acceptance Program (RWAP) system.Support Microsoft SharePoint Internal and External farms and websites.Maintenance and improvements to existing software solutions.Maintenance and improvements to web products.Detail work, research, coding, and documentation.Database administration and data Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) operations.Strong documentation skills.Provide functional/technical direction and planning.Lead IT tasks/projects from initiation to completion.Assist with server and network support as needed for special projects.Supporting and providing direction for improvements to all Navarro projects such as Underground Test Area (UGTA), RWAP, Project Controls, and EMIS, this is done in compliance with Department of Energy (DOE), National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA), and Navarro policies and procedures.Defining controls and tuning performance of the company’s database holdings.Ensuring that IT Associates have access to the tools and information to be effective.Maintain the confidentiality of entrusted information when supporting DOE/NNSA/Navarro and diligently use the privileges and permissions entrusted for that function.Perform as a Windows Active Directory Domain Administrator, data administrator, and source code control administrator.Rely on experience and discernment to plan and accomplish goals.Lead and direct the work of others with creativity and latitude.RequirementsA minimum of 8 years on-the-job experience in systems to include database administration, programming, and application support is a requirement.A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related Information Technology field, and/or related certifications is required.Performs a variety of complicated tasks.Under limited supervision has the ability to work with broad objectives, with latitude to figure out the best way to accomplish tasks.Experienced knowledge of computer systems, networks and specialty software.Experienced knowledge of databases, in particular SQL Server, to include Transact-SQL (T-SQL).Experienced knowledge in Microsoft SharePoint.Knowledge of computer programming languages and techniques, such as Classic ASP, ASP.NET, Web Forms, HTML, XML, JavaScript, VB.Net, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), and PowerShell.Knowledge of Internet Information Services (IIS), setting up web sites, application pools, virtual directories, web applications, permissions, and .NET Framework extensions.Skill and ability to perform critical strategic tasks and to interpret broad strategic requirements, and to develop and execute plans to satisfy them.Ability to have a major impact on interpersonal success and productivity, with extensive latitude for independent discernment.Ability to communicate effectively at the highest levels.Ability to contribute functional expertise to business proposal initiatives.Ability to lead a task or project.Ability to train and mentor junior staff.Level of language skills, mathematical skills, communication skills, reasoning ability and computer skills necessary to perform essential functions of the job.Overtime may be required to complete work you're doing.Due to the nature of the government contract requirements and/or clearances requirements, US citizenship is required. Navarro is an equal-opportunity employer. Name: Associate Reporting Analyst
Description: We'll put you in the driver's seat on vital projects that have strategic importance to our mission of helping people lead healthier lives. Yes, we share a mission that inspires. We need your organizational talents and business discipline to help fuel ours. It's the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)Positions in this function include those responsible for running daily and weekly data integrity reports. Perform quality checks to proactively and retrospectively identify case errors related to adherence with compliance standards. Assist in design / development of new operational reports. Assist in maintenance/revisions of existing operational reports. Provide operational analysis utilized for decision making. May make recommendations based on the analysis, and provide explanations for reporting results as needed. Share findings with leadership for process improvement. Primary Responsibilities: Conducting research on causes of compliance related case errors  Accessing Reporting Portal to retrieve information to identify potential / actual errors  Accessing Administrative Tool to identify Web Based Case submission delays / errors  Performing analysis of authorization / referral based data on requests submitted through Sharepoint from leadership team  Assisting with creating and running queries to retrieve appropriate data sets  Knowledge of the full referral/authorization lifecycle from submission, error resolution, through final determination / output  Presentation of findings through ad hoc and standardized reports as requested by internal teams and clients

Name: IT Systems Analyst II
Description: Positions in this function create and deliver high quality system solutions for our applications, products and services across all technology functions. They consult with users and technology specialists to define business processes and the information systems for supporting those processes. Individuals in these roles may perform analysis and also serve as business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. They provide technical support in developing systems that are cost effective and meet users requirements.  This function works to create systems that work together in a cohesive manner, enforcing standards and methods consistently across the enterprise. Roles may support both current system improvements and maintenance along with new system development. Primary Responsibilities: Solid organizational skills and focus on accuracy and attention to detail.  Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities  Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment  Providing accurate and timely estimates for tasks  Provide support and leadership in critical production support issue resolution  Support the team for application availability, reliability and stability on a 7 by 24 by 365 basis  Conduct or facilitate root cause analysis on all in-scope incidents and recommend a corrective action plan  Work with team to achieve timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreements  Work with business to prioritize production issue resolution.  Work with business segments to better define project requirements for development and implementation  Assesses and interprets customer needs and requirements  Translate requirements into technical specifications  Work with external vendors to troubleshoot and resolve complex software issues.

Name: Club Operations System Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The Club Operations System Analyst is directly responsible for the test and debug portion of pending development including necessary documentation, and displays a high level of proficiency in ATLAS/Clarity. Additionally, this position is responsible for the testing and debug portion of pending development or modifications to the I3 Contact Center Platform. Provides assistance in the development of business requirements for for restructuring, modifying, or enhancing Company systems. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSDevelops, maintains, and distributes test plan for user acceptance testing of functional specifications designed for the Call Center.Communicates with application development via Footprints.Communicates with third party vendor via email or phone.Attends weekly meetings to update business unit as well as application development to the status of assigned responsibilities.Develops and/or edits functional specifications for review by Club Operations management.Provides first-tier troubleshooting support for issues reported by vendor or other users with Company systems.Completes all required Company trainings and compliance courses as assigned.Adheres to Company standards and maintains compliance with all policies and procedures.Performs other related duties as assigned.EDUCATIONHigh School Diploma or equivalent.EXPERIENCEA minimum one (1) year of experience in the travel, vacation ownership, financial servicing or other related field required.No supervisory experience required.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES Provides immediate supervision to direct reports. Oversees and controls the work performance of others in a close working relationship, often in the same room or close proximity. A portion of the time may be spent performing individual tasks similar to those performed by direct reports. May participate in the interview, selection and training processes, as assigned. May be responsible for assigning work to direct reports, reviewing results in accordance to policies and procedures, and providing recommendations to management. Name: Business Analyst - Information Technology (IT)
Description: Located in Las Vegas, the business analyst is responsible for analyzing and modeling existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. A thorough understanding of the current state of the organization is necessary prior to recommending changes related to implementing a new business solution.  The business analyst uses modeling tools to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state. The business analyst is responsible for the knowledge transfer of business implications to the application/database developers and project managers. RESPONSIBILITIES The business analyst works closely with the business and is a major contributor to the requirements specification deliverable, writes the business and functional requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.  This person understands the business and ensures that there is synergy between the business and IT. Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The business analyst understands development processes SDLC and is very analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues. Creates detailed Business Requirement Document (BRD) and translate it into functional specifications.Provides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formatsConstruct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specificationsImprove systems by studying current practices; designing modificationsRecommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved proceduresDefine project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budgetMonitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actionsMaintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidentialPrepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trendsContribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as neededValidate resource requirements and develop cost estimate modelsConduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client groupInterpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-makingPerform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reportsCreate informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvementConduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issuesQUALIFICATIONSAbility to impact operations and effect change without being confrontationalDetail oriented, analytical and inquisitiveAbility to work independently and with othersExtremely organized with strong time-management skillsSoftware DesignAnalysisTeamworkSoftware MaintenanceProcess ImprovementBig Picture ThinkingWork Well Under PressureCommunicationProblem SolvingCritical ThinkingRelationship BuildingBachelors degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or technical training equivalentBachelors Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience3+ years of experience working as a Functional, Data or Business Analyst3+ years of experience in Access, Excel(Advanced), Visio, and MS Project3+ years of customer interfacing experience project oversight, customer presentation.3+ years SQL Server 2005/2008 knowledge T-SQL, Tables, ViewsExcellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Name: Transportation Analyst
Description: The Position  Adhere to all procurement policies and procedures and ensure compliance. Implement value delivery strategies and plans consistent with overall department and corporate strategic direction in all day-to-day activities. Responsible for maintaining and ensuring that Procurement is in compliance with ISO9001 std/13485; FDA Regulations/QSRs; Corporate Requirements and any other corporate Quality and SH&E directives.  Processes approved purchase requisitions and places purchase orders for supplies, equipment and services within authorized signature limits.  Working under general supervision and guidance, assists in the development and qualification of sources to support the ongoing purchase of supplies, equipment and services at the most cost effective level while monitoring and ensuring that supplier quality, service and performance remains consistently high. Conducts new sourcing, bidding and negotiations to meet business area requirements while supporting continuous improvement in terms of Quality, Service and Total Cost of Ownership  Works within assigned center of excellence (CoE) to identify and select suppliers based on their ability to comply with all corporate specifications and requirements.  In conjunction with internal partners, implement defined metrics that measure performance and reinforce/advance the effectiveness of the procurement organization and the working relationship with the business areas.  Support the identification of supply and quality problems proactively and assist in the development of corrective actions to the benefit of Procurement's internal partners.  Provide support to ensure all established guidelines, policy and governance across Diagnostics are adhered to.  Support Regional Procurement Projects within North America Region as assigned. Collaborate with regional Procurement colleagues for mutual achievement of projects that deliver additional value to each Regional site. Job-related Experience: Typically requires 1 - 6 years of relevant strategic sourcing experience to include: purchasing, negotiating contracts, contract management, supplier development and supplier qualification/certification, required.  Demonstrated team member/participation skills, preferred. Other Qualifications: Strong communication skills (oral & written) with the ability to present supply concepts at the business level.  Ability to manage conflict and encourage collaboration.  Project management skills.  Commodity and supplier knowledge in the specific required area.  Knowledge of general contract law, UCC/EU, risk assessment and market pricing.  Demonstrated experience in MS Office applications, SAP, Ariba and other project management and financial applications.

Name: SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description: JOB SUMMARY & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:  • Responsible for the ITIL processes and procedures for Incident and Problem Management, Knowledge Management, Caesars Service Desk, and Business Critical Operations areas in Information Technology. This includes but is not limited to the following:  • Assist in Creating, updating and enforcing the Incident and Problem Management processes enterprise-wide  • Support the Caesars Service Desk and Business Critical Operations teams  • Drive continuous improvements within processes and IT teams  • Participate in any new projects or products for Service Management  • Lead various vendor initiatives, including contract and price negotiations  • Monitor Critical incidents and assist in driving to resolution • Report on enterprise-wide metrics and SLAs  • Assist with analysis of enterprise-wide metrics and meeting or exceeding SLAs.  • Prepares reports directed to management and to the IT organization  • Identify gaps in metrics to drive improvements  • Manage weekly Service Management oriented meetings to review metrics - P1 incidents and changes, root cause analysis, process • Drive the Incident, Problem, and Knowledge Management Processes  • Drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the incident management process  • Create and share Enterprise IT reports  • Monitor the effectiveness of Incident, Problem, and Knowledge processes and make recommendations for improvement  • Drive, develop, and maintain the major incident process and associated procedures  • Review and audit the process  • Ensure that all IT teams follow the incident management process for every incident • Vendor Engagement  • Assist in driving the External Service Desk  • Assist in Implementing Service Desk Quality control  • Assist Service Desk in First Call Resolution initiatives  • Manage relationship between Service Desk and enterprise IT teams.  • Identify and implement continual process improvements • SME for enterprise IT ticketing system  • Ability to train individuals & answer questions regarding the system  • Heightened Reporting Skillset  • Heightened Analytical/problem analysis  • Heightened excel experience  • Ability to customize reports ad hoc for enterprise IT & business users  • Misc. other responsibilities:  • Participate in a 24X7 on-call rotation  • Participate in various Development and Support Projects  • 1-2 Years job experience, preferred  • Past job experience in support of I.T. Casino systems recommended  • Previous experience with Remedy, ServiceNow, or equivalent ITSM tools.  • Strong ability to partner with internal teams to review and understand work processes and organize cross functional staff to ensure project completion.  • Strong ability to develop a clear point of view supported by data and analysis and good ability to sell idea to others.  • Strong ability to develop and foster high energy and highly motivated teams.  • Superior communications skills, both verbal and written in order to develop procedures, policies, plans and to conduct effective presentations to a wide variety of audiences.  • Prefer at least 1 year in leading team members and providing technical information to team members in a supportive, non-demeaning manner  • Ability to maximize system to support business processes, recommend and influence business process change to maximize use of system.  • Experienced working in a global IT organization with cross-cultural and geographically distributed teams.  • Process Implementation and Improvements  EDUCATION:  • College training equivalent to Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical training  • ITIL Foundations Certification preferred

Name: Banking Credit Analyst
Description: Assists lending department by completing financial statement and tax return spreads and/or cash flow analyses. Assists loan officers in gathering data from customers, internal and outside sources; prepares spreadsheets and analyzes financial information including financial statements and tax returns; contacts customers for additional information and clarification of data. Assists loan officers in gathering up-to-date financial statements for consumer/commercial accounts; ensures credit inquiries and UCC filings are researched to determine credit worthiness and appropriate collateral positioning are achieved. Compiles data from credit bureaus, conducts industry peer comparisons, and performs cash flow analyses and other such tasks and comparisons. Assists loan officers in performing pre-qualification assessment and analysis of financial condition and risk of financing requests within framework of Bank credit culture and current economic and industry trends. Assist loan officers in the review and renewal of credit facilities; provides back-up support. Assists with scanning of loan files and loan related data. Checks pledged assets as requested by loan officers. Assists with on-going computerization of the loan review function. Assists loan officers in verification of funds with mortgage companies and contractors. Develops knowledge of financial industry, economy, market conditions, rates, vendors and competition. May represent the Bank in various community, civic, and community reinvestment functions to further enhance the Bank?s image and develop additional business. Reinforces the application of superior customer service through his or her own example along with appropriate follow through with involved customers and employees. Assists in providing deposit and loan account ratings for loan officers. Answers telephones, questions and directs callers to proper Bank personnel. Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; Inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions. Demonstrates knowledge of and adherence to EEO policy; shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; educates others on the value of diversity; promotes working environment free of harassment of any type; builds a diverse workforce and supports affirmative action. Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports the Bank?s goals and values; benefits the bank through outside activities. Performs the position safely, without endangering the health or safety to themselves or others and will be expected to report potentially unsafe conditions. The employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations and orders issued pursuant to the OSHA Act of 1970, which are applicable to one?s own actions and conduct. Name: Finance Budget Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJT3 provides engineering and technical support to four of the western test ranges for the U.S. Air force and Navy under the joint range technical Services Contract, better known as J-Tech. We are a Joint venture of Raytheon and AECOM and is supported by nine teammate companies. We prepare our Nations war – fighting aircraft, and weapons systems, and aircrews for today’s missions and tomorrow-global challenges. JT3 is hiring a Financial Budget Analyst in Las Vegas Nevada! If you are detail oriented, willing to work in a fast-paced environment with competing deadlines, and like a challenge we would like to speak to you! Please apply! Primary Responsibilities:Prepares and analyzes specific accounting statements and reports to assist in the preparation of financial statements, tax reports, and other internal and external reports as requiredConducts special accounting studiesPerforms setup and maintenance of files within the existing financial software as well as assists in the testing of financial upgradesVerifies the proper distribution of charges to specific accounts and contracts.Prepares monthly and yearly journal entriesInterfaces, as needed, with government, corporate, and private auditorsPrepares monthly, quarterly, and annual payroll, vendor, or expense reports.Applies learned knowledge of practices and procedures to deal with issues or research problems that require further definition before resolutionMaintains the financial accounts, books, and reports in a current acceptable condition. Reviews and audits these records, which include, but are not limited to: general ledger and supporting journals of original entry maintained for contract activities and reports; banks and banking records; company and contract financial reports; and journal vouchersMonitors posting and maintenance of financial books and records and assures all supporting documents are adequate and properly filed; performs continuous audits of financial accounts to maintain account integrityMonitors operating cash requirements; reviews reconciliation of all bank accountsPerforms all other position-related duties as assigned or requestedBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Finance, Accounting, or Economics3 Years of job related Finance, Accounting, or Economics work experienceProficient in computer skills including; MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS OutlookStrong verbal and written communication skillsMust qualify for and maintain a government security clearance and possess a current State issued driver’s licensePreferred Qualifications:Experience in reconciling complex payroll, tax and benefit scenarios in a fast paced deadline driven environmentKnowledge of Critical variance analysis skillsKnowledge of and experience with budgeting, accounting and financial reportingAbility to work independently with a high degree of accuracyGovernment experience Company DescriptionJT3 is dedicated to being the nation's premier provider of joint test, tactics, and training support, to four of the western test ranges for the U.S. Air Force and Navy. We have a joint venture with Raytheon and AECOM.  If you have experience as a Java Software Engineer who would like to help develop systems to prepare our nation’s war fighting aircraft, weapons systems for today’s missions.

Name: Business Systems Analyst 3
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements gathering and functional design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Partners with the business line to develop requirements. Works with the application development team to create functional designs. Participates in testing, training, and implementation of applications. Analyzes and evaluates user needs. Develops and maintains a complete and accurate understanding of how a business unit impacted by an assigned application conducts their business. Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective. Assists business lines in use of new and existing capabilities of a system. Works with internal business groups to document, analyze, and redesign business processes. Partners with business representatives to identify, refine, and document detailed business needs. Joins clients and technical staff to investigate, analyze, and resolve application problems related to system functions. May be point of contact for user support and problem-solving. Occasionally manages small projects. Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. Works with technology and application development teams to design functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs. Reviews, coordinates, and executes test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.**Qualifications:****Basic Qualifications**-Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience-At least 5 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications.**Required Skills/Experience**- 5 years SEI Trust3000 experience- 5 years SEI Trust3000 BIS experience- 5 years finance experience**Preferred Skills/Experience**Basic understanding in:-IT project management-Information managementWorking experience in:-IT environment-IT standards, procedures, policy-Business assessment-Business process modeling-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-System testing-System development life cycle-Workflow analysis-SQLExtensive experience in:-Problem Solving-Writing Skills-Communication Impact-Requirements analysis-Drive and Results Orientation-Listening-Teamwork and Collaboration-System Testing**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** United States**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180039485U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Name: Management Analyst 4
Description: The Position  Management Analysts conduct a variety of studies, research and analysis of management and administrative areas such as budgeting and financial analysis; departmental operations; legislative analysis; management research; and statistical and informational analysis.  Incumbents function as managers who train, supervise and evaluate the performance of subordinate supervisors; develop policies and procedures; and allocate staff and resources to accomplish goals and objectives.  This position is with the Department of Business & Industry, Housing Division in Las Vegas. The incumbent will work with our Division Administrator and Deputies to support the development of legislative drafts and provide for internal audit support. This position has the primary oversight and management of the Division's programmatic dashboard and will provide for divisional metrics and reporting to evaluate various programs and look for areas to assist in the proper distribution of these resources. This position will provide the Division with complex technical analysis on current Divisional processes and procedures to ensure compliance with Federal, State and Local guidelines. The incumbent will assist and work with our Grants and Projects team on the awards and contracting processes as the division reviews and looks to improve its policies and procedures relating to the Qualified Allocation Plan, Emergency Solutions Grant, HOME Program, and Low-Income Housing Trust Fund program. Additionally, the MA 4 will work with our teams to provide recommendations on our extensive programs and help us to leverage our websites, social media sources and other forms of outreach that we are currently utilizing. This would include the evaluation of views, reach and demographics for social media engagement regarding home ownership programs and our online apartment search function. In addition, helping to expand the reach of our Affordable Housing Advocate through these channels along with Weatherization assistance and Lot Rent Subsidy awareness.This position requires the incumbent to pass a criminal background check and travel up to 25%. * THIS RECRUITMENT MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF APPLICATIONS RECEIVED. QUALIFIED APPLICANTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. *  To see full Class Specifications visit: http://hr.nv.gov/Resources/ClassSpecs/Class_Specifications-7_0/ To Qualify: In order to be qualified, you must meet the following requirements:  Education and Experience (Minimum Qualifications) Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in public or business administration, finance, social sciences, mathematics or related field and four years of professional experience in the research, development, evaluation or revision of programs, organizations, methods or procedures; OR one year of experience as a Management Analyst III in Nevada State service; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience on a year-for-year basis. Special Notes The ability to travel at least 25% of the time is required. Special Requirements A State of Nevada/FBI background check will be required of the selected applicant.

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Position Description  Develop and deploy supply chain initiatives that help drive improvements in supplier quality, delivery, and cost. Provide Supply Chain with analytical, technical, and financial expertise in support of overall operations. Individual will assist with managing enterprise-wide supply policies and procedures and will leverage third party tools and vendor resources to ensure expenditures are optimized. Individual will be responsible for leading Scientific Games (SG) required analysis and reporting requirements including but not limited to; Spend analysis, Supply Chain Dashboarding, Conflict Minerals analysis & reporting, Supplier Scorecards, 10K and SEC reporting requirements, Compliance reporting requirements, etc. This position will play a critical role in issue resolution, supplier management, goods/services receipt issues, and PO and Non-PO invoice processing support across both Oracle and MAPICS/IntelliChief. Additional duties may include: •Assisting in the creation of supply strategies to optimize cross-divisional purchases; •Take a leadership role in managing corporate-wide spend analysis; •Assisting with corporate Supply Chain KPI metrics analysis; •Performing analysis of SG expenditures to evaluate total cost of ownership. •Maintaining a high level of interpersonal and communication skills to promote positive working relationships inside and outside of SG. Essential Job Functions: •Manage third party vendor expenditures analysis and reporting. •Collaborate across the enterprise to evaluate and optimize expenditures. •Utilize Supply Chain system technologies to reduce the total cost of goods and services. •Assist in the development of Supply Chain tools, optimization models, and data analytics to help drive the team’s strategic direction•Lead business process re-engineering initiatives to increase productivity, quality and effectiveness of procurement.•Assist with leading cross-functional teams executing strategic sourcing projects.•Assist with supplier selection and negotiate contracts for key strategic initiatives.•Direct the formation and maintenance of strategic alliances with key suppliers to create a highly automated and efficient supply chain system.•Must be a key contributor to improve day-to-day interaction with vendors.•Drive internal customers to identify and implement business process improvements. •Conduct business dealings with the highest level of integrity and regard for legal issues.•Assure internal controls are adequate and followed in order to protect SG assets.•Ability to travel as necessary.  Position Requirements Qualifications:•Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, computer Science or related field. Experience working with ERP systems (preferably Oracle) and related business data warehouses. MBA or advanced degree preferred. Required Experience: •3-5 years of analytical experience using data to create and analyze reports.Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:•Excellent analytical, mathematical, computer skills.•Strong organizational and interpersonal skills. •Excellent planning and forecasting abilities. •Excellent oral and written communications skills required. •Strategic thinker, with sound knowledge of strategic purchasing methods.•Proven negotiation skills.•Demonstrated ability to implement creative solutions while working under pressure. Physical Requirements: Office environmentWork Conditions: May require weekend and evening hours The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, “SG”) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. As a prerequisite to employment with SG (to the extent permitted by law), you shall be asked to consent to SG conducting a due diligence/background investigation on you. This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The employee in this position may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities than those stated above. SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Name: Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium
Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.  Position Title:  Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium  Location:  Remote, US Wide  Core Responsibilities:  Serve as Senior Electronic Health Record (EHR) subject matter expert for the provision of any combination of two or more Cerner Millennium Clinical Solutions (SurgiNet; SurgiNet ANES; CareNet or PharmNet). Scope of duties include all aspects of implementing and subsequent operational support of Cerner Millennium.  Responsible for working collaboratively with all Atos Cerner Millennium Solution Teams Consultants for the delivery of migration services at the client engagement level.  Minimum Qualifications: Assigned to and works with the Cerner Millennium EHR migration team (domestic and global) to articulate business requirements related to client projects and operational support.Is fully compliant in the use of Atos’ “end-to-end” and “Best Practices” documented framework for EHR migration initiatives, abides by all defined processes, activities and goals to maintain the repeatability, leveragability and reference-ability for EHR related services.Identify opportunities, performance measurement methodologies and reporting tools necessary to improve business processes resulting in improved efficiencies and/or quality in healthcare and delivery of services to our clients.Act as a liaison between client operations, client informati, and Anthelio EHR practice service teams to ensure systems meet the functional specifications as defined by operations.Acts as a liaison between client(s) and vendor(s) related to system functionality specificationsSupports and/or leads EHR departmental and interoperability business process optimization activities as assigned for client sites.Maintains current knowledge of applicable federal and state EMR/EHR related laws and accreditation standards; monitors and communicates changes to ensure customer adaptation and compliance.Documents and maintains a knowledge base of Cerner Millennium products implemented at client sites. Mentors junior team members on product functionality, package validation as well as application solution build activities etc.Consistently demonstrates skills with thorough documentation in customer issue cases.Participates in Domain validation; package testing ; application break/fix resolution ; design change build/testing as approved by customer and other application support related activities as assigned.Serves as a Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet Anesthesia Subject Matter Expert in the delivery of services including but not limited to:Consults with client on workflow design; functional specifications, design, build and test changes to workflow logic in response to requested changes; provides education for build and maintenance of master tables from the EHR databaseDevelops and/or updates test scripts for all system implementations, changes and upgrades.Participates in system functional and integrated testing as assigned.Participates in change control process meetings and if fully compliant with Atos Change Management processes.Develops internal WIKI support articles/troubleshooting tipsheets for Cerner Millennium Solution analysts and Atos’ Healthcare National Service Desk.Provides knowledge transition to client staff and/or Cerner Millennium Solution teams and other sub-practice service teams to perform daily, weekly and monthly system maintenance and monitoring to ensure the good health of the systems (if applicable).Works collaboratively with all Atos Service Delivery teams to achieve high customer satisfaction levels for services delivered. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent healthcare and/or technical certification/licensing required. Registered Nurse highly desired.3-5 years of practical experience in the Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet ANES or Supply Chain Management required.3+ years experience in EHR system related implementations and/or application support in a healthcare environment required, hospital experience preferred. Skills & Requirements:Analytical ability to identify, analyze and evaluate market changes, create solutions to difficult administrative, technical or human situations.Effective written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills for contact with internal and external customers and peers to obtain and interpret a variety of information based on knowledge of departmental practices, hospital policies and programs and specific technical and regulatory knowledge.Must possess the ability to learn new things in a variety of ways (i.e., self learning and/or virtual classroom setting) and think innovatively for solutions to business and technical problems related to patient care/record process flow.Ability to participate on multiple projects simultaneously and remotely.Superior organizational skills.Intermediate to expert level skill in use of standard Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to travel as required by client engagement and as otherwise defined by the Atos’ Digital Healthcare Solutions Leadership team. Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: **Req No.** 17663BR**Job Posting Title** Sales Operations Analyst**Location** NV - Las Vegas**Shift** Day**Employment Status** Full Time**Description** As member of the Sales Operations team, the primary focus of the position is to provide opportunity management, sales analysis and reporting in support of the sales division. This position will work with Sales to manage the sales opportunity pipeline, create metrics, analyze sales, opportunity and order data to develop sales/demand forecasts and support our annual census. In addition, this position will develop management reporting and dashboards, help drive business process improvements and support the development of automated tools and applications to increase efficiency and accuracy of analyses and reporting. Analysis will include market share, product mix, funnel coverage, opportunity sales cycle, customer buying trends and sales trends. The position will also interact with key departments in support of the sales forecast including finance, operations, order management and product management.**First Year Goals**? Collaborate with Sales Operations and key contacts to understand the products, markets, and customers? Work with Sales to manage opportunity pipeline and develop sales forecasts? Provide analysis and management reports to support weekly Sales reporting cadence and census? Demonstrate knowledge of Salesforce.com, SAP, Tableau and associated reporting tools.?Drive development of key management dashboards**Required Qualifications**? Bachelor's degree required or equivalent experience in an analyst role? 3+ years of experience as an analyst preferably with a considerable sales focus? Advanced knowledge of Excel, data management and report development preferably using SAP, Salesforce.com and Tableau? Strong analytical skills? Data accuracy, attention to detail, and ability to present data in a professional manner? Highly motivated and able to work independently and manage priorities effectively**Special requirements needed** Security Investigation**Keys To Success**? Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity.? Build collaborative relationships both internally and externally? Decision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve.? Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles.? Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneself? Foster innovationPosting Code: ~cb~ #LI-KK1

Name: Fraud Risk Analyst II in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary Work with the fraud risk team and internal business partners to develop, implement, and evaluate fraud risk management strategies that reduce fraud losses, improve profit, increase efficiency, and improve the customer experience. Summary of Essential Job Functions • Perform tracking, reporting, and prepare presentations on key performance indicators. Analyze data for trends and recommend strategies to reduce fraud loss.Develop, implement, and evaluate fraud risk strategies.Manage projects under tight deadlines.Ad hoc analyses.Partner and collaborate with Operations, Compliance, and IT teams.Take initiative to improve reporting process and assist team.Be responsible for scorecard validations and tracking.Balance priorities to meet multiple deadlines. Job RequirementsPosition Requirements • Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business, Finance, Economies, Statistics or other quantitative area. Prefer 3-4 years of experience in fraud, credit or operational risk management or similar lending environment.Knowledge of fraud or credit risk analysis, and understanding of profitability drivers, financial analysis and credit reporting.Strong analytical skills advanced PC skills, the ability to think critically, as well as excellent communication and relationship-building skills. Modeling or CART analysis experience preferred.Proficiency in SAS, SAS EMiner and SQL or a similar programming language is required.Ability to transform big data into recommended actions to prevent fraud loss.Statistical modeling exposure including logistic regression, CHAID/CART analysis, and other general linear models. • Project management experience a plus. Experience in identifying and preventing transaction and payment fraud and/or experience in developing and/or using fraud risk models, algorithms or scorecards a plus. Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. However, the employee may choose to stand and move within cubicle area. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, feel, talk and hear; reach with hands and arms. Must possess the ability to effectively hear and communicate. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 2 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.  Based on the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), management has analyzed this position and determined it to be exempt.

Name: Business Analyst/ Software Developer (Applications Analyst II)
Description: Bachelor’s degree in a computer related field and 2 years' progressive related experience, or equivalent training and experience.An object oriented programmer, preferably in C# ASP.NET, APEX, or JAVA.The candidate needs to understand the fundamental features and concepts associated with the Model-View-Controller architectural pattern.Knowledge of technical principles, theories, standards, practices and procedures in software development is a must.Knowledge of SQL Server and Oracle relational databases is a must.Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast-paced, changing environment.Must possess strong analytical skills, and good testing and debugging skills.Good communication and interpersonal skills.We are looking for a person who is a team player and has experience developing and supporting applications.Ability to establish and maintain strong and effective customer relations.Computer skills to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.  MSTS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. MSTS is a background screening, drug-free workplace. Candidate will write program code from internal specification documentation or outdated application code and prepare test plans, test data, runs tests, observes results and correct program code to resolve any differences from specifications.Candidate is expected to support existing in-house developed applications.Candidate is expected to also support existing in-house developed applications and commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) applications including support for users, translating business requirements into enhancements; configuring and testing changes; maintaining and monitoring system security and permissions; and coordinating activities with other team members, the application owner, and Information Technology.If you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place! At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We’re dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Join us!  MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

Name: Analyst, Material Planning
Description: What are some of the daily duties of a Material Planning Analyst?Responsible for determining the weekly inventory replenishment plans using analytical models.Coordinate with maintenance planning, engineering, and material control departments to ensure successful execution of all special programs as well as the day-to-day replenishment.Develop new models and perform case studies as required. These models could range from inventory optimization, logistics, aircraft movement patterns, or part failure prediction.Maintain existing models that determine the appropriate stock levels and distribution of the company’s aircraft related rotable and expendable parts inventories. Recommend changes whenever there are significant changes in the inputs such as an increase or decrease in the number of aircraft, individual aircraft flight patterns, a desired revision of confidence factors, changes in mechanical reliability, etc.Work closely with the Purchasing and Component Repairs groups within the Materials Department to assist in their planning efforts and understanding all of the associated operational risks.Perform regular analysis which includes, at a minimum, the entire universe of applicable primary and alternate parts (the parts tree), associated aircraft effectivity, aircraft movement patterns, and locations, quantity on hand, prior usage, industry average failure rates, turn times and desired confidence factors.Maintain a master parts tree. Interface inter-departmentally and with maintenance technical services, as necessary, to assure completeness, as well as currency in Allegiant’s ERP system and Aircraft Parts Catalogs. Investigate and initiate changes, as necessary.Analyze and resolve aircraft parts-related issues as they arisePerform other duties, as assignedWhat are the minimum requirements to be a Material Planning Analyst?Education requirements– Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree preferred. Operations Research, Engineering, Logistics, or Supply Chain degrees and/or emphasis will be strongly considered.Work Experience–Advanced level of proficiency using Excel or programming language. Experience and/or certifications in the following are desirable: Process optimization, Programming or database management, Business or Supply Chain Management, Six-Sigma Lean, and Project Management.No visa sponsorship is available for this position.What other skills, knowledge, and qualifications are needed to be a Material Planning Analyst?Must have ability to read, write, and speak EnglishStrong intellect and aptitude desiredAbility to manage multiple and varied activitiesGood leadership and people management skillsEffective communication skillsAbility to prioritize and effectively problem solveA high level of creativity and mathematical aptitude is essentialMust pass a background check and pre-employment drug screenMust have authorization to work in the U.S. as defined in the Immigrations Act of 1986What are the physical requirements of a Material Planning Analyst (if applicable)Office environment. Some travel required. Allegiant Travel Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, creed, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, marital status, military service status, protected veterans, union/non-union activity, citizenship status, or other characteristic protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. Name: Senior Analyst – Advanced Analytics (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics will work with internal Enterprise Analytics departments and other MGM Resorts departments on projects that leverage advanced analytics to drive business performance. By combining advanced analytics capabilities with programming skills, the data scientists will help drive innovative analytical solutions across MGM Resorts.  All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts policies, practices and procedures. Leverages various statistical techniques to identify patterns within large data sets; to promptly make predictions and business-oriented suggestions; utilizes predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, targeting, and other business outcomes  Collaborates with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes; create data visualization and audience appropriate documentation of findings and approachInvestigates and analyzes structured, unstructured data, and streaming data to solve simple to mid-complexity business problemsPerforms processing, cleansing, preprocessing and verifying the integrity of imperfect data used for analysis; able to identify various data structures and standardize methods in data transformationsActively participates in internal peer review process to validate assumptions and technical approachSimplifies and communicates key findings and insights to non-technical audiencesCommunicates and reviews findings with business partners making recommendations from analytic insightsPartners with Business Intelligence team to productionalize and build appropriate change control and monitoring processes for analytical product and/or application programming interfacesIdentifies existing models needing to be recalibrated or retrainedCollaborates with Enterprise Analytics, Business Intelligence and Enterprise Data Management teams to establish and prioritize data collection needs and consumption methodsCollaborates with HR and facilitates learning and skills development opportunities across EA teamOther job-related duties as requestedRequired:Bachelors degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, operations research or other related technical field.At least 3 years of experience in similar advanced analytics role in a professional environment, or possess advanced degree with practical internship.Proven experience as Data Analyst in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting, predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and/or optimization algorithms.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Advanced degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, operations research or other related technical field.Previous experience working in a similar integrated resort setting.
