Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSUMMARY: Under the direction of the Director of Financial Analysis, the Operations Analyst will provide in-depth analysis and guidance across the entire business in support of the divisional executive's efforts to further grow the business, generate revenue and optimize profitability. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Exhibit conduct in accordance with all Gaming Commission Regulations, Federal and State laws and regulations, and Golden Nugget and departmental policies and procedures.Develop and maintain databases for financial, gaming, marketing, staffing and other statistical data.Develop and generate necessary daily/weekly/monthly financial, gaming, marketing, staffing and other statistical reports and analyses.Analyzes promotional programs in order to determine their effectiveness as measured by revenue generated in relation to cost.Develops historical, current and potential future trend analysis.Assists in assessing and communicating financial and operating results to senior management.Develops appropriate financial and operating metrics for use by management in decision making.Perform ad-hoc analysis necessary to improve business operations or assist other departments with more complex analytical needs.Ensures departmental goals and performance measures are understood and achieved by managers.Communicates effectively with all levels of management.Continually expected to improve on and support the annual budget process.Assists in special projects as required by Management.Prepares weekly comp reports for review by management.Performs all other related and compatible duties as assigned, weekend shifts required.QUALIFICATIONS:Excellent analytical, problem solving, administrative, multi-tasking, organization and prioritization skillsExcellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written), fluent English and articulateAbility to work efficiently, independently and cohesively, consistently producing quality resultsHigh-level proficiency in Microsoft Excel required; SQL, gaming and lodging software experience preferred.Solid understanding of Casino Financial Statements preferred.Strong data management and interpretation skills, as well as knowledge of applying statistics to business modelingMinimum age requirement is 21.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's Degree in the area of Finance, Business or Accounting required.One plus (1-3) years' experience with significant exposure in financial analysis in casino, hotel or hospitality industry required.SDL2017

Name: Program Financial Analyst
Description: AECOM Program Financial Analyst in Las Vegas, Nevada  United States of America - Nevada, Las Vegas  Job Summary Purpose and Scope: Perform business/economic analytical studies and cost benefit analyses on behalf of the RSSII (Range Support Services II) contract. Essential Responsibilities: 1) Conduct research and prepare financial analyses and forecasts.  2) Generate management tools to effectively control programs.  3) Generate reports documenting findings.  4) Conduct research into procurement practices and assess/implement improvements to, or compliance with acquisition procedures.  5) Prepare computerized programs utilizing commercial software to manage tasks.  6) Participate in cost proposal development.  7) Maintain data base to produce monthly financial reports.  8) Track, process and distribute deliverables and monitor comment status.  Perform all other position related duties as assigned or requested.  Work Environment, Physical Demands, and Mental Demands:  Typical office environment with no unusual hazards, occasional lifting to 20 pounds, constant sitting while using the computer terminal, constant use of sight abilities while reviewing documents, constant use of speech/hearing abilities for communication, constant mental alertness, must possess planning/organizing skills, and must be able to work under deadlines.  Minimum Requirements  Bachelors' degree in Business or Finance and at least 3 years of job-related experience or equivalent.  Good written communication skills; strong Excel software skills.  Deltek Costpoint experience desired.  Possess working knowledge of word processing and integrated software applications; organizational skills and ability to perform detail oriented work is required.  Position may require intermittent travel.  Qualify for and maintain an active DoD clearance is required.  Qualify for and maintain a government Top Secret security clearance.  Possess a valid state issued driver's license.  Preferred Qualifications  Local candidates preferred.  Current DoD Top Secret Clearance is highly desired  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH & E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.  NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.  Job Category Finance and Accounting  Business Line Government  Business Group Management Services Group (MS)  Country United States of America  Position Status Full-Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. ******BR  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: Financial Analyst II - Investor Reporting
Description: Wyndham Destinations is seeking a Financial Analyst - Investor Reporting in Las Vegas, Nevada. This position assists with the Investor Reporting activities for WCF’s securitization program which consists of approximately 15 debt facilities. The Financial Analyst will assist with the preparation of monthly servicer reports, help respond to investor/rating agency/auditor requests, prepare securitization compliance requirements and produce various ad hoc analyses. The Analyst will also work closely with the Forecasting team to ensure the consistency and accuracy of reporting.Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Prepare monthly servicer reports for approximately 15 debt facilities by updating servicer report templates and formulas and reconciling cash flows and balances. Must be extremely detail oriented, well organized, and comfortable in translating legal definitions.Prepare monthly and quarterly servicer certificates, monthly conduit sale documents, annual compliance packages, and assist with responding to internal and external audit requests.Prepare wire requests, obtain signatures, and submit to Treasury for processing.Provide support as requested on special projects for the WCF and WD Financial Management groups.QualificationsEducationBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, MIS or Business, may be acceptable if combined with strong relevant work experience.Knowledge and skillsMust be extremely detail oriented and well organized.Must be able to communicate effectively with senior management and peers in both written and verbal form.Prior knowledge of securitization mechanics preferred.Technical SkillsAdvanced MS Excel requiredPrior experience in querying data from a relational database preferred.Job experience2-5 years of experience in financial analysis, forecasting, accounting or auditing.Prior experience in servicer reporting and/or securitization preferred.Wyndham Destinations (NYSE:WYND) believes in putting the world on vacation. Our global presence in 110 countries at more than 220 vacation ownership resorts and 4,300+ affiliated exchange properties distinguishes Wyndham Destinations as the world’s largest vacation ownership and exchange company, with North America’s largest professionally managed rental business. Each year our team of 25,000 associates delivers great vacations to millions of families as they make memories of a lifetime. Learn more at wyndhamdestinations.com. Our world is your destination.  Every year 3.5 million families entrust us with their vacation dreams. Through our unique brands, flexible ways to explore, and more destinations than anyone else, we make it easy to experience and enjoy the most amazing vacations around the globe. As the world’s largest vacation company, Wyndham Destinations provides access to unlimited possibilities to inspire your next vacation.  Wyndham Destinations is one family, one team of professionals who actively strive to provide our customers and each other with our signature Count On Me! Service promise. A promise to be responsive to needs, to be respectful in every way and deliver a great experience. It's more than a promise, at Wyndham it's been recognized as a commitment, visible in our awards including Newsweek's 100 Greenest Companies, Diversity Inc's 25 Noteworthy Companies and Ethisphere Institute Lists of the World's Most Ethical Companies amongst others. Come join the Wyndham family and discover the rewards for your career. http://careers.wyndhamdestinations.com/  Whether at work or on vacation - wherever your dream destination, wherever you see yourself—we help you get there.  A career at Wyndham Destinations offers you the following great benefit opportunities and more: Competitive compensation packageEmployee discounts on travelMedical/dental and vision care plans401(k) program that matches dollar for dollar up to 6% of salaryFlexible Spending Accounts, short & long term disability, life insurance & educational assistanceCommunity volunteer and global sustainability/green programs Come and be part of One Family, One Team, One Company . . . Wyndham Destinations  The Company makes every effort to ensure equal employment opportunities for all individuals and abides by EEO and nondiscrimination provisions of all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application please email your request to Mycareer@Wyn.com and provide the job title and location to which you are applying.

Name: Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTitle: Sr. Systems Analyst  Department: IT  Position Type: Exempt Hours per Week: 40 Position Summary: The Senior Systems Analyst is a member of the Enterprise Support & Web Integration Services team and provides applications best practices, and technical leadership, consulting services and support to the several internal and external Systems. Leads projects, performs highly complex coding, designs program logic and modifications, performs feasibility studies, and analyzes and designs high level system applications, in accordance with Company guidelines, client needs. General Duties:Performs analysis and makes recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.Designs data bases and data dictionary criteria.Performs a variety of complex programming tasks, such as designing, documenting, and coding program logic.Provides technical training, guidance, and resource support for end users and Departmental staff.Provides application support and enhancements to existing applications. Defines system requirements, priorities, and viable alternatives. Coordinates the efforts of staff to locate, assess, install, test, and maintain computer software systems. Coordinates conversions and upgrades to vendor systems.Performs as a project lead and directs systems analysts. Provides leadership and coordination on projects assigned to systems analysts.Assists in developing user documentation and departmental policies and procedures that impact the use of application systems.Continues to develop professional skills in the information systems through trade magazines, manuals, seminars, and courses. Assist's in training analyst staff.Performs complex Senior Systems Analyst duties on a regular and continuous basis.Performs other related duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree, or an equivalent combination of education and experience may be acceptable.7 plus years of related experience. Zenith American Solutions  Real People. Real Solutions. National Reach. Local Expertise.  We are currently looking for a dedicated, energetic Sr. Systems Analyst with the necessary skills, initiative, and personality, along with the desire to get the most out of their working life, to help us be our best every day.  Zenith American Solutions is the largest independent Third Party Administrator in the United States and currently operates over 44 offices nationwide. The original entity of Zenith American has been in business since 1944. Our company was formed as the result of a merger between Zenith Administrators and American Benefit Plan Administrators in 2011. By combining resources, best practices and scale, the new organization is even stronger and better than before.  We believe the best way to realize our better systems for better service philosophy is to hire the best employees. We're always looking for talented individuals who share our dedication to high-quality work, exceptional service and mutual respect. If you're interested in working in an environment where people - employees and clients - really matter, consider bringing your talents to Zenith American!  We realize the importance a comprehensive benefits program to our employees and their families. As part of our total compensation package, we offer an array of benefits including health, vision, and dental coverage, a retirement savings 401(k) plan with company match, paid time off (PTO), great opportunities for growth, and much, much more!  Interested in learning more about our company or the other career opportunities available? Visit us at www.zenith-american.com!  Zenith American Solutions is proud to be an Equal Opportunity workplace.  Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Senior Analyst – Casino Marketing Analytics (Corporate)
Description: Location:Las Vegas, NevadaBecome one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The Senior Analyst of Casino Marketing collaborates with the team to analyze the performance of high end database, VIP events and host related activities. The Senior Analyst will be responsible for generating insights about the high-end segment, the effectiveness of various marketing components and make recommendations for improvements that would increase performance. In addition, the senior analyst will perform ad-hoc research into the effectiveness of various high-end strategies and provide insights into their contribution and recommendations on how to improve. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts policies, practices and procedures. Develop analytical insights on high-end events/customer activities and works with leadership of identifying the areas of opportunity.Synthesize data, insights, and consumer research to create presentations that make fact-based recommendationsReview the performance of VIP events, provide insights and recommendation for future events.Collaborate with the Director to communicate recommended approaches to senior leaders, and anticipate the future needs of our customersAid in identifying and recording best practices in the high-end space and ensure systems are in place to document the learnings on an institutional level.Assist in development of key metrics of success, relaying reporting requirements and creation of insights into the VIP lines of businessPartner with key stakeholders to understand core business challenges, intent of marketing efforts and help craft view, tools and insights that best help in informing direction.Perform ongoing analysis of segment and offer performancePerform other job-related duties as requestedRequired:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Finance, Applied Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or other related field.At least 2 years of experience in relevant subject area expertise (e.g., industry or function).Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms.Preferred:Master’s degree in Marketing, Finance, Engineering or related field.Experience in casino and hospitality marketing.Experience with SAS highly.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.

Name: Sr. Business Consultant Diversity & Inclusion Strategy (Corporate)
Description: Location:Las Vegas, NevadaBecome one of the stars behind The SHOW and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.The Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) Team is the Company’s primary business group for promotion of D&I as a core value in the culture and operations of the Company, including development and implementation of key D&I strategies, policy and programming; D&I analytics; and D&I as a key driver of employee engagement. Key focus areas of the D&I Team include design and installation of D&I policy and programs in critical Company operations across business segments – with focus on the critical subject matter of D & I, Company culture and leadership development among management and front-line employees; leadership of the property/corporate division Corporate Social Responsibility (“CSR”) Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the enterprise-wide Employee Network Groups (“ENGs”); and central Company resource for D&I best practices – as well as other special events and activities as designated. This Business Consultant position is an integral part of supporting all strategies, initiatives and programs of the D & I Team.All Department positions serve as Company and Department ambassadors, and support enhancement of the Company’s profile and reputation as a major leader in CSR and its pillars: diversity and inclusion, giving/philanthropy/volunteerism/community engagement; and environmental sustainability. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts policies, practices, and procedures.Designs and implements an overall strategy to maximize the effectiveness of ENGs and CSR Councils.Responsible for the design, preparation and delivery of the agenda, instruction curricula and other programming elements for the Corporate Social Responsibility Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the Employee Network Groups (“ENG”) – This includes subject matter related to Diversity & Inclusion, the Company’s mission, vision and values, Company culture, leadership and talent development and employee engagement, all in alignment with Company-wide goals and objectives.Provides independent, decisive action, particularly in managing the CSR Councils, the ENGs and other D&I programs and initiatives.Leads and supports ENG and CSR Council meetings independently without supervision.Provides leadership/career development coaching and guidance on an individual basis to employees who may be participants in/members of the CSR Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the ENGs.Responsible for developing and implementing recommendations to drive increase in ENG membership/participation; monitors, tracks, and develops a plan to increase ENG member certifications; and ensures adherence to monthly schedules for ENG meetings.Takes the lead role in managing all aspects of Social Media pertaining to ENGs, including maintaining the Company’s internal ENG website and connected pages; monitoring ENG Workplace by Facebook quality assurance; and ensuring ENG compliance with the Company’s Social Media protocols.Serves as the subject matter expert of the D&I Team by providing research and analysis, and external benchmarking, of D&I trends and best practices as it relates to ENGs and CSR Councils.Owns responsibility for advising key stakeholders of progress against D&I goals related to ENGs and CSR Councils in the annual strategic plan reporting on Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”).Provides direction and makes recommendations based on D & I reporting and KPIs to D&I Team leadership, Department leadership, Company senior leadership and the Company’s Board of Directors CSR Committee. Serves as a company representative at meetings, programs or events conducted by external D & I and other stakeholders.Provides input and support for preparation of the Company’s responses to D&I reputation surveys, questionnaires, etc.Acts as project lead for other initiatives, programs and projects of the Department, as assigned including the annual Inclusion Summit.Responsible for setting and maintaining timetables for projects; manages deadlines and resources; works with a wide degree of creativity and latitude as well as minimal supervision; and regularly updates his/her own skills through on-going training and formal education.Acts as a mentor of other Company employees and models the competencies and standards of effective leadership; participates in Company-sponsored volunteer and other CSR opportunities.Responsible for research and measurement of best practices in order to develop an ENG and CSR Council effectiveness scorecard.Owns responsibility for maintenance and updates of the playbooks for the boarding of new ENG and CSR Council officers.Responsible for design and implement a registration system for sign ups and tracking of ENG and CSR Council participation.Develops, implements and monitors the communication strategy to introduce all ENG and CSR Council programs.Proactively capture feedback from participants to refine and tweak the ENGs and CSR Councils as neededWorks with HR Learning & Development team to communicate professional development resources to ENGs and CSR Councils.Manages and maintains the Employee Network Group annual budget.Facilitates the Inclusion Circles and Focus Group discussions with the Culture and Engagement Team.Performs other job-related duties as assigned. Required:Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with a concentration in Business, Human Resources, Organizational Development or subject matter related to Diversity & Inclusion; or equivalent education and experienceAt least 6 years of experience in a Diversity and Inclusion role, or related experience.Excellent customer service skills.Able to lead and mentor a team.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Previous experience working in hospitality or a similar resort setting.Bilingual in English and Spanish preferred.#LI-DR1

Name: Analyst, Commercial Analytics
Description: What does an Analyst, Commercial Analytics do for Allegiant? The Commercial Analytics Analyst will directly support senior management by analyzing/modeling commercial functions that impact revenue performance, identifying opportunities for additional revenue generation, and other projects as requested. What are some of the daily duties of an Analyst, Commercial Analytics?Provides in-depth analyses of commercial functions, identifies emerging risks and opportunities, and communicates findings to senior managementWorks with commercial departments such as revenue, third party or marketing to understand key drivers and trends in commercial performanceIdentifies opportunities for generating additional revenue and cost reduction for commercial departments, create a plan to address improvement areas, execute and provide reporting/analysis for the planLeverages solid Excel and financial modeling skillsPerforms a variety of tasks and ad-hoc analysisOther duties as assignedWhat are the minimum requirements to be an Analyst, Commercial Analytics?Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics and/or EngineeringTwo (2) years of Airline or transport experience strongly preferred; experience in business, economics and/or math, and ability to create spreadsheet models and produce relevant outputs are all beneficial.No visa sponsorship is available for this positionWhat other skills, knowledge, and qualifications are needed to bean Analyst, Commercial Analytics?Results-driven; accepting responsibility for individual performance and contributions to team projectsAbility to work with cross-functional groups in a collaborative environmentMust be able to work in a high-pressure environmentManages time effectively in order to meet timelines across multiple projectsStrong systems skills, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)Understanding of the airline operating environment and how various commercial groups impact overall operational performance/costTableau or SQL experience a plusExcellent critical thinker and effective problem solver with creative solutionsDetail oriented and highly organizedStrong oral and written communication skills, ability to present to senior managementDeals well with and finds ways to decrease ambiguityMust pass a ten (10) year background checkMust have authorization to work in the U.S. as defined by the Immigrations Act of 1986What are the physical requirements ofan Analyst, Commercial Analytics?Office environmentTravel may be requiredAllegiant is an equal opportunity employer and will not unlawfully discriminate against qualified applicants or Team Members with respect to any terms or conditions of employment based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, creed, marital status, military service status, union/non-union activity, citizenship status, or other characteristic protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. This includes compliance with all federal, state and local laws providing for nondiscrimination on the basis of disability in all aspects of the employment process and the requirement to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with those laws.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY This role is responsible to support the company in preparing and analyzing detailed financial results, as well as supervising budget preparation and analysis. This position will review financial data and provide recommendations to meet and/or exceed budget goals and operational efficiencies. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSResponsible for the preparation of long range planning, forecasting and the annual budget process.Reviews financial data and provide recommendations to management, in order to maximize operational efficiency and financial returns.Responsible for the development and improvement of financial reporting tools.Implements best practices, process improvements and internal controls.Performs ad hoc financial analysis as needed and without guidance.Assists in the preparation of proforma analyses of potential resort operations and/or association acquisitions.Liaises with company accounting counterparts.Consistently practices and maintains the highest standards of professionalism when interacting with team members, management, owners, members and prospects.Collaborates with department leadership to identify, discuss and prioritize financial performance versus annual budget.Administers and completes special projects as requested including but not limited to capital expenditures tracking and return on investment calculations.Reviews operating budgets to analyze trends affecting budget needs.Participates in the monthly financial close processes.Applies advanced knowledge of data collection and analysis methods to prepare detailed reports and analyses.Completes all required company trainings and compliance courses as assigned.Adheres to company standards and maintains compliance with all policies and procedures.Performs other related duties as assigned.EDUCATIONBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in related field.EXPERIENCEA minimum two (2) years of experience in the accounting and/or finance field required.No supervisory experience required.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position spends the majority of the time (50% or more) achieving organization objectives, often through the coordinate achievements of subordinate staff. A portion of the time may be spent performing individual tasks related similar to those performed by direct reports, but primary duties are supervisory or organizational-goal related. Analyzes and resolves problems, determines work techniques, monitors for regulatory compliance, maintains production, interprets and creates policies, and demonstrates solid subject matter knowledge.  Establishes departmental goals and objectives, functions with independence, and makes decisions on matters of significant importance. Manages human, financial, and/or physical resources; proactively assesses risk to establish systems and procedures to protect organizational assets. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action; develops systems to ensure subordinates adhere to policies and procedures in compliance with organizational goals and objectives. LICENSE & CERTIFICATIONSThis position does not require licenses or certifications.SKILLS & ABILITIES This position requires the capability to understand and follow both oral and written directions as well as knowledge and usage of correct business English and office practices. Must be able to communicate effectively with others, analyze and resolve problems, maintain effective working relationships, and interact successfully with internal and external customers.  Specific skills and abilities include, but are not limited to the following: Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.Understand how to develop and implement business strategies.Ability to interpret and create policies, procedures and manuals.Excellent customer service skills.Proficient in time management; the ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.Ability to take initiative and effectively adapt to changes.Recognizes an emergency situation and takes appropriate action.Able to establish and maintain a cooperative working relation.Ability to interpret and create spreadsheets.Able to use sound judgment; work independently, with minimal supervision.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Able to perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with impending deadlines and/or established timeframes.Competent in public speaking.Performs well with frequent interruptions and/or distractions.Advanced math skills.

Name: Senior Analyst – Operational Analytics (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The Senior Analyst Operational Analytics collaborates with the team to drive insights, recommendations and identify best practices to improve performance across MGM’s operational divisions. The Senior Analyst will perform analysis and foster close relationships with operators to identify areas of opportunity and efficiencies that will serve as the basis of data-driven change management. This individual collaborates with internal Enterprise Analytics (EA) teams and external business partners to provide tailored analyses, goals and action plans. Communicate data insights involving a combination of data, visuals and narrative to explain what is happening in the operation and why the insights from data are important.Deliver holistic and structured analytical approaches focused on data storytelling.Create clear, concise, summaries of analysis and providing recommendations for improvement. Work in close partnership with operators to determine KPI goals and action plans.Provide insights to Operational Analytics analysts in the development of KPI goal tracking.Create clear, concise, summaries of analysis and providing recommendations for improvement. Provide guidance to Operational Analytics analysts.Network externally to seek innovation.Perform other job related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality, Gaming or related field.At least 2 years of relevant subject area expertise (e.g. industry or function) with experience in driving business performance through operational insights and analytics.Experience in operations analytics.Knowledge of data structures, systems and BI tools / capabilities.Strategic view and ability to execute on quality data and tools enabling business goals.Able to use influence to ensure alignment and adoption of analytics capabilities / insights.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.

Description: Title: Cerner Ambulatory Support Analyst  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212775  CTG is seeking a Cerner Millennium Ambulatory support analyst. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance.  This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011). Name: Tier 1 Intrusion Analyst
Description: At Criterion Systems,Inc., we developed a different kind of businessa company whose real value is a reputation for excellence built upon the collective skills, talents, perspectives, and backgrounds of its people. Our Offerings: *100% employee-owned private Government contractor founded in 2005. *High retention rate because we work hard at holding onto talent. *Excellent Leadership Team comprised of individuals who have successfully built and run businesses and are involved in day-to-day operations to include an open-door policy. Our employees are the most valuable assets. Are you ready to be appreciated?  Criterion Systems is seeking to hire a Tier 1 Intrusion Analyst to support a government customer in Las Vegas, Nevada.  The candidate will be part of the Security Operation Center (SOC) working in a 24x7 environment. The position requires interaction with security personnel at customer sites, various levels of management, and outside agencies. Position can include up to 10% travel, local and nationwide. Applicant must be a positive, flexible, self-starter requiring minimal supervision, and able to excel in a fast-paced environment. Communication skills are critical with the ability to verbalize and provide documentation to both technical and non-technical audiences. Applicants must be detail-oriented and have the ability to multi-task effectively. Duties and responsibilities include: Monitor, deter, identify, and investigate computer and network intrusions. Ability to research trends and countermeasures in computer/network including vulnerabilities, exploits, and malicious activity. Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with computer network security techniques and best practices. Technical focus on the monitoring and analysis of large, distributed and complex network. Candidate must be able to identify suspicious and malicious activity in a heterogeneous network environment and respond appropriately. Research new and evolving threats and vulnerabilities with potential to impact the monitored environmentRead and understand network packet capture filesMonitoring and analysis of network and IDS informationLog collection, analysis, correlation, and alertingIdentification of suspicious/malicious activitiesIdentification and tracking of malicious codeReporting malicious activity to client locations with recommendations for remediationReview and management of incident resolutionsOther duties as assignedTravel up to 10%Required Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Security or related technical discipline OR 4 years professional IT experience may be used in lieu of degree.Three (3) years of technical experience with some security componentActive Department of Energy (DOE) "Q" Clearance OR Top Secret Security Clearance OR Secret with an SSBI investigation OR the ability to obtain a clearanceUS Citizenship requiredMust be willing to work various shifts in a 24x7 environmentStrong knowledge of networkingStrong knowledge of common network protocol behaviorStrong knowledge of information security principlesExcellent verbal and written communications skillsExcellent customer service skills Desired Qualifications: -  One or more years' previous experience in network intrusion analysis is highly desired Experience with network and host-based IDS/IPSExperience with SIM/SIEM technologiesThe following information security training is highly desired: SANS GSEC, SANS GCIA, SANS GCIH, CEH, OSCP.Compliance with 8570 CND-A within six months. This position is not immediately available. We are awaiting funding for the role.  Criterion Systems is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.SDL2017

Description: Title: Insurance Analyst Location: Las Vegas, NV 89146, USA Duration: 3 Months ContractJob Description:Serves as a liaison to external contacts.Plans, prepares and develops risk management presentations to the insurance marketplace.Represents Company in insurance industry and professional associationsPlans and schedules inspections of all facilities with insurance carriers and loss control consultants to identify hazards and recommends appropriate programs to reduce exposures.Coordinates General Rate Case process and filings related to Corporate Insurance.Reviews and reconciles insurance premium amortization schedules and master data request in order to ensure complete and accurate regulatory filings and cost recovery.Responds timely and accurately to internal and external data requests and inquiries regarding insurance programs and premium allocations.Monitors the receipt of insurance binders, policies and endorsements. Name: Senior Performance Analyst
Description: Job Summary The Senior Performance Analyst is responsible for the collection, extraction and analysis of data from multiple sources to assist in developing credit risk parameters. This position provides useful information and reporting which is required to support company-wide risk management objectives. Perform other assignments as required. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:  Determine current and future asset financial performance by different tranches and make recommendations for improving the product offer to maximize the portfolios overall profitability  Assist in identifying and analyzing key causes, patterns or trends with portfolio and/or risk management and communicate those issues to management.  Review, analyze and evaluate business and technical system requirements; translate business requirements into technical specifications.  Responsible for numerous database designs and complex searching techniques used to precisely extract information from highly complex databases using SQL.  Define reporting and data requirements by consulting with executive team.  Develop and maintain complex SAS reports to provide data and analysis. Education and/or Experience Bachelors degree in economics, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering or related area required; Advanced degree preferred (Masters, PhD).  Minimum 3 years of data analytics experience to include analyzing large data sets, data mining and providing consultation to stakeholders required.  Minimum 3 years of experience with SAS, SQL and/or other tools to perform data manipulation and analysis required.  Knowledge of banking products and services on consumer businesses like Credit Card/Auto/Mortgage business Computer Skills Knowledge of SAS, SQL Server, and Microsoft Office Suite required.  Knowledge in information technology and statistical analysis or computer programming (i.e. VBA, SAS, MATLAB, Python)

Name: Senior Financial Systems Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The Senior Financial Systems Analyst is a vital member of the team responsible for supporting the Global Accounting and Finance teams' use of Diamond Resorts financial accounting and reporting applications by providing senior level technical support on Hyperion Planning, HFM, Essbase, and FDMEE applications.  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSWorks closely with the Financial Planning & Analysis team to understand and develop Company budget and forecasting process and the applications needed to support it.Determines required drivers and calculations, recommends and creates driver dimensions, develops and tests driver based calculations, creates needed applications, security groups, and filters.Provides technical direction to the FPA team on creating planning forms.Helps develop a common dimensionality structure that can support external financial reporting requirements and assists in modifying FDMEE data load rules to support this structure.Determines impact of dimensionality changes across all Company Hyperion applications, modifies processes impacted by the dimensionality change, and ensures dimensionality remains consistent and in sync across all Hyperion applications.Maintains Diamond Resorts Essbase reporting applications and develops FDMEE data load rules to keep data current among them.Provides technical assistance in Company use of Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) as it relates to consolidation calculations, top-side adjustments, and report development.Provides technical assistance and training to junior team members; troubleshoots and resolves application issues raised by them, involving the team's manager and IT resources if necessary.Maintains and adheres to a change control process that ensures system stability and reliability.Completes all required Company trainings and compliance courses as assigned.Adheres to Company standards and maintains compliance with all policies and procedures.Performs other related duties as assigned. EDUCATIONBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in related field. EXPERIENCEA minimum three (3) years of experience in the implementing, maintaining, and administering Hyperion applications required.No supervisory experience required. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESThis position does not include any supervisory responsibilities. LICENSE & CERTIFICATIONSThis position does not require licenses or certifications. SKILLS & ABILITIES This position requires the capability to understand and follow both oral and written directions as well as knowledge and usage of correct business English and office practices. Must be able to communicate effectively with others, analyze and resolve problems, maintain effective working relationships, and interact successfully with internal and external customers.  Specific skills and abilities include, but are not limited to the following: Proven ability in building, deploying and supporting Hyperion Planning and Essbase applications for a large, multi-national company in a fast-paced, evolving environment.Working knowledge in maintaining Hyperion application dimensionality using EPMA.Working knowledge in developing member based formulas and driver based calculations using Hyperion Calc Manager.Familiar with Essbase best practices related to design and how dimensionality can impact application performance.Proven skills in Lifecycle Management (LCM) to migrate changes across multiple system environments.Working knowledge of a chart of account structure, currency translations, financial consolidations and high level accounting concepts; and how these impact the administration of Hyperion applications.Proven skills in developing complex financial reporting using HFM, Essbase, SmartView and Financial Reporting Studio.Must know how to build, troubleshoot, and load data using FDMEE.Working knowledge with Oracle R12's consolidation, accounting setups and FSG reporting.Able to communicate effectively, work independently, manage various demands and tasks in an organized manner and show an aptitude for problem solving.Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.Understands how to develop and implement business strategies.Ability to interpret and create policies, procedures and manuals.Excellent customer service skills.Proficient in time management; Name: Business Consultant
Description: Job DescriptionYou'll choose your own schedule, yet most of our Business Consultants log from 5 to 20 hours a week or more, meeting with 4 to 8 pre-qualified client organizations either at their establishment or via on online video meeting. On First Meetings you will observe data from the organization and complete an intake interview so you are best prepared to assist in their Systems and Innovations Readiness Meeting, which is the next phase of their VOWAS.org program.  Depending on your existing skills, and your speed of successful execution of your role, an average performer can make within their first 12 months from:  $115,000 to $195,000(not including stock options)  ​If you're a top performer, you can double, quadruple, or achieve 10x or more of those figures. ​Learn more here: http://www.serviceaces.com/businessconsultantincome ​Details: On top of other incentives, for every minute you work with us you'll earn stock (http://www.serviceaces.com/stock) from our pre-IPO partner organization GS Partners Inc (VOWAS.org). All of our active team members are currently earning seven figure stock options in their first year with us (based on post-IPO﻿ stock﻿ cash value estimate of two dollars per share*).  Business Consultants work 5 to 20 hours a week, meeting with 4 to 8 pre-qualified client organizations either at their establishment or via on online video meeting. On First Meetings you will be visiting clients on the second half of your local successful Field Agent(s) ACES qualification meeting, greeting the organization's leadership, and initially notating systems and processes so you are best prepared to re-visit the organization to assist in the Systems and Innovations Readiness (SIR) Meeting, which is the next phase of their VOWAS.org implementation after the Field Agent has qualified and accredited the client's application as an ACES organization.  We offer an outstanding pay plan with: a base of fifteen (15) shares of stock per hour worked ($300 hourly*)Business Consultant revenue sharing (http://www.serviceaces.com/commissions)profit sharing opportunities if you are advanced into a corporate headquarters leadership rolesign on bonusesadditional compensation for additional services as noted below One of the reasons the stock package is larger than the norm is to enable more individuals to earn sufficient assets to re-invest in new industrial Economic Development areas.  ​You'll complete a company-paid certification which prepares you for your role.  A successful Business Consultant Director-in-Training, after their first four weeks has the opportunity to advance into a district Vice President of Business Consultants role which includes commission overrides on others in your Division. Vice Presidents champion their own Division by bringing other qualified Business Consultants as well as qualified Brand Ambassadors, Recruiters, Analysts, Field Agents, Financial Consultants, Marketing Show Hosts, Field Productions Members, Studio Productions Members, and Executive Directors into the organization. A successful Vice President may have an opportunity for a Chief Executive of Business Consultants leadership role.  With good performance (at least an 80% Performance or Effective Rating) through your first twelve weeks, you have the opportunity to progress from a representative to an associate level stock earning role which includes larger stock options.  Successful Business Consultants, after their first four weeks have the opportunity to advance into a Senior Director of Business Consultants role which includes overrides on other successful Business Consultants you qualify to supervise through their client's Systems and Innovations Readiness (SIR) enrollment(s).  Successful Business Consultants (business consultants with at least one of their own ACES organization enrollment) are provided with fund access, at no additional cost to the Business Consultant, for:​expense fund: to be utilized at the Business Consultant's discretion to pay for career candidate leads, and an assistant for First Meetings and/or SIR (Systems and Innovations Readiness) Meetings If chosen for this role, you'll complete a company paid certification and online onboarding program. With good performance through your first twelve weeks, you have the opportunity to progress from to an associate level stock earning role which includes larger stock options.  Job Type: ContractPart time (5 to 20 hours) Requirements and preferences: Five years of management experience required; 10 years preferredFive years of experience required; 10 years preferred in either: management consulting, c-level executive, business ownership, engineering, or technology developmentBachelor's of Science or Art required; MBA or JD preferredTwo smart devices (a phone, tablet, and/or laptop) with a high speed (2MBPS upload and download) mobile data plan requiredMust speak English fluentlyMust hold a valid US Driver's LicenseMust be authorized to work in the US (a citizen, permanent resident, or hold a valid work visa or free trade visa) ​Benefits offered: if you choose not to maintain your current healthcare insurance program, after beginning with us you would enroll in a healthcare.gov plan until the 10th United States organization has started utilizing VOWAS.org benefits and services at which time you and your qualified household members would be eligible to utilize applicable VOWAS.org benefits and services after you've worked 90 days as a successful workforce member with ServiceAces ​*based on post-IPO﻿ stock﻿ cash value estimate of the one-year post-IPO cash value range per share of $20.00 per share per Depat.org: https://www.depat.org/102189253Company DescriptionWe help households and organizations learn of the new tools and resources of Vouchers, Organized Workforce Aid, and Systems (VOWAS.org) which is helping them earn more income and work less hours. By individual analysis and education, certify their application to access VOWAS.org as soon as possible.

Name: Banking Credit Analyst
Description: Assists lending department by completing financial statement and tax return spreads and/or cash flow analyses. Assists loan officers in gathering data from customers, internal and outside sources; prepares spreadsheets and analyzes financial information including financial statements and tax returns; contacts customers for additional information and clarification of data. Assists loan officers in gathering up-to-date financial statements for consumer/commercial accounts; ensures credit inquiries and UCC filings are researched to determine credit worthiness and appropriate collateral positioning are achieved. Compiles data from credit bureaus, conducts industry peer comparisons, and performs cash flow analyses and other such tasks and comparisons. Assists loan officers in performing pre-qualification assessment and analysis of financial condition and risk of financing requests within framework of Bank credit culture and current economic and industry trends. Assist loan officers in the review and renewal of credit facilities; provides back-up support. Assists with scanning of loan files and loan related data. Checks pledged assets as requested by loan officers. Assists with on-going computerization of the loan review function. Assists loan officers in verification of funds with mortgage companies and contractors. Develops knowledge of financial industry, economy, market conditions, rates, vendors and competition. May represent the Bank in various community, civic, and community reinvestment functions to further enhance the Bank?s image and develop additional business. Reinforces the application of superior customer service through his or her own example along with appropriate follow through with involved customers and employees. Assists in providing deposit and loan account ratings for loan officers. Answers telephones, questions and directs callers to proper Bank personnel. Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; Inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions. Demonstrates knowledge of and adherence to EEO policy; shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; educates others on the value of diversity; promotes working environment free of harassment of any type; builds a diverse workforce and supports affirmative action. Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports the Bank?s goals and values; benefits the bank through outside activities. Performs the position safely, without endangering the health or safety to themselves or others and will be expected to report potentially unsafe conditions. The employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations and orders issued pursuant to the OSHA Act of 1970, which are applicable to one?s own actions and conduct. We pioneered the professional staffing industry, and we've been successfully matching professionals with employers since 1948. Name: Revenue Analyst/Modeler (Corporate)
Description: Location:Las Vegas, NevadaBecome one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race. The primary responsibilities of the Revenue Analyst/Modeler is to create and compile various statistical reports and analyze data and reports for management review on all financial aspects as they relate to forecasting, yielding, budgeting, revenue generation and cost control. This role will also require extensive hands-on data and process management experience in order to build data driven solutions, conduct analysis, and derive insights that will drive commercial success for MGMRI’s portfolio of entertainment. Develop and implement a consistent and best of breed set of templates, reports and analyses for management to utilize.Collaborate with Information Management on designing and maintaining highly scalable data pipelines to obtain proper data sources.Develop predictive and optimization models; measure model performance and validity using statistical techniques.Ability to conduct data mining and develop machine learning algorithms (ie. clustering analysis, logistic regression, etc.) or machine learning APIs and open source libraries.Perform demand forecast and revenue optimization using various forecasting techniques (ie. time series, linear regressions, etc.) to identify sales trends.Design, document, deploy and maintain analytical reports utilizing data manipulation techniques to track KPIs.Analyze data from various sources to infer, predict and recommend relevant and actionable insights pertaining to revenue maximization.Translate complex datasets, statistical analysis and models into app and web based graphs or interactive data visualization reports.Assist in the preparation of yield management of data on a daily basis and provide recommendations for revenue maximization (Forecasts, pricing optimization, competitive impacts, and dilution and displacement analyses).Review all promotional opportunities, sponsorships and strategic partnerships with various internal departments within MGMRI.Assist in the collection and data storage of key historical data to assist the properties in the ongoing daily implementation of pricing strategies, analysis of reports, recommendations for continued revenue generation and efficiencies.Continuously investigate new profit and growth opportunities. Consolidate, simplify and create new and existing reports for data analyzing.Collaborate with management in evaluating new technologies and software to improve tracking and streamline processes.Conduct rate shops and price comparisons of competitive sets.Perform other job related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, with and emphasis in Statistics, Finance, Economics, MIS or related equivalent education and work experience.At least 3 years of experience in data analytics.General knowledge of revenue management.Working knowledge of dynamic pricing techniques.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent. (education)SAS (Statistical Analysis Software) and/or SQL (Structured Query Language) knowledge.Experience with various database environments (ie. Teradata and SQL Server).Advanced Excel (ie. PowerBI, Tableau, and/or Spotfire).Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms.Preferred:Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Business Management or a related field.At least 2 years working experience in Revenue Management.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Analyst, Material Planning
Description: What are some of the daily duties of a Material Planning Analyst?Responsible for determining the weekly inventory replenishment plans using analytical models.Coordinate with maintenance planning, engineering, and material control departments to ensure successful execution of all special programs as well as the day-to-day replenishment.Develop new models and perform case studies as required. These models could range from inventory optimization, logistics, aircraft movement patterns, or part failure prediction.Maintain existing models that determine the appropriate stock levels and distribution of the company’s aircraft related rotable and expendable parts inventories. Recommend changes whenever there are significant changes in the inputs such as an increase or decrease in the number of aircraft, individual aircraft flight patterns, a desired revision of confidence factors, changes in mechanical reliability, etc.Work closely with the Purchasing and Component Repairs groups within the Materials Department to assist in their planning efforts and understanding all of the associated operational risks.Perform regular analysis which includes, at a minimum, the entire universe of applicable primary and alternate parts (the parts tree), associated aircraft effectivity, aircraft movement patterns, and locations, quantity on hand, prior usage, industry average failure rates, turn times and desired confidence factors.Maintain a master parts tree. Interface inter-departmentally and with maintenance technical services, as necessary, to assure completeness, as well as currency in Allegiant’s ERP system and Aircraft Parts Catalogs. Investigate and initiate changes, as necessary.Analyze and resolve aircraft parts-related issues as they arisePerform other duties, as assignedWhat are the minimum requirements to be a Material Planning Analyst?Education requirements– Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree preferred. Operations Research, Engineering, Logistics, or Supply Chain degrees and/or emphasis will be strongly considered.Work Experience–Advanced level of proficiency using Excel or programming language. Experience and/or certifications in the following are desirable: Process optimization, Programming or database management, Business or Supply Chain Management, Six-Sigma Lean, and Project Management.No visa sponsorship is available for this position.What other skills, knowledge, and qualifications are needed to be a Material Planning Analyst?Must have ability to read, write, and speak EnglishStrong intellect and aptitude desiredAbility to manage multiple and varied activitiesGood leadership and people management skillsEffective communication skillsAbility to prioritize and effectively problem solveA high level of creativity and mathematical aptitude is essentialMust pass a background check and pre-employment drug screenMust have authorization to work in the U.S. as defined in the Immigrations Act of 1986What are the physical requirements of a Material Planning Analyst (if applicable)Office environment. Name: FP&A Analyst
Description: *Req No.** 17520BR*Job Posting Title** FP&A Analyst*Location** NV - Las Vegas*Shift** Day*Employment Status** Full Time*Description** About IGT  IGT enables players to experience their favorite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines and Lotteries to Interactive and Social Gaming. Leveraging a wealth of premium content, substantial investment in innovation, in-depth customer intelligence, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our gaming solutions anticipate the demands of consumers wherever they decide to play.  Through the PlayDigital division, IGT offers a complete portfolio of award-winning digital gaming products, platforms, and services supporting online interactive casino & slot games, retail & online sports betting, and emerging gaming such as virtual reality.  The PlayDigital FP&A Analyst will report to and work closely with the PlayDigital Senior Manager of FP&A to provide financial forecasting, variance tracking, and other strategic support to the executive team. This position has exposure to executive management and will include strategic analyses such as: board & CFO presentations, capital expenditure analyses, industry/peer group comparisons, new business opportunities, acquisition analyses, and other ad-hoc projects as requested. This function will drive multiple large strategic projects that provide insights and support optimal business decision making. Actions of the Senior Analyst frequently influence the work of other team members, other teams, and management decisions. *First Year Goals**Job Requirements Include: ? Work directly with the PlayDigital Senior Manager of FP&A to create monthly financial reporting packages to accommodate divisional and corporate executive teams. Reporting packages inclusive of financial results, KPIs, analysis comparisons to prior periods and budget, and select insights for PlayDigital organization  ? Assists with the multi-year, annual budget, and financial planning/forecasting processes  ? Ensures driver based forecast system in SAP BPC is accurately reflecting internal assumptions  ? Works with product management and sales organizations to understand market dynamics that could impact forecast assumptions  ? Ability to interface with executive management and effectively communicate financial data and reports  ? Variance analysis and research against budget/forecasts/prior year  ? Margin analysis to understand drivers of profitability between actuals and forecast compares  ? Analyze trend analysis for all KPI?s and financial drivers within the segment  ? Develops and updates presentation schedules as necessary; including charts, graphs, PowerPoint slides.  ? Manages data flow into corporate financial planning tool (SAP BPC) and understands the fundamentals of ERP accounting and reporting systems *Required Qualifications** ? Minimum 4+ years? experience required in finance, accounting or related field  ? Bachelor?s Degree with major in Business, Finance, or Accounting required  ? Strong verbal and written communication skills  ? Strong financial / business systems experience, preferably SAP and BPC  ? Must be a detail oriented self-starter with strong organization skills  ? Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint  ? Ability to travel on occasion  ? Ability, if needed, to work outside of normal business hours, including weekends and holidays *Special requirements needed** Pass a background check*Keys To Success** ? Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity. ? Build collaborative relationships both internally and externally ? Decision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve. ? Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles. ? Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneself ? Foster innovation  ~cb~ #LI-KK1 **** IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.

Name: Managed Services Analyst
Description: Founded by a team of data experts, VizExplorer is a highly-differentiated analytics and business intelligence leader, applying design and visualization principles to big data problems. With analytics, data visualization, and operational intelligence solutions, VizExplorer makes enterprise data actionable, delivering insights to optimize efficiency and profitability. As a market leader in the Casino Gaming industry, VizExplorer products maximize revenue and profits, making marketing and casino floor configuration recommendations based on analysis of a myriad of disparate and varied consumer databases and systems of record; VizExplorer provides critically important technology to more than 250 casino properties across six continents. The VizExplorer platform can be tailored to suit horizontal and other vertical applications and is also being used in beta by a professional sports team for marketing and venue related analytics.  The Managed Services Analyst is responsible for delivery the Managed Services Program processes which focus on continued customer acclimation and immersion into proprietary database marketing products. Name: Insurance Analyst
Description: Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Assembles and organizes underwriting data requests, completes insurance applications and creates underwriting submissions for all major corporate insurance renewals.  Performs research and prepares correspondences for review and approval of insurance language and indemnification provisions in contracts, leases and agreements. Ensures compliance with contractual requirements.  Assists with the internal management of Client's (Captive) operating and compliance activities. Provides analysis for underwriting, claims, budgeting and investment decision making. Facilitates annual board of directors/shareholders meetings and completes annual license renewals. 10%  Coordinates engineering efforts with property insurers and internal generating plant property engineers. Reports monthly developments to Generation executive leadership and develops plans and strategies for achieving lower operational risk.  Researches current market risk initiatives. Stays well versed in insurance industry standards, policies, changes and news.  Assess the need for various instruments (bonding, letter of credit) to satisfy indemnification requirements for contracts. Creates and executes indemnification instruments and manages renewal process where required.  Serves as a liaison to external contacts Plans, prepares and develops risk management presentations to the insurance marketplace.Represents Company in insurance industry and professional associationsPlans and schedules inspections of all facilities with insurance carriers and loss control consultants to identify hazards and recommends appropriate programs to reduce exposures.Coordinates General Rate Case process and filings related to Corporate Insurance.Reviews and reconciles insurance premium amortization schedules and master data request in order to ensure complete and accurate regulatory filings and cost recovery. Responds timely and accurately to internal and external data requests and inquiries regarding insurance programs and premium allocations.  Monitors the receipt of insurance binders, policies and endorsements. Manages the safekeeping of original insurance policies.  Conducts ad-hoc risk studies and quantitative analysis as required. Develops reports summarizing analytical results and recommendations. Ensures proper documentation of decisions.  Manages the liability and property certificate of insurance program (COI) and letters of self-insurance. Reviews evidence of insurance from third parties and determines compliance with Company standards and contractual requirements.  Supports workers compensation insurance placement, regulatory compliance and program oversight.  Essential Education, Skills, and Environment  Education and Work Experience  Master’s Degree in the area of specialty from an accredited school and 1 year of experience.  or  Bachelor’s Degree in the area of specialty from an accredited school and 3 years of related experience.  Candidates that do not possess a bachelor’s degree must have a minimum of 7 years of related work experience.  Specialized Knowledge and Skills Demonstrated knowledge of:Overall business, the sources of risk, and potential options for mitigation.Accounting and financial analysis.Skills such as:Analytical and quantitative analysis, written, communication and organizational.Managing Internal and external relationships. Equipment and Applications  PCs, word processing, spreadsheet and database software.  Work Environment and Physical Demands  General office environment. No special physical demands required.

Name: Operations Senior Associate - Consulting (Gaming & Hospitality)
Description: RSM’s Gaming & Hospitality practice has an immediate opening for an Operations Associate with deep interest and experience in Consulting. This position is an internal and client-facing role that is responsible for reviewing the clients’ business needs and providing support in regards to engagement delivery life cycle (50% internal project management and 50% external client consulting). The successful candidate must demonstrate willingness to go the extra mile for the team's success. He or she will be a problem solver, creative thinker, and fast learner, be detail-oriented and interested in learning RSM’s consulting business. This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who loves project management and has experience across the consulting landscape.  Project Manager Responsibilities (50%)  · Provide assistance for time-sensitive tasks for Gaming & Hospitality leadership.  · Work with leadership to coordinate risk mitigation, process improvement, communication, and support needs affecting the successful delivery of client solutions.  · Monitor the progress of the teams’ engagements as it relates to budgeting and billing.  · Develop internal and external meeting objectives, agendas, and slide decks; document meeting outcomes, and follow up on actions items.  · Assist leadership with ongoing support of practice management reports, staffing processes.  Consulting Responsibilities (50%)  · Leveraging knowledge of the Gaming & Hospitality practice, support leadership in execution of strategic or tactical imperatives.  · Start to develop an understanding of services and solutions offered by the practice.  o Ability to assess, establish, and organize internal control projects for implementation.  o Assist in providing a variety of financial and operational consulting services.  o Identifies and defines clients’ financial and operating problems, assesses client needs and assumes responsibility for scoping engagements, developing work programs, fee estimates, and proposing engagements Qualifications: · BS/BA in business, accounting, or technology related area or equivalent experience.  · 2+ years of previous project or team management/coordination experience.  · Prior consulting experience is preferred.  · Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously.  · Must be a team player and be able to effectively interact with staff at all levels of the firm.  · Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint.  · Ability to prepare presentations including charts, graphics and tables, speaker notes & handouts, etc.  · Willingness to travel up to 50%You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.  Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.  RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.Job ID req6712Line of Business: Internal Client ServiceSubFunction: FAS IFA Natl Gaming & HospJob Type: Full TimeReq #: req6712Location:  300 South 4th Street, Suite 1200, , Las Vegas, NVRegion: West RegionJob Category: Business Consulting/TechnologyEmployment Type: ExperiencedDegree Required: BachelorTravel: Yes
