Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Talent Pool
Description: Caesars Entertainment is seeking candidates interested in the Senior Financial Analyst position. Candidates that meet the criteria below will be considered for future openings.  The Senior Financial Analyst is responsible for analyzing financial data relating to budget and financial statements and preparing communications, presentations and reports. The Senior Financial Analyst is a critical role in the success of Caesars Entertainment being able to deliver its mission, vision and values. In this role, you will:Prepare and analyzes reports on financial results on a monthly and quarterly basis, identify trends, explaining variances, track spend, forecastingWork closely with other department leadership on financial matters relating to the budget and financial statement analysis.Develop operational process mapping and ensuring compliant with SOX initiativesAssist in streamlining and improving processes, work product, and outputCreate and prepare PowerPoint presentation and custom reports for Senior LeadershipSupport key initiatives to promote and achieve a culture of service excellence and employee engagement.Special Projects support the team in gathering, analyzing, and presenting data related to special projectsConduct ad-hoc analysis as necessary including, but not exclusive to, operations performance reviews, financial modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis, budgeting and capital planning support, and other key business functionsEnsure that the analyses are thoughtful, insightful, and professionally structuredHelp leadership get the most out of standard analytical tools & reports - serve as translator / interpreter to local audience & conditionsDevelop and support production reports for departments across the enterpriseRegularly synthesize data into actionable recommendations and presentationsProactively research business trends across functions and communicate findings to Senior LeadershipPerform other job related duties as assigned Must Haves Bachelor degree in related field (MBA preferred)2 years of relevant experience Accounting/Finance, Analytics, AuditExperience producing analysis, creating reports, communications and presentationsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsAbility to solve difficult or complex problems with effective solutionsAbility to manage multiple tasks concurrently in a changing environmentAbility to uphold and demonstrate the highest level of integrity in all situations and recognize standards required by a regulated businessDetail-oriented and ability to manage time, handle frequent deadlines and meet service level agreementsAbility to provide excellent internal customer serviceAbility to be a self-starter with strong analytical skill and have the ability to work independentlyAbility to get along with co-workers and work as a teamA neat and professional appearanceIntermediate knowledge of computer software: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerpointMust be technically skilled and have experience using data analysis tools including MS Office products; must be able to quickly learn relevant industry database applications and software Nice to Haves Gaming or hospitality industry experienceAdvanced Excel skill setHyperion or Oracle GLSDL2017

Name: RPA Analyst
Description: Company SummaryJoin our team! As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American Title Insurance Company (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. We have been entrusted with helping our customers achieve and protect their dream of homeownership since 1889. First American Title’s Direct division provides comprehensive title insurance protection and professional settlement services for real estate purchases, refinances and equity loans.We believe that our people are the key to the company’s continued success. Because our employees enable our future, we invest in theirs by supporting their careers and promoting their overall wellbeing. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2018 list for the third consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, visit www.firstam.com.Job SummaryEssential FunctionsTechnical and implementation focus is on providing standard applications to resolve business needs/issues.Participates in identifying business system requirements and related business/application solutions for a specific business need.Gathers customer requirements for customized system solutions and provides alternative solutions.Writes and maintains system documentationProvides training and support directly to customers.Job ComplexitiesWorks on requirements or problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriateFollows department processes and procedures and may make recommendations to improve these processes.Validate and/or create Quality Assurance Test Cases and/or perform testing.Supervision Received or ExtendedWorks under general supervision of more experienced Business Systems Analysts.Actively contributes to the results of a team and works towards achieving team goals and objectives.Uses expertise of more senior level Business Systems Analysts and leverages additional resources to confirm solution or explore customized applications as a solution.No supervision of othersKnowledge and Skills/Technology UsedHas basic knowledge of general business environment/operation and has general cost benefit awareness.Solid working knowledge of standard features/functions of one or more application to field, analyze and resolve customer issues/problems.Good written and oral communication skills in order to define parameters to meet business requirements.Identifies/receives problem, researches alternatives, prepares presentations, drives solutions, tests to confirm, gains consensus, and implements solutions for defined business processes.Creates documentation of business processes, training procedures, and standard operating procedures.Has basic understanding of Data Analysis and/or relational databases.Has basic understanding of system integrations and supporting technologies.Standard Microsoft Office skill set.Typical EducationTypically requires BS degree or equivalent combination of education and experienceTypical Range of ExperienceTypically 2-5 years of directly related experience First American invests in its employee’s development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

Name: IAM Systems Analyst
Description: ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSResponsible for participation on multiple project teams and  provides Caesars with innovative business solutions that fit system  constraints, meet user needs and match the company’s strategic outlook.  Performs application analysis and design, development, integration and  enhancement activities, as well as implementation and related maintenance and  documentation.  Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to the  following:  ·  Analyze existing systems and databases, and  recommend enhancements to solve identified business needs. Apply working  knowledge of application components (e.g. file structures) in conjunction with  query tools to solve identified business needs. Able to use requirement  gathering templates/protocols to collect information. ·  Perform all aspects of internal system  acceptance testing, ensuring delivery of well-tested system enhancements, and  further ensuring systems meet business requirements. May perform daily supervision of a  cross-functional testing team, where appropriate, in preparing system and  integration test data, testing and reporting test results to programming and to  management.  ·  Trouble-shoot incidents reported by end-users,  escalating where necessary to schedule system changes, and discussing  resolutions with end-users to arrive at a permanent solution.  ·  Keep abreast of current technology in both  hardware and software to recommend business solutions that fit system  constraints, meet user needs, and match the company's strategic outlook.  ·  Attend training classes and seminars designed to  advance skills and creative capabilities.  Develop and maintain good written and oral communication skills. Participate in training of users on new  capabilities.Produce and maintain product documentation,  training materials and problem diagnosis materials. ·  Advise user departments about functional design  and impact on departmental operations.  Consult with user departments in the analysis of manual and automated  systems; assists in presentation of detailed functional specifications,  formats, and templates. Suggests  solutions to problems presented that fit within the operating limitations of  equipment.  ·  Support business needs and objectives by  investigation of user needs and development of innovative ideas for solutions. Coordinate, analyze and schedule system  change requests.  ·  Participate in feasibility and conceptual  design, functional design, and general design studies.  ·  Advise user departments in the development  and/or change of departmental procedures.  ·  Communicate and explain business requirements  design to other team members, including user interface and integrated  performance support, programmers and analysts, documentation providers, and  training, implementation, and support personnel ensuring business requirements  are well-understood and implemented.  ·  Project management techniques demonstrated. Ability to use problem solving  approaches, effective communication in various settings and with a variety  of audiences, strategic thinking and planning, etc to achieve the required  outcome with teams both internal and external.Establish and maintain good working relationships, be tactful and  foster an ethical work environment; give proper credit to others.Demonstrate  knowledge of defects and issues. Can recognize a defect, a user error,  training issue, data issue, etc. in the testing context.Demonstrate knowledge in the distinct phases of testing  and can articulate them clearly.Write simple to moderate test scripts and prepare simple  to moderate test data.Casino / Hotel  operations are 24X7; expectation is for resource to be part of the on call  24X7 support rotation.KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE3 years work experience in job with systems analysis and  design, implementation, training, and testing required in Identity and Access  Management.  Working knowledge of Active Directory, a must.  Experience working with SailPoint Identity IQ and/or Okta (or  similar applications).  Requires basic knowledge of SQL scripting, database uses and  design, spreadsheets, word processing and operating systems. Basic knowledge of systems analysis and  design. Experience in Windows hardware  installation, OS patching, SW upgrades, and diagnostics, this is usually  acquired through previous business systems experience.  Basic knowledge of project management techniques preferred.  Enjoys challenges  and can multitask.  Self-starter and  can work well alone or with a team.  Additional  consideration will be given to the following skill sets; working knowledge of  Caesar's Entertainment systems and processes.EDUCATIONBachelor's degree, or equivalent technical education, in  Computer Sciences, Management Sciences, System Access/Security, or Systems Engineering  field preferred.

Name: Lead Business Intelligence Developer (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.  The Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Developer will design, develop and maintain reporting and analytics applications for the Enterprise Analytics organization. This position will partner with the Enterprise Analytics team to drive Business Intelligence strategy, assess and implement Business Intelligence tools, facilitate user adoption of BI assets, and develop OLAP and semantic data layers for BI consumption. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts International policies, practices, and procedures. Design, develop and support reporting and analytics applications leveraging tools such as Cognos BI, Microsoft Power BI, Cognos TM1, and Microsoft Analysis Services technologies.Gather and translate requirements from end-users to develop and maintain the BI architecture.Lead the development of Cognos Framework Manager packages, Cognos Transformer cubes, Microsoft Power BI models, and other BI assets that will be consumed by the Enterprise Analytics team to build reports and dashboards as well as to perform ad-hoc analysis.Design, develop, and support the semantic data layer.Design, develop, and support multi-dimensional analysis with various OLAP technologies.Partner with the Data Services team and Information Management team for data integration and data modeling needs.Partner with the Master Data Management and Data Governance teams to ensure that reporting solutions will use governed KPIs and approved data sources.Provide input to the overall Business Intelligence strategy for the enterprise.Participate in Proof of Concepts and product evaluations.Lead the development of BI solutions using various data sources (e.g. SQL relational and multi-dimensional, unstructured data, TM1, and Power Play cubes.)Provide support to the Enterprise Analytics organization to resolve application issues in a timely manner.Perform data analysis to troubleshoot data issues with the BI solutions and data integration processes.Provide training to internal customers and drive solution adoption.Lead and guide other BI analysts and developers on the team.Provide strategic direction, perform code reviews, and ensure that all products that are designed/built adhere to Enterprise Analytics standards and development best practices.Embrace internal support methodologies and SDLC best practices and continuously strive to improve the systems and processes.Other job duties as assigned.Required:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management or related field.At least 6 years of technology implementation and development experience with a Business Intelligence tool.Previous experience in managing projects, tasks, and people.Expert level understanding of Structured Query Language (SQL).Solid understanding of data integration technologies and database concepts.Experience with OLAP Architecture and Administration.Experience in Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, multi-dimensional cubes, and relational models.Experience in data management or computer programming.Experience with tools such as Cognos Framework Manager, Cognos Transformer, Cognos TM1, Microsoft Analysis Services, and Microsoft Power BI.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Master’s DegreeClient facing, able to converse in clear concise manner with business customersExperience with Cloud technologies such as Azure and modern ecosystems

Name: ASP.net Developer (Senior Applications Analyst)
Description: Bachelor’s degree in a computer related field and 5 years’ progressive related experience, or equivalent training and experience.Candidate should be an object oriented programmer, preferably in ASP.NET, C#.NET, APEX or JAVA.Must possess strong analytical skills, and good testing and debugging skills.Must possess excellent customer service skills and good oral and written communication skills.Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast-paced, changing environment.Applicant selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation.Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing. MSTS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. MSTS is a background screening, drug-free workplace. Candidate will be an object oriented programmer, preferably in ASP.NET, C#.NET, APEX or JAVA.Candidate is expected to also support existing in-house developed applications and commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) applications, with emphasis on supporting the Maximo Asset Management application.We are looking for a person who is a team player and has strong experience developing and supporting applications.Advanced knowledge of technical principles, theories, standards, practices and procedures in software development.Candidate will write program code from internal specification documentation or outdated application code and prepare test plans, test data, run tests, observe results and correct program code to resolve any differences from specifications.Assist in the administration and technical responsibility of COTS applications including support for users, translating business requirements into enhancements; configuring and testing changes; maintaining and monitoring system security and permissions; and coordinating activities with other team members, the application owner, and IT.Knowledge of SQL Server and Oracle relational databases is a must. Telecommuting or teleworking may be a possibility for this position.Candidate may provide direction to less experienced staff.If you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place! At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We’re dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Join us!  MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

Name: Senior Analyst - Compensation
Description: Position Overview: The primary responsibility of the Senior Analyst – Compensation is to perform a wide range of compensation functions, including administering compensation programs and administers the HR budget. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and The Venetian | The Palazzo Casino Resort’s policies, practices, and procedures. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Processes requests for new positions by performing appropriate job description audit, job analysis/evaluations, and relevant research considering both internal equity and external factors to support competitive, cost effective and compliant positioning of compensation recommendations and decisions.Administers the annual HR budget with respect to cost and headcount.Prepares all quarterly compensation submissions.Partners with the appropriate HR function (e.g., Management, TM Relations, Talent Acquisition, etc.) in the successful execution of all salary change requests, including promotions and transfers, to ensure they are within Compensation guidelines.Partners with the appropriate HR functions to obtain finalized job descriptions by ensuring approved versions are catalogued appropriately and communicated to Talent Acquisition and Management.Participates in approved local salary benchmarking surveys/market and best practice research, and analyzes appropriate responses as needed by managing the necessary research, data retrieval, computation, manipulation, analysis, preparation, review and submission of data surrounding total compensation.Maintains up to date knowledge of current and new legislation as it relates to best HR practices and generally accepted management principles.Prepares compensation related ad hoc and scheduled reports and develops tools to support forecasting and planning.Ensures compliance with FLSA, DOL, federal, state and local regulations regarding pay and compensation.Obtains guidance and interpretation of compensation policies and programs, and evaluates requests for changes and updates.Documents methodology, assumptions, and decisions on compensation issues to ensure consistency of decisions.Identifies opportunities for process improvements and introduction of best practices.Makes program recommendations to ensure competitive pay, retention and motivation.Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job.Performs other related duties as assigned.Additional Duties & Responsibilities:Company Standards of Conduct All Venetian | Palazzo Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company’s standards, work requirements and rules of conduct. Additional Duties & Responsibilities:Additional Duties & Responsibilities:Minimum Qualifications:21 years of age.Proof of authorization/eligibility to work in the United States.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, preferably in Human Resources, Business Management, Finance, Accounting, or Economics.3 years of experience in administering various Compensation programs; hospitality industry preferred.Knowledge and experience identifying and completing comprehensive salary surveys.Demonstrated knowledge and experience developing and implementing base pay, and cash incentive programs.Analytical skills to conduct analysis and develop recommendations.Working knowledge of Human Resources policies and procedures.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both in spoken and written form.Must be able to obtain and maintain any certification or license, as required by law or policy.Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience.Must be able to work varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidays.Physical Requirements: Must be able to: Lift or carry 20 pounds, unassisted, in the performance of specific tasks, as assigned.Physically access all areas of the property and drive areas with or without a reasonable accommodation.Maintain composure under pressure and consistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts.Ability to interact appropriately and effectively with guests, management, other team members, and outside contacts.Ability for prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneel.Work in a fast-paced and busy environment.Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke.

Name: Deskside Analyst I
Description: Position Overview: The primary responsibility of the Deskside Analyst, Level I is to provide support in analyzing, diagnosing, troubleshooting and resolving incidents for Team Members and Guests related to workstations, printers, applications and POS devices within Gaming, Hotel, Front of House, Heart of House and Retail locations. All duties are to be performed in accordance with department and The Venetian | The Palazzo Casino Resort's policies, practices, and procedures. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: * Address Team Member incidents and Guest technical support issues. * Fulfill service requests and project tasks as scheduled and in a timely manner. * Perform scheduled preventative maintenance on workstations and peripherals. * Write well-structured work notes, resolution notes and tracking level of effort expended on incidents, service delivery and project tasks for Deskside utilization reporting. * Control and prioritize work queue that may include incidents, requests and projects as well as providing status updates on assignments and identification of proper escalation points. * Make recommendations for updates or new knowledgebase items. * Provide hardware and software support to local and remote end-users, including hands-on support and basic tutoring/instruction when necessary. * Handle problem recognition, research, resolution and follow-up for routine user problems. * Incident Management: Analyze, triage, diagnose and resolve complex, technical customer problems. * Service Delivery: Recommend solutions, configure and deploy hardware, install software, setup large special events and perform preventative maintenance activities. * Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job. * Performs other related duties as assigned. Additional Duties & Responsibilities: Additional Duties & Responsibilities: Additional Duties & Responsibilities: Minimum Qualifications: Company Standards of Conduct All Venetian | Palazzo Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company's standards, work requirements and rules of conduct. Team Members are expected to behave in a manner that supports a harmonious work environment to help us deliver unmatched service to our guests and customers. Minimum Qualifications * 21 years of age. * Proof of authorization/eligibility to work in the United States. * Minimum of six months of related technical support and customer service experience or possess an AA or AS Degree. * Strong analytical and problem solving skills. * In-depth knowledge of Windows operating systems required. * Technical certifications of Microsoft, ITIL, Network or Security Certification, preferred. * Ability to diagnose problems by reading log files and using network or application diagnostics tools. * Ability to communicate effectively in a positive/upbeat fashion utilizing English, both in spoken and written form. * Maintain a professional, neat and well-groomed appearance adhering to Company appearance standards. * Maintain consistent adherence to The Venetian and Palazzo Unmatched Guest Service Standards. * Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays. * Must be able to obtain and maintain any certification or license, as required by law or policy. * Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience. * Must be able to work varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidays. Physical Requirements: Must be able to: * Work in a fast-paced, results oriented and busy environment. * Maintain composure under pressure and consistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts. * Ability to interact appropriately and effectively with guests, management, other Team Members, and outside contacts. * Physically access all areas of the property and drive areas with or without a reasonable accommodation. * Use office equipment, including but not limited to computer, monitor, keyboard, mouse, printer, scanner, copier, fax, etc. * Must be able to withstand prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneeling. * Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke.SDL2017

Name: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212776  Seeking a Cerner Millennium Foreign System Interface support analyst. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation. Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core build and functionality.  ? Review interface design specs and integrate external applications with the Cerner Millennium suite  ? Work with business users to identify requirements for maintaining application tables, dictionaries, and parameters required for system operation and configuration  ? Understand current design and implications to process and workflow  ? Serve as primary contact for application design regarding new requirements  ? Provide support for testing and conversion activities  ? Install patches/fixes provided by the vendor in accordance with change control processes  ? Cerner 2015.01.19 code level  Ability to understand the impact of interface issues on Cerner clinical applications  Expert understanding of both inbound and outbound processing  Expert understanding of both basic matching parameters and special interface configurations (SI_Manager)  Expert knowledge of interface monitoring tools, including all levels of Millennium logging and Olympus server monitoring  Expert knowledge of various levels of scripting required for interfaces  Strong CCL Skills a plus Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran. Name: Licensing Analyst
Description: Position Description  Lottery games are one of the biggest consumer products on the planet and Scientific Games is the world’s largest supplier. Our lottery games have been entertaining and thrilling players since 1973. Most importantly our games fund good causes like education, health and welfare, senior citizens, roads, bridges and the environment.  Scientific Games supports lotteries in more than 50 countries by delivering industry leading marketing and insights, unmatched retailer innovation, developing first class mobile-based products and most recently launching our virtual SG Sports betting platform.  We are looking for employees interested in helping Scientific Games strengthen our position as the world’s foremost leader in lottery products and services.  Job Summary: The person in this position works closely with management to ensure compliance with all Federal, State and Tribal Gaming licensing requirements, regulations and ordinances as well as regulatory related reports and information. Completes and submits all documentation related to gaming applications for the Company, its subsidiaries, management and field personnel.  Position Requirements Essential Job Functions:Complete all aspects of gaming licensing applications and/or gaming submissions including, but not limited to, completing detailed forms, writing letters and gathering documentation.Ensure timeliness, completeness and accuracy of each gaming applications and reports submitted on behalf of the Company.Maintain summary reports and/or database systems.Review and monitor the submission of license applications and/or gaming submissions.Prepare and update source documents used in applications and/or submissions.Review correspondence from gaming regulatory agencies and determine action required and prepare necessary correspondence , documents, check requests and other written communication.Maintain database of verbal and written communication with gaming regulatory agencies.Maintain appropriate communications within and between various divisions.Support company policies and procedures; make appropriate recommendations.Maintain electronic filing systems according to departmental procedures.Maintain and secure confidential information.Submit reports as required by each regulatory agency.Other duties as assigned.Qualifications:Required:Associates Degree, Certified Legal Assistant, Paralegal or experience deemed equivalentDetail oriented with strong organizational skillsAbility to multi-taskMature disposition with the ability to handle deadlinesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsProficient in Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, software applications, databases and spreadsheetsProficient in conducting internet researchPreferred:Bachelor’s DegreeLicensing and/or regulatory experienceAbility to read, write and speak Spanish or any other languageWork Conditions: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, “SG”) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. As a prerequisite to employment with SG (to the extent permitted by law), you shall be asked to consent to SG conducting a due diligence/background investigation on you.  This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The employee in this position may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities than those stated above.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If you’d like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: EEOC Poster.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If you’d like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here EEOC Poster.

Name: Senior PeopleSoft Developer/ Technical Analyst (Senior Applications An
Description: Job DescriptionIf you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place!At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. Name: Associate Analyst
Description: The AssociateAnalyst position will be responsible for all aspects of underwriting and due diligence for commercial real estate transactions including stabilized, value-add, and development type transactions. Applicants should have 2-3 years of experience in a similar background. We expect the candidate to be able to work in a fast-paced environment, organizing and executing multiple projects at once while demonstrating the potential to handle a larger role as the company grows.  This position is located in Las Vegas, NV. Duties &ResponsibilitiesPrepares underwriting of commercial real estate properties based on historical financial statements, projections, and market standards to determine a projected income, and valuation of the asset(s).Assists with all due diligence relating to new investments.Gathers market data including demographics, sales and rent comparables, supply absorption, and employment statistics for understanding feasibility.Assist with drafting investment memos to be presented to lenders and investment committees.Provides loan closing coordination including collecting due diligence items, ordering third party reports, coordinating with all parties including borrowers, lenders and legal counsels, and acting as liaison with the servicing department.Monitors and analyzes the financial performance of the portfolio and individual properties.Assists in the preparation of investment reports in compliance with company guidelines and investor requirements.Assists with financing and disposition transactions.QualificationsBachelors degree, preferably with a major in Real Estate, Finance, or Business Administration.2-3 years of experience in commercial real estate/investment banking/private equity.Demonstrated analytical skills and underwriting related experience, preferably with all commercial property types.Strong computer knowledge and skills including in-depth expert knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, & PowerPoint).Ability to prioritize and to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet, professional manner.Eye for detail, accuracy is imperative.Excellent organizational and analytical skills.Ability to be an effective team member and display initiative.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsBenefits Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision  Matching 401k  Job Type: Full-time

Name: QA Analyst-Intermediate

Responsibilities include installing and configuring software and hardware, analyzing specifications, designing and executing test cases, running automation scripts, creating defect reports, setting up and maintaining hardware integration test lab and working with Development to troubleshoot issues. The Intermediate Quality Assurance Analyst will perform some or all of the following types of testing: functional, regression, integration, usability, and load/performance. requirements Create detailed bug reports that allow Development to easily understand and correct the issue Maintain accurate records on all tests performed and related results Work with Development to troubleshoot issues Provide Project Status to QA Lead Recommend and follow established Quality Assurance standards, processes and procedures Meet deadlines and date commitments for the department Work to ensure the delivery of high quality products and documentation in a timely manner Willing to travel to/within the United States up to 50% of working hours to support development team during product installations/onsite maintenance or to test products at certification labs Troubleshoot field issues Execute simple database queries Develop submission documentation for product submissions Proficient with products and associated functionality to which he/she has been assigned Will take an active role in Peer Review of test cases written by more junior staff Provides timely status updates to supervisorRequired Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesGood understanding of quality assurance and testing methodologies relative to the Software Development Lifecycle Previous experience with software quality tools (test case management, project planning, automation) Strong Analytical Skills Must be a team player, able to work independently and under tight deadlines Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent PC hardware knowledge and the ability to build and maintain PC components Experience with Casino Gaming Devices Familiar with all PC cables and connectors Knowledge of video and I/O hardware Familiar with Linux is a plusEducation and Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent experience 3-5 years testing experience Experience creating and executing test cases from Functional Specifications Experience assembling and maintaining computer hardware Office Location Las Vegas, NV

Name: IT Systems Analyst II
Description: Positions in this function create and deliver high quality system solutions for our applications, products and services across all technology functions. They consult with users and technology specialists to define business processes and the information systems for supporting those processes. Individuals in these roles may perform analysis and also serve as business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. They provide technical support in developing systems that are cost effective and meet users requirements.  This function works to create systems that work together in a cohesive manner, enforcing standards and methods consistently across the enterprise. Roles may support both current system improvements and maintenance along with new system development. Primary Responsibilities: Solid organizational skills and focus on accuracy and attention to detail.  Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities  Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment  Providing accurate and timely estimates for tasks  Provide support and leadership in critical production support issue resolution  Support the team for application availability, reliability and stability on a 7 by 24 by 365 basis  Conduct or facilitate root cause analysis on all in-scope incidents and recommend a corrective action plan  Work with team to achieve timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreements  Work with business to prioritize production issue resolution.  Work with business segments to better define project requirements for development and implementation  Assesses and interprets customer needs and requirements  Translate requirements into technical specifications  Work with external vendors to troubleshoot and resolve complex software issues.

Name: Associate Reporting Analyst

We need your organizational talents and business discipline to help fuel ours. It's the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)Positions in this function include those responsible for running daily and weekly data integrity reports. Assist in maintenance/revisions of existing operational reports. Provide operational analysis utilized for decision making. Name: Management Analyst 4
Description: The Position  Management Analysts conduct a variety of studies, research and analysis of management and administrative areas such as budgeting and financial analysis; departmental operations; legislative analysis; management research; and statistical and informational analysis.  Incumbents function as managers who train, supervise and evaluate the performance of subordinate supervisors; develop policies and procedures; and allocate staff and resources to accomplish goals and objectives.  This position is with the Department of Business & Industry, Housing Division in Las Vegas. The incumbent will work with our Division Administrator and Deputies to support the development of legislative drafts and provide for internal audit support. This position has the primary oversight and management of the Division's programmatic dashboard and will provide for divisional metrics and reporting to evaluate various programs and look for areas to assist in the proper distribution of these resources. This position will provide the Division with complex technical analysis on current Divisional processes and procedures to ensure compliance with Federal, State and Local guidelines. The incumbent will assist and work with our Grants and Projects team on the awards and contracting processes as the division reviews and looks to improve its policies and procedures relating to the Qualified Allocation Plan, Emergency Solutions Grant, HOME Program, and Low-Income Housing Trust Fund program. Additionally, the MA 4 will work with our teams to provide recommendations on our extensive programs and help us to leverage our websites, social media sources and other forms of outreach that we are currently utilizing. This would include the evaluation of views, reach and demographics for social media engagement regarding home ownership programs and our online apartment search function. In addition, helping to expand the reach of our Affordable Housing Advocate through these channels along with Weatherization assistance and Lot Rent Subsidy awareness.This position requires the incumbent to pass a criminal background check and travel up to 25%. * THIS RECRUITMENT MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF APPLICATIONS RECEIVED. QUALIFIED APPLICANTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. *  To see full Class Specifications visit: http://hr.nv.gov/Resources/ClassSpecs/Class_Specifications-7_0/ To Qualify: In order to be qualified, you must meet the following requirements:  Education and Experience (Minimum Qualifications) Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in public or business administration, finance, social sciences, mathematics or related field and four years of professional experience in the research, development, evaluation or revision of programs, organizations, methods or procedures; OR one year of experience as a Management Analyst III in Nevada State service; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience on a year-for-year basis. Special Notes The ability to travel at least 25% of the time is required. Special Requirements A State of Nevada/FBI background check will be required of the selected applicant.

Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: **Req No.** 17663BR**Job Posting Title** Sales Operations Analyst**Location** NV - Las Vegas**Shift** Day**Employment Status** Full Time**Description** As member of the Sales Operations team, the primary focus of the position is to provide opportunity management, sales analysis and reporting in support of the sales division. This position will work with Sales to manage the sales opportunity pipeline, create metrics, analyze sales, opportunity and order data to develop sales/demand forecasts and support our annual census. In addition, this position will develop management reporting and dashboards, help drive business process improvements and support the development of automated tools and applications to increase efficiency and accuracy of analyses and reporting. Analysis will include market share, product mix, funnel coverage, opportunity sales cycle, customer buying trends and sales trends. The position will also interact with key departments in support of the sales forecast including finance, operations, order management and product management.**First Year Goals**? Collaborate with Sales Operations and key contacts to understand the products, markets, and customers? Work with Sales to manage opportunity pipeline and develop sales forecasts? Provide analysis and management reports to support weekly Sales reporting cadence and census? Demonstrate knowledge of Salesforce.com, SAP, Tableau and associated reporting tools.?Drive development of key management dashboards**Required Qualifications**? Bachelor's degree required or equivalent experience in an analyst role? 3+ years of experience as an analyst preferably with a considerable sales focus? Advanced knowledge of Excel, data management and report development preferably using SAP, Salesforce.com and Tableau? Strong analytical skills? Data accuracy, attention to detail, and ability to present data in a professional manner? Highly motivated and able to work independently and manage priorities effectively**Special requirements needed** Security Investigation**Keys To Success**? Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity.? Build collaborative relationships both internally and externally? Decision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve.? Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles.? Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneself? Foster innovationPosting Code: ~cb~ #LI-KK1

Name: Financial Analyst - Resident Shows Division
Description: Financial Analyst – Resident Shows DivisionRegular PositionCirque du Soleil is much more than just a show: it’s also you. At the center of Cirque's creative energy are talented people with a passion for challenging their own limits. Life at Cirque is about creating wonderment with colleagues of enlightening talent and to do so, at nothing less than the speed of light. Together, we work hard, juggle priorities, sometimes shift trajectories, always have loads of fun and, above all, dare to reinvent ourselves, to reach for and to meet new challenges.Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the Financial Analyst, Revenue will provide support and analyses to Resident Shows management to enable the efficient management of human and financial resources.The ideal candidate will be viewed as a trusted business advisor and must demonstrate excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, be highly organized, self-motivated, and a solution-oriented problem-solver with the ability to handle a variety of tasks independently and efficiently. Additionally, this individual must be energetic, ethical, and desire a challenging work environment.The primary responsibility of the Financial Analyst, Revenue is to assist in all phases of revenue forecasting and reporting, including daily-weekly-monthly reporting, dash-boarding of key metrics, and ad-hoc business analysis for Cirque du Soleil resident show division.You will be a champion at:· Developing in-depth knowledge of show revenue and serving as a business advisor to management;· Developing the annual budgets (per show, per day revenue projections), and monthly forecasting of revenue for all shows;· Ensuring the accuracy and completeness of revenue results of the all shows;· Analyzing and reviewing periodic results with Resident Shows management;· Identifying opportunities to improve the consistency and accuracy of the financial information;· Producing strategic analyses and what-if business analysis to optimize management decision making;· Promoting compliance with the organization’s financial policies and procedures· Monitoring and assuring Cirque and Partner compliance with the terms and conditions of the Performance Agreement;· Serving as a financial liaison between Cirque’s Executive team, the Shows, and the Partner;· Providing finance support for the development of new tools and methods to support internal customers;· Assisting in formulating and implementing new financial systems, tools, and methods;· Assisting in development and daily preparation of revenue related managerial reports used for tracking and analysis;· Preparing and distributing various daily, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports in accordance with established practices and procedures;· Preparing various managerial reports for executive review;· Performing all other job related duties as requested.Ideally, you will have:· Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field;· Four to six years of relevant business experience; 2 years in revenue analytics;· Detail oriented with an ability to see the larger picture in order to make decisions;· Strong working knowledge of Microsoft tools (Word, PowerPoint, Access);· Advanced Excel skills required;· Experience with an ERP or comparable business information system, (SAP an asset) and reporting tools (‘Longview’ is a plus);· Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to achieve results through proactive research;· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;· Excellent organizational skills to function effectively with attention to detail while meeting targeted deadlines;· Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills;· Experience with SQL Language and Tableau is an asset;· Fluency in English; French is an asset.

Name: Associate Operations Analyst
Description: Associate Operations AnalystOperations Analysts have responsibility for reporting associate performance metrics, analyzing trends, forecasting needs and maintaining reports and processes. They are responsible for collecting, summarizing, inputting and analyzing data for various internal and external reports. Operations Analysts need to have a thorough understanding of how to interpret client business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. They extract and compile data from different databases, utilize various reporting tools plus Excel and Access to produce reports based upon end user needs. Operations Analysts review the data to evaluate and analyze quotas for customer satisfaction, service volume, timeliness, etc. Operations Analysts have to have an ability to automate manual processes, tasks; ability to complete data analysis and reporting including action plans to improve deficiencies. Operations Analysts are expected to have a thorough working knowledge of TeleTech’s policies and procedures as well as client requirements, expectations and metrics.Key Performance ObjectivesAchieve 100> of accuracy and timeliness of reports and analysis. Operations Analysts have daily, weekly, and monthly reports that must be run in timely and accurate manner, and they are given tasks, which must be met on time. They work with multiple data sets to ensure complete and accurate data. Operations Analysts need to meet timeliness requirements for metrics collections, reporting, utilize appropriate resources to generate solutions and drive associates performance through analysis of metrics and different data. (Time management, achievement motivation, results orientation, efficiency, accountability)Learn key business objectives, timeframes, and requirements associated with each reporting and analytical goal and task. Operations Analysts understand the client’s business requirements and business process management, and then translate them to particular software requirements. They need to have high level of knowledge of TeleTech’s and client’s practices, policies, and requirements and having a thorough understanding of systems and tools that are used to extract data, run reports and be able to do analysis to drive associates performance. Operations Analysts assist management with certain aspects of the annual planning process that may include preparation of forecasts, cost benefit analysis for system or process changes, invoices process, revenue assurance, etc. Operations Analysts need to adapt quickly to any changes in the process. Be able to troubleshoot issues, analyze data to uncover and report issues that might impact data and metrics. Understand the requirements for each task while strictly adhering to TeleTech’s policies. (Attention to detail and process, follow-through, technical knowledge, ability to learn, analysis)Understand and improve the key success metrics associated with each goal. These include:Reporting accuracy - 95> tickets close without errors Ability to close project/ticket in timely manner based on current departmental criteriaCustomer Satisfaction (CSAT)Operations Analysts should gather information, analyze data, observe the process and participate in efforts to constantly look for opportunities to improve current analysis process and communicate their ideas to their managers regularly. (Observation, innovation, creativity, collaboration, communication)Deliver consistent high quality customer service. Operations Analysts respond to all customer (internal/external) requests within the established time frames. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver solutions as needed. Maintain a positive, respectful and caring attitude when working with others. Communicate problems clearly and reassure customers that issues will be resolved quickly and deliver with minimum long term impact. Proactively share all issues with management. Take personal responsibility for solving and finding solutions. (Customer focus, friendly, helpful, accountability, diplomacy, communication)Escalate department issues as appropriate. Clearly identify reporting or analysis related issues including the scope of the problem and relative urgency. Provide clear documentation of the issue to the appropriate team. Answer questions and assist in isolating the root cause of problems. Participate in testing solutions to ensure problems have been resolved. (Analysis, problem solving, judgment, communication, system troubleshooting)Basic QualificationsStrong understanding of Teletech’s business, core values, and goalsStrong interpersonal skills in dealing with a diverse populationHigh customer service orientationHigh level of integrity, honesty, and judgmentAbility to respect and ensure strict confidentiality of customer data.Demonstrated multi-tasking capability and proven success in fast paced environmentStrong attention to detail and desire to follow proceduresStrong verbal and written communication skillsWorking knowledge of database applications such as MS Office(Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Oracle, Kronos or ability to learn technology quicklyStrong analytical, logic and statistical skillsReportingTroubleshootingPreferred QualificationsKnowledge of call center businessCall center experienceSix Sigma CertificationTTEC requires all employees hired in the United States to successfully pass a background check and depending on location and client program a drug test, as a condition of employment. Name: Regional Reporting Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY This position will perform the Sales and Marketing and Yield reporting at an individual site and regional level to supply reporting information to upper and middle management for business decisions and assist management with reporting needs. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSUsing business intelligence tools to perform data-mining, provide statistics and analyze data to identify trends that could help isolate areas of opportunities for business growth and performance improvements.Collects data from various sources including staff and management level, creates and revises reports, and provides accurate information to management.Uses analytical skills to make reporting more efficient and valuable.Performs statistical analysis and specific projects to assist management and department business partners.Evaluates existing reports to ensure the most efficient methodology is employed or provides recommendations to increase productivity.Analyzes penetration monthly for individual site performance including arrivals, tours, volume, volume per guest (VPG), and transactions compared to budget. Specific skills and abilities include, but are not limited to the following: Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.Excellent customer service skills.Proficient in time management; the ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.Ability to take initiative and effectively adapt to changes.Able to establish and maintain a cooperative working relation.Ability to interpret and create spreadsheets.Able to use sound judgment; work independently, with minimal supervision.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Able to perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with impending deadlines and/or established timeframes.Performs well with frequent interruptions and/or distractions.Basic - Intermediate - Advanced math skills.

Name: Intern - Financial Analyst/Hyperion Analyst
Description: Position Description  This internship postion will be a temporary position with an emphasis on on-the-job training. The financial analyst will help create financial analyses and support to various SG Business Units. He/she will learn the financial reporting tools to support the business units in budgeting and forecasting of revenue, capital, and operational expenses. Job Responsibilities:•Day-to-day department responsibilities (reporting, variance analyses, budget presentation prep)•Leverage Hyperion and Essbase to analyze large volumes of information and condense into meaningful and actionable highlights•Assist with key project(s)•Recommend process improvements•Gain valuable work experience and prepare for future career  Position Requirements Position Requirements/Qualifications:•Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four year university in Finance, Business or a technology field •Proven track record of delivering quantifiable resultsSkills/Abilities:•Strong analytical skills and good intuition when reviewing data to identify areas of opportunity•Drive to deliver quantifiable results•Ability to multi-task, use good judgment to balance multiple priorities, meet deadlines and work under pressure•Skill in building trusting relationships and partnerships throughout the organization•Strong interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrated clarity in spoken and written communications•Ability to work well as part of team•Trustworthiness with access to confidential information•Proficiency in Microsoft OfficePhysical Requirements:•Office EnvironmentWork Conditions: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, “SG”) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. As a prerequisite to employment with SG (to the extent permitted by law), you shall be asked to consent to SG conducting a due diligence/background investigation on you. This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The employee in this position may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities than those stated above. SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Name: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212620  CTG is looking for a Clinical IT Associate Application Analyst (Tier 1) will support a large Health System client for CTG Health Solutions and is responsible for providing service desk functionality in support of health care delivery specifically in Epic Systems.  The focus of this position is to provide high First Call Resolution support by responding to inquiries from the user community for requests and incident resolution for Epic application modules.  The person will also assist Management in monitoring the quality and timeliness of response to customer issues and requests, meeting service delivery goals and customer satisfaction levels Qualifications: ? Must have previous experience supporting Ambulatory or Inpatient systems ? either as an analyst or Help Desk resources with Application Specific first call resolution.  ? Prefers prior experience with EpicCare EMR in some capacity ? Trainer, Go Live Command Center, Help Desk Technician, Application Analyst non certified.  ? Must have experience troubleshooting and problem solving end user issues in a healthcare environment.  ? Experience working with customer support/call center ticketing systems.  ? Ability to handle oneself in a professional manner working in a highly stressful environment, at times with impatient customers. Must possess excellent communication and problem-solving skills.  ? Requires the ability to read, write and speak effectively in English. Review and understand customer requirements and specifications.  ? Provide prompt escalation of application/system problems including assisting in determining root cause of problems through to appropriate solutions.  ? Must have a broad understanding of information technology and the ability to adapt to new technologies is essential. Able to deal with ambiguity and change and handle multiple projects and tasks.  ? Must possess ability to function independently and collaborate effectively on a team.  ? Must be self-directed and able to work remotely  ? Overtime and/or weekend work may/will be required depending on the shift schedule. Able to be flexible when necessary to support varied shifts. Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: Seasonal Operations Associate (Consultant)
Description: Job ID: 157815 Store Name/Number: NV-Venetian (0042) Address: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd., Suite# 1001, Las Vegas, NV 89109, United States (US) Hourly/Salaried: Hourly (Non-Exempt) Full Time/Part Time: Part Time Position Type: Temporary Store Operations It takes a lot of behind-the-scenes effort to make sure our stores have the right products in the right place at the right time to fuel our clients' beauty obsessions. That’s where our operations team comes in, to keep our stores looking beautiful and running smoothly "backstage!" This team is the backbone of the store and essential in providing the best possible experience for every client who walks through our doors. Your role at Sephora: As an Operations Associate, you help keep the store running smoothly “backstage” in partnership with the entire operations team.In addition, you will: Complete daily processing and organization of damages, testers, and known theft productEnsure all shipping and receiving activities are completed and executed within the store in a timely mannerReview all visual elements in the store and communicate missing or damaged pieces to the Ops Manager or appropriate store leadershipMaintain and organize the backstage area as neededDemonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Work-Life Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, & InitiativeWe think you’d be a great for this role if you have:Minimum 1-year work experience, preferably in an operations capacityFlexible availability to work during “peak” retail hours such as nights, overnights, weekends, and holidays. In the ops role, you will be required to work early mornings, late evenings, and overnight stock shifts as neededStrong communication skills, ability to multitask, and comfortability with computer/store systemsYou’ll love working here because:The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work withThe product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product, often multiple times a month. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)The education. Sephora heavily invests in training for our store associates – not just product knowledge but building a personalized career plan with you so you can achieve your professional goals The perks. Sephora offers medical benefits, competitive 401k, gift matching, and a 'perks' program that includes various discounts at participating companies (hotels, rental cars, telecommunication, gyms, etc)The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 prestige brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Moet Chandon, Marc Jacobs, Dior, and so many moreOur legal team wants you to know what’s required:Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds and bend/stretch to stock shelvesAdherence to Sephora’s dress code and other policies in the Sephora Employee Handbook

Name: SQL/Tech Support Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Duties and Responsibilities: · Provide world class customer service  · Master all Internal software applications  · Understand casino marketing business processes, interpret customer requests and understand the business requirements for customer requests  · Interpret trace logs  · Read and interpret stored procedures  · Adapt at modifying stored procedures and exhibit a fundamental understanding of the process of testing modified stored procedures prior to implementing in a production system  · Understand rollback and recovery procedures when correcting failed data manipulation attempts  · Identify and troubleshoot SSIS package errors  · Firm understanding of all third party software integration. Examples Include-  o Player Tracking Systems  o Point of Sale Systems  o Property Management Systems  · Ability to troubleshoot and resolve integration and interface incidents  · Troubleshoot and resolve failed player import incidents  · Competency in using Visual Studio during troubleshooting procedures  · Supervise Level I staff in updating and manipulating customer production data  · Fundamental understanding and consistent practice of root cause analysis  · Fundamental understanding of problem management versus incident management  Essential:  o Writing queries  o Updating data  o Joining tables  o Stored procedures  Desirable:  · Two or more years as a support technician  · Training experience  · Two or more years in a casino IT or casino marketing environment  · MS SQL Certification  · Data Base administrator experience  · Understand Software Development Life Cycle

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst  Las Vegas, NV  Job Description: General Summary: The Financial Analyst as an integral part of the financial/strategic planning team by providing analytical expertise and tactical support to operating departments and upper management. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Includes the following (other duties may be assigned):  · Performs complex statistical, cost, and financial analysis of data reported in the various systems.  · Develops financial reports for forecasting, trending, and results analysis.  · Assist with the development and analysis of complex models for events, promotions and reinvestment programs  · Perform profitability analysis on current and proposed business changes  · Provides timely, insightful analysis that includes identifying trends and recommending improvements to senior management.  · Interprets financial transactions and events for users who must make economic or business decisions  · Reviews costs and performs cost benefit analysis to projects and/or programs  · Responsible for daily, weekly and monthly financial reporting to both internal and external groups  · Participates in annual budget preparation and analysis, market performance and forecasting, ad-hoc analysis and presentations and labor staffing analysis  · Uses various software applications, such as spreadsheets and relational databases to assemble, manipulate and/or format data and/or reports.  Provide excellent customer serviceJob Requirements: QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Statistics or Analytics from four-year college or university; or three to five years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Gaming or Hospitality experience preferred.MBA or CPA a plus.Advanced knowledge in the use of spreadsheets (MS Excel) and proficiency with databases is required.Strong written skills exhibiting ability to write and compose correspondence for use by senior level executives a must.Must have strong mathematical and analytical skills including but not limited to trend analysis and financial modeling. LANGUAGE SKILLS: Read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, marketing reports and legal documents.Respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the executive committee.Write articles for internal publication that conform to prescribed style and format.Effectively present information to top management, groups of employees, and/or boards of directors. MATHEMATICAL/ANALYTICAL SKILLS: Apply advanced mathematical and statistical concepts.Apply mathematical operations to such tasks as frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory, and factor analysisApply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.Handle a variety of abstract and concrete variables

You will also participate in internal and external programs to support personal growth and development.The ExperienceWork across all aspects of Executive performance management including supporting the preparation of Board materials, preparation of Executive meeting agendas, managing the Executive cadence of meetings, communications and processes to ensure good governance and accountability, challenging assumptions behind reports used by the Executive and CEO to make important decisions•Learn and work on projects across all areas of the business including operational involvement in the business units, strategic planning, identification of growth initiatives, portfolio management, competitive intelligence, cross-business unit projects, monitoring of the external environment, mergers and acquisitions (M&A), new market entry, market positioning and segmentation, product/ customer positioning, capital investment decisionsWhat we're looking forCompleted MBA with demonstrated record of success including 1 to 3 years work experience with a top tier investment bank, consulting firm, or within Finance or Corporate Strategy function of a global organizationLearn more about this position, our team and culture: https://www.aristocrat.com/executive-graduate-strategic-analyst-for-ceos-office/Why Aristocrat?World Leader in Gaming EntertainmentRobust benefits packageGlobal career opportunitiesOur core values: Respect, Courage, Integrity and PassionOur Winning WaysUnite - Come together as one team, with one visionDevelop - Empower, inspire and grow our peopleDeliver - Execute with excellence, be accountable for resultsPlay - Be creative, celebrate successThe US based roles may require registration with the Nevada Gaming Control Board (NGCB) and/or other gaming jurisdictions in which we operate.LocationLas Vegas, NV, USJob familyFP&AContract TypeRegularTime TypeFull time
