Name: Senior HCMS Analytics Analyst (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:The Senior HCMS Analytics Analyst will be a key partner with MGM Resort International’s Leadership team in providing enterprise wide Workday analytic systems solutions. The Senior HCMS Analytics Analyst will be responsible for driving Human Capital Management solutions via advanced analytics within Workday. This role will recommend and implement changes, enhancements, and new releases, to optimize capabilities of the system. The Senior HCMS Analytics Analyst will manage and execute analytical projects that support the organization’s strategic objectives. The individual is responsible for the development and analysis of complex HR related reports to support the business in the management of employee lifecycle. Educates and elevates the awareness of business leaders and internal HR clients regarding availability and use of analytical tools, techniques, and the opportunities that exist with strategic use of HCM information assets.Partners with functional areas to recommend optimal KPIs to drive effective business decisions/business solutions.Works alongside the HCMS Solutions team to optimize prioritization of HCMS and analytics projects, or creation of roadmaps for functional areas.Creates and maintains advanced level report designs using Workday report writer. Establishes enterprise wide standards for report design and structure.Conducts analyses, typically of moderate to high complexity of HCM data and processes with emphasis on identifying trends and determines root cause of problems.Serves as an analytics subject matter expert in configuration projects includes but is not limited to business process modifications or enhancements.Maintains ongoing knowledge and actively seeks out new Workday functionality while partnering with Solutions Team to determine the effect of releases and changes, and make recommendations for adoption of enhancements to benefit MGM Resorts International users.Establishes and maintains governance around system reporting, data source usage, calculated fields catalog and enterprise wide reporting catalog.Perform other job related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and work experience.At least 3 years of experience in Human Resources Operations (i.e, Employment, Compensation, Labor Relations, HRIS, etc.).At least 2 years of experience in report writing and analysis to compile, configure, and make recommendations based upon a large amount of data.Strong analytical skills required to prepare and analyze complex reports make recommendations to management.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Previous HR and IT and/or Finance Analysis experience preferred. Previous hands-on experience working with a Human Capital Management (HCM) system such as Workday, PeopleSoft, or Oracle.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Facets Configuration Analyst Senior
Description: Energize your career with one of Healthcares fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, its a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the worlds leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 6 leader.  Optum helps nearly 60 million Americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms, conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system, finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. No other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.  In this job, you would be responsible for defining and configuring various aspects in Facets required to accurately administer benefit and provider pricing. Additionally the person will be responsible to design and develop testing approaches to test configuration work. Primary Responsibilities: Analyze products, contracts and pricing, design / configure claim rules and clinical rules, conduct configuration validation, and perform configuration peer review.  Lead requirements gathering with business partners  Evaluate business requirements and determine global design

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst

The Financial Reporting Manager is comfortable interfacing with different financial systems, and an advanced user of MS Excel. The Financial Reporting Manager will provide input to financial systems initiatives including the evolution/design/implementation of IQMS (ERP system). For immediate and confidential consideration, please send your resume to Adam Wood (adam.wood@roberthalf.com).  Robert Half Finance & Accounting, the world's leader in specialized financial staffing, provides exciting full-time opportunities in the areas of accounting, bookkeeping, finance, audit, taxation and more. We pioneered the professional staffing industry, and we've been successfully matching professionals with employers since 1948. Our proven proprietary processes, along with our relationships in 325 locations worldwide, allow us to provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. But don't take our word for it. Our company has appeared on Fortune? magazine's list of "World's Most Admired Companies" since 1998, and 9 out of 10 of our customers would recommend our service to a colleague.  Apply for this job now or contact our nearest office at 844.539.2523 for additional information.  All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.  ? 2018 Robert Half Finance & Accounting. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans  By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use. Req ID:* 03100-0010729392Functional Role:* Sr. Financial AnalystCountry:* USAState:* NVCity:* Las VegasPostal Code:* 89169Compensation:* DOERequirements:* The ideal candidate should meet the following minimum requirements: (i) a bachelor?s degree in business administration or finance, masters of business administration (MBA) preferred, (ii) 7-10+ years of financial reporting and analysis experience; (iii) advanced MS Office suite skills, including specifically advanced MS excel and MS power point; and (iv) excellent communication skills (both verbal and written); and (v) extremely strong systems implementation and management skills as the successful candidate will design and set-up the financial reporting function within the ERP system for a complex and growing organization.

Name: Senior Analyst - SOX and Control Initiatives
Description: Position Overview  The primary responsibility of the Senior Analyst SOX and Control Initiatives is to assist the Director SOX and Control Initiatives in facilitating, planning and managing the finance group's internal control program across Las Vegas Sands Corp. (the Company) properties, focusing on compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX). All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Las Vegas Sands Corp.'s policies, practices, and procedures.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Implement, enhance and manage the Company's global SOX compliance program by continuously defining risks and key controlsImplement AS5 and other control rationalization guidance for both the business process and the general computer control environmentsAssist Director with process documentation, evaluation of processes and systems, process improvement, data analysis, teaming with project implementation teams, and investigations.Coordinate self-assessments with process owners and assist them in updating policies and proceduresCoordinate testing with internal and external audit teamsDevelop the annual reporting documentationAssist the Director SOX and Control Initiatives in completing the annual SOX risk assessment and annual reporting requirementsPerform and document walkthroughs and transaction flows of SOX and other business processes globallyAssist in the development of testing plans to assess compliance with SOX requirementsFacilitate contact with process owners, internal and external audit teams, concerning internal control testingTrack and validate internal control issues identified by audit teams, management, and self-assessmentsMonitor remediation of internal control issuesMaintain documentation of internal controls across domains (SOX) and assists operations and IT departments in updating policies and proceduresAssist other departments in process and control enhancements, remediation of audit findings, and various special projects, as needed, within Finance/Accounting.Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job.Performs other related duties as assigned. Company Standards of Conduct  All Las Vegas Sands Corp. Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company's standards, work requirements and rules of conduct. Team Members are expected to behave in a manner that supports a harmonious work environment to help us deliver unmatched service to our guests and customers. Minimum Qualifications21 years of age.Proof of authorization to work in the United StatesLas Vegas Sands Corp. is an E-Verify employerAdditional information regarding E-Verify can be found at http://www.uscis.gov/e-verifyBachelor's degree in accounting, auditing, business or information technologyGraduate degree in business or professional certification(s) related to internal controls (CPA, CIA, CISA, etc.) preferredMust be able to obtain and maintain a Nevada Gaming Control Board Registration and any other certification or license, as required by law or policy.2+ years of direct business process, auditing or information technology (IT) internal controls experience required, which must include working with large companies that have a significant number of applications and processesExperience working in the gaming industry preferredAbility to Travel as neededProficient in Microsoft Office 2013, including Visio and OutlookSkilled in process documentation and flowchartingBasic understanding of information security, operations and change management and the impact of IT controls on SOX complianceAbility to provide solutions to identified problems or process weaknessesTrained in gaming compliance and/or hospitality best practicesResourceful self-starter and problem solver in deploying the organization's initiatives relating to managing process change, executing internal control implementation, providing ongoing guidance and monitoring to ensure processes and controls are properly designed to maximize effectiveness and efficiency, educating business users responsible for business process, and maintaining compliance with SOX, COSO, and other internal control requirements.Strong project management skills in coordinating activities associated with the SOX program and control testing accomplished by the LVSC Audit Services Group and external audit firm. Strong relationship and inter-personal skills are also necessary in coordinating the requirements of the various process owners, across multiple departments and global jurisdictions, in the SOX program.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both in spoken and written form.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience.Must be able to work varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidays. Physical Requirements Must be able to:Physically access all areas of the property and drive areas with or without a reasonable accommodation.Maintain composure under pressure and consistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts.Ability to interact appropriately and effectively with guests, management, other team members, and outside contacts.Ability for prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneel.Work in a fast-paced and busy environment.Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke.SDL2017

Name: Senior Credit Risk Analyst
Description: Job Information Work Experience 4 Job Opening ID 311 City Las Vegas Employment Type Direct Hire Job DescriptionMNCP Staffing has an exciting direct hire position for a Senior Credit Risk Analyst for one of National Clients. In this role, you will be analyzing portfolio performance with respect to consumer credit risk at origination. Your areas of focus include: the yield/risk balance of underwriting structure/credit policy and the business impact of new products and programs. Analyses support credit operations, sales and finance operations by providing clear and concise assessments used for decision making.  Responsibilities of the Senior Credit Risk Analyst: Analyze risk in the loan portfolio including, originations trends, credit quality, and default performance.Provide decision support to management team by querying, analyzing, and interpreting qualitative and quantitative data.Prepare reports summarizing findings with recommendations on underwriting structure/credit decisioning.Develop special financing opportunities to support strategic objectives. Partner with other departments to ensure effective implementation of select financing programs.Conduct ad hoc research projects incorporating project design, data collection and analysis, summarization of findings, and presentation of results for areas such as portfolio performance and new origination acquisition strategiesProactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to managementPromote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex dataWork directly with internal business partners to manage internal systems related to portfolio information and financing options Skill set Qualifications of the Senior Credit Risk Analyst:  Must have a Bachelors Degree or higher in Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics, MIS or Accounting  4+ Years of experience of proven portfolio, financial, operational, budgeting and forecasting analysis  Advanced MS Excel Is Required.  Experience in consumer loans portfolio performance, loan underwriting preferred  Understanding of credit analytics, credit scoring modeling preferred

monitors, troubleshoots, and fixes Financial Data Management/Enterprise Edition (FDMEE) data loads supplying data to EPM applications.Maintains logic of FDMEE mapping.Runs the Hyperion Financial Name: Supply Chain Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Develop and deploy supply chain initiatives that help drive improvements in supplier quality, delivery, and cost. Provide Supply Chain with analytical, technical, and financial expertise in support of overall operations. Individual will assist with managing enterprise-wide supply policies and procedures and will leverage third party tools and vendor resources to ensure expenditures are optimized. Individual will be responsible for leading Scientific Games (SG) required analysis and reporting requirements including but not limited to; Spend analysis, Supply Chain Dashboarding, Conflict Minerals analysis & reporting, Supplier Scorecards, 10K and SEC reporting requirements, Compliance reporting requirements, etc. This position will play a critical role in issue resolution, supplier management, goods/services receipt issues, and PO and Non-PO invoice processing support across both Oracle and MAPICS/IntelliChief. Additional duties may include: Assisting in the creation of supply strategies to optimize cross-divisional purchases;  Take a leadership role in managing corporate-wide spend analysis;  Assisting with corporate Supply Chain KPI metrics analysis;  Performing analysis of SG expenditures to evaluate total cost of ownership.  Maintaining a high level of interpersonal and communication skills to promote positive working relationships inside and outside of SG. Essential Job Functions: Manage third party vendor expenditures analysis and reporting.  Collaborate across the enterprise to evaluate and optimize expenditures.  Utilize Supply Chain system technologies to reduce the total cost of goods and services.  Assist in the development of Supply Chain tools, optimization models, and data analytics to help drive the teams strategic direction  Lead business process re-engineering initiatives to increase productivity, quality and effectiveness of procurement.  Assist with leading cross-functional teams executing strategic sourcing projects.  Assist with supplier selection and negotiate contracts for key strategic initiatives.  Direct the formation and maintenance of strategic alliances with key suppliers to create a highly automated and efficient supply chain system.  Must be a key contributor to improve day-to-day interaction with vendors.  Drive internal customers to identify and implement business process improvements.  Conduct business dealings with the highest level of integrity and regard for legal issues.  Assure internal controls are adequate and followed in order to protect SG assets.  Ability to travel as necessary.  Position Requirements Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree in business, finance, computer Science or related field. Experience working with ERP systems (preferably Oracle) and related business data warehouses. MBA or advanced degree preferred. Required Experience: 3-5 years of analytical experience using data to create and analyze reports. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: Excellent analytical, mathematical, computer skills.  Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.  Excellent planning and forecasting abilities.  Excellent oral and written communications skills required.  Strategic thinker, with sound knowledge of strategic purchasing methods.  Proven negotiation skills.  Demonstrated ability to implement creative solutions while working under pressure.  Physical Requirements: Office environment  Work Conditions: May require weekend and evening hours  The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, SG) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. As a prerequisite to employment with SG (to the extent permitted by law), you shall be asked to consent to SG conducting a due diligence/background investigation on you.  This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The employee in this position may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities than those stated above.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If youd like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: EEOC Poster.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If youd like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here EEOC Poster.

Name: Finance Budget Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJT3 provides engineering and technical support to four of the western test ranges for the U.S. Air force and Navy under the joint range technical Services Contract, better known as J-Tech. We are a Joint venture of Raytheon and AECOM and is supported by nine teammate companies. We prepare our Nations war – fighting aircraft, and weapons systems, and aircrews for today’s missions and tomorrow-global challenges. JT3 is hiring a Financial Budget Analyst in Las Vegas Nevada! If you are detail oriented, willing to work in a fast-paced environment with competing deadlines, and like a challenge we would like to speak to you! Please apply! Primary Responsibilities:Prepares and analyzes specific accounting statements and reports to assist in the preparation of financial statements, tax reports, and other internal and external reports as requiredConducts special accounting studiesPerforms setup and maintenance of files within the existing financial software as well as assists in the testing of financial upgradesVerifies the proper distribution of charges to specific accounts and contracts.Prepares monthly and yearly journal entriesInterfaces, as needed, with government, corporate, and private auditorsPrepares monthly, quarterly, and annual payroll, vendor, or expense reports.Applies learned knowledge of practices and procedures to deal with issues or research problems that require further definition before resolutionMaintains the financial accounts, books, and reports in a current acceptable condition. Reviews and audits these records, which include, but are not limited to: general ledger and supporting journals of original entry maintained for contract activities and reports; banks and banking records; company and contract financial reports; and journal vouchersMonitors posting and maintenance of financial books and records and assures all supporting documents are adequate and properly filed; performs continuous audits of financial accounts to maintain account integrityMonitors operating cash requirements; reviews reconciliation of all bank accountsPerforms all other position-related duties as assigned or requestedBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Finance, Accounting, or Economics3 Years of job related Finance, Accounting, or Economics work experienceProficient in computer skills including; MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS OutlookStrong verbal and written communication skillsMust qualify for and maintain a government security clearance and possess a current State issued driver’s licensePreferred Qualifications:Experience in reconciling complex payroll, tax and benefit scenarios in a fast paced deadline driven environmentKnowledge of Critical variance analysis skillsKnowledge of and experience with budgeting, accounting and financial reportingAbility to work independently with a high degree of accuracyGovernment experience Company DescriptionJT3 is dedicated to being the nation's premier provider of joint test, tactics, and training support, to four of the western test ranges for the U.S. Air Force and Navy. We have a joint venture with Raytheon and AECOM.  If you have experience as a Java Software Engineer who would like to help develop systems to prepare our nation’s war fighting aircraft, weapons systems for today’s missions.

Name: Management Analyst 4
Description: The Position  Management Analysts conduct a variety of studies, research and analysis of management and administrative areas such as budgeting and financial analysis; departmental operations; legislative analysis; management research; and statistical and informational analysis.  Incumbents function as managers who train, supervise and evaluate the performance of subordinate supervisors; develop policies and procedures; and allocate staff and resources to accomplish goals and objectives.  This position is with the Department of Business & Industry, Housing Division in Las Vegas. The incumbent will work with our Division Administrator and Deputies to support the development of legislative drafts and provide for internal audit support. This position has the primary oversight and management of the Division's programmatic dashboard and will provide for divisional metrics and reporting to evaluate various programs and look for areas to assist in the proper distribution of these resources. This position will provide the Division with complex technical analysis on current Divisional processes and procedures to ensure compliance with Federal, State and Local guidelines. The incumbent will assist and work with our Grants and Projects team on the awards and contracting processes as the division reviews and looks to improve its policies and procedures relating to the Qualified Allocation Plan, Emergency Solutions Grant, HOME Program, and Low-Income Housing Trust Fund program. Additionally, the MA 4 will work with our teams to provide recommendations on our extensive programs and help us to leverage our websites, social media sources and other forms of outreach that we are currently utilizing. This would include the evaluation of views, reach and demographics for social media engagement regarding home ownership programs and our online apartment search function. In addition, helping to expand the reach of our Affordable Housing Advocate through these channels along with Weatherization assistance and Lot Rent Subsidy awareness.This position requires the incumbent to pass a criminal background check and travel up to 25%. * THIS RECRUITMENT MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF APPLICATIONS RECEIVED. QUALIFIED APPLICANTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. *  To see full Class Specifications visit: http://hr.nv.gov/Resources/ClassSpecs/Class_Specifications-7_0/ To Qualify: In order to be qualified, you must meet the following requirements:  Education and Experience (Minimum Qualifications) Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in public or business administration, finance, social sciences, mathematics or related field and four years of professional experience in the research, development, evaluation or revision of programs, organizations, methods or procedures; OR one year of experience as a Management Analyst III in Nevada State service; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience on a year-for-year basis. Special Notes The ability to travel at least 25% of the time is required. Special Requirements A State of Nevada/FBI background check will be required of the selected applicant.

Name: SAS Sr Analyst
Description: Job Title – SAS  Senior AnalystLocation –  Henderson, NVAbout Us Barclays  is a transatlantic consumer, corporate and investment bank offering products  and services across personal, corporate and investment banking, credit cards  and wealth management, with a strong presence in our two home markets of the UK  and the US. Our goal is to become the bank of choice by providing superior  services to customers and clients and supporting our stakeholders via a  commercially successful business that generates long-term sustainable returns.  About Barclays in the US  Barclays offers corporate and investment banking  and credit card services in the US. Our 10,000 US colleagues are located in  offices across the country, with headquarters in New York City. In 2017,  Barclays announced plans to create a world-class campus in Whippany, New  Jersey, for our Technology, Operations and Functional teams in the US. Other  principal locations include Delaware, Nevada, Ohio and Maine. About  SAS Planning & Forecasting BCUS Operations Forecasting & Planning is a Shared Services group  responsible for Volume and FTE requirement fpr the Customer Contact Centers at  interval, daily, weekly, and monthly levels. Our mission is to shape the bank’s  agenda by operating a best-in-class forecasting & planning organization  that delivers actionable insights, metrics to the business that optimizes  shareholder and customer value. Overall  purpose of role: This  role serves as a one-stop shop for our Spanish bilingual teams, as well as  internal and external business partners. The role includes overseeing the  translation from English to Spanish for all Care policies, procedures and  workflows, bilingual operation controls (OiC liaison) including the discovery, vetting  and implementation of subsequent controls to mitigate the risks (this would  also extend into Core Care when applicable).  Perspective applicant will be challenged to work with all lines of  business to negotiate, develop and potentially implement process improvement  opportunities to reduce the dependency on third party companies such as  Language Line by providing superior servicing for the bank at a reduced cost.  The role requires working to provide a top-notch customer experience while  mitigating risk to the Bank and making it as easy and as desirable as possible  for our Spanish-speaking customers to do business with us by supporting our  vision of making us the go to bank. Overall purpose of role: o  Responsible  for Planning & Forecasting across Collections, Fraud, Care and/or Credit  Operational functions  o  Maintain  strong relationships across the entire network to understand business needs and  impacts in order to ensure appropriate staffing to service our customers across  the different lines of business Key specific  accountabilities. o  Solely  responsible for all capacity plans and forecasting needs across a key business  function  o  Provide  rigorous methodology and approach to documentation and version control to  ensure replicability, performance and adherence to all regulatory controls  Risk and Control Objective  All Barclays  colleagues have to ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in  full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management  Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards  Essential Skills/Basic Qualifications: Basic  Qualifications o  Bachelor’s  Degree in a technical field: Statistics, Finance, Economics or similar;  Master’s Degree preferred  o 2  years analytical experience with proven performance in decision making and  problem solving  o 2  years Microsoft Office capabilities  o 1  years of coding experience in SAS using complex procedures and data mining  techniques Preferred  Qualifications* o  Proven  ability to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders; strong  communication and interpersonal skills  o  Experience  in Planning & Forecasting in a Workforce Management function  o  Formal  studies and/or experience in statistics and modelling would be beneficial  o  Business  expertise in an Operational setting  o  Exhibits  Barclays core competencies of: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and  Stewardship Risk and  Control Objective All  Barclays colleagues have to ensure that all activities and duties are carried  out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk  Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards. Your Application To be  considered for this role, click on the apply button now. Barclays Values & Diversity Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate  professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please  discuss this with the hiring manager. We  are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any  grounds. It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without  discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, colour, creed, religion,  national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation,  gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status,  disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected  by law.

Name: Program Financial Analyst

strong Excel software skills.Deltek Costpoint experience desired.Possess working knowledge of word processing and integrated software applications; organizational skills and ability to perform detail oriented work is required.Position may require intermittent travel.Qualify for and maintain an active DoD clearance is required.Qualify for and maintain a government Top Secret security clearance.Possess a valid state issued drivers license.**Preferred Qualifications**Local candidates preferred.Current DoD Top Secret Clearance is highly desired**What We Offer**AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM._**_Job Category_** _Finance and Accounting_**_Business Line_** _Management Services_**_Business Group_** _Management Services Group (MS)_**_Country_** _United States of America_**_Position Status_** _Full-Time_**_Requisition/Vacancy No._** _197476BR_**_Clearance Required_** _Yes__Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status._

Name: Risk Analyst in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionPosition SummaryThe position will primarily be responsible for driving the Bank’s incremental growth through Digital Acquisition strategies. This position will focus on evaluating, analyzing, and reporting the impact and performance of digital acquisition strategies, as well as conducting analysis to evaluate the risk of new and existing programs.Summary of Essential Job FunctionsEvaluating, analyzing, and reporting the impact and performance of digital acquisition strategies.Leading analysis in order to evaluate the risk of new and existing programs.Assessing all application underwriting rules and strategies to align for business standards and strategic goals.Driving incremental growth through the development of new strategies or the optimization of existing strategies in the digital acquisitions space.Presenting findings to upper management and making recommendations for improvements. Job RequirementsPosition RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Math or related field.3+ years analytical experience in Banking, Finance, Insurance or Gaming.3+ years advanced use of at least one of the following: Microsoft Access, SQL Server, Oracle, or SASIntellectual horsepower with problem solving and analytical skills.Must be proficient in data mining and financial modeling procedures.Self-starter, who can work independently with a high degree of organization on several projects at one time.Sufficient self-confidence and ability to propose new ideas/solutions.Ability to quickly assimilate and analyze large amounts of information.Strong knowledge of Microsoft tool suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio).Knowledge of financial analysis and profitability drivers. Preferred (Not Required): Advanced degreeExperience in digital markets and online acquisitions.Physical RequirementsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. However, the employee may choose to stand and move within cubicle area. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, feel, talk and hear; reach with hands and arms. Must possess the ability to effectively hear and communicate. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 2 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Name: IT Support Analyst Sr
Description: Position Description  When you become a member of our Corporate team, you will work across the organization to provide the knowledge, resources and tools that help Scientific Games deliver outstanding service and support to our internal clients. Our Corporate Group includes Finance, Investor Relations, Legal, Compliance, Internal Audit, Facilities, Human Resources and Corporate Communications. We’re always looking for team players who are customer centric, who seek to challenge themselves and have the drive to move our business forward.  If this sounds like you...Let's make games!  Reporting to the Desktop Manager, the Sr. IT Support Analyst investigates, diagnoses, and resolves most incidents that are not resolved by the Service Desk Analyst. This individual assists the Service Desk Analyst solve basic technical problems and investigates more complex issues escalated to him/her. The Sr. IT Support Analyst performs high level local desktop support for onsite personnel as well as remote support using remote control tools. This individual relies on experience and judgment, as well as pre-established processes and procedures to identify, research, and resolve technical issues. The Sr. IT Support Analyst documents, tracks and monitors issues escalated to him/her to ensure a timely resolution. They coordinate with management, IT personnel, and vendors as required to address issues related to existing IT systems and implementations of new IT technologies. This individual will collaborate with peers to discuss and identify solutions.  Position Requirements Job Functions:Diagnose, replace, configure, install and test various hardware/software components including peripherals on data network.Track and resolve service tickets related to all hardware, software and network issues worked.Troubleshoot and resolve trouble tickets related to technical difficulties with hardware, software, and the network.Triage Tier 3 trouble tickets and escalates support issues to Desktop manager when the issue exceeds their skill set.Resolve network switch and connectivity issues.Administers, updates, and troubleshoots corporate telephony system.Determines root cause of problems and identifies workarounds or permanent fixes.Ensures workarounds or permanent fixes are documented and communicated to Service Desk Analysts.Collaborate with development staff to recreate issues in the test environment.Interface with infrastructure, database, and development personnel.Ability to complete multiple projects, creating a plan, its progress, and any issues in a timely manner.Initiates escalation as appropriate to ensure management awarenessActively contributes to ongoing process improvement.Provides Guidance, including training of other Analysts.Serves as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for IT support team.Actively participates in end user and Service Desk Analyst training by providing materials, conducting training, or attending training in the role of SME.Writes automated routines and programs using common desktop software.Maintains IT equipment and supply inventories to ensure critical parts and supplies are in place to maintain systems with limited downtime.Verify with the customer that the issue has been resolved and update the ticketing system.Performs other duties or special projects as assigned or directed by Desktop Manager.Position Requirements/Qualifications:Computer Sciences degree, Information Technology or related field or equivalent technical experience.5-7 years of experience in an IT technical support position preferably in a manufacturing or gaming environment.Skills/Abilities:Degree in computer science or related field desired.Attention to detail.Demonstrated experience installing and supporting PCs, laptops, printers, and telecommunication equipment.Significant experience installing and supporting Mac OSX, Windows 7 & 10, Office 2013 and 2016, and other desktop related applications.Knowledge of Oracle EBS systems and applications.Knowledge of network concepts, basic server administration and troubleshooting a plus.Knowledge of IT technologies such as VMWare and Parallels.Cloud support experience: (Microsoft, Google, iCloud, etc.)Proven ability to keep up to date with the latest IT technologies.Outstanding customer service skills.Communication skills a must – oral and written.Must have excellent interpersonal and motivation skills.Ability to work independently and in a diverse team environment.Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize.PC Imaging experience is required.Maintain Confidentiality of all company-related IT Information.Ability to build and maintain trust relationships with coworkers / customers and Executive managementOccasional travel may be required.Ability to lift a minimum of 25+lbsWork Conditions: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, “SG”) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. Name: Senior ERP / EHR Analyst
Description: Located in the vibrant Las Vegas region is a thriving medium-sized acute care hospital. This hospital has recently implemented a new Epic System. They are searching for an experienced Senior ERP/ EHR Analyst to build and improve on their new Epic System. This facility offers ample growth opportunities and a generous benefits package!  Position Focus Senior ERP / EHR Analyst  The Senior ERP / EHR Analyst reports to the Assistant Hospital IT Director and oversees the hospital-wide design and implementation of an ERP or EHR system.  Plays a key role in developing business processes and configuring software for the new system.  Identifies solutions for issues relating to integrating the new system while keeping hospital leadership informed.  Provides professional customer support for EHR Systems hospital-wide.  Organization and Community  This hospital promotes a culture of shared leadership and is committed to nursing excellence.  This location offers a vibrant and happening metro area of quiet suburban areas that provide outstanding outdoor recreation.  Requirements Senior ERP / EHR Analyst  Finance or Revenue Cycle experience (including Hospital Billing or Claims) equivalent to a Bachelor Degree in Business, Finance or Public Administration.  Epic Healthcare EMR experience.  Current certification in Epic application(s).  3 years professional experience in finance, revenue cycle, accounting or purchasing.  Relocation assistance is provided  Contact: Jonah Levinger  Merraine Group Inc. is an executive search & recruitment firm specializing in the placement of Physicians, Managers, Directors and C-level leadership at Hospitals and Medical Centers across the United States. We place professionals throughout all hospital practices: Laboratory, Radiology/Imaging, Physical/Occupational Therapy and Respiratory, Nursing, Behavioral Health, Case Management, Emergency, ICU, Med/Surg, Surgical and OR, Quality, Pediatrics/NICU and Womens Health, Finance, HIM, IT, Informatics and Practice Management.  To learn more about Merraine Group: Click Here

Name: Senior IT Systems Analyst
Description: Positions in this function create and deliver high quality system solutions for our applications, products and services across all technology functions. They consult with users and technology specialists to define business processes and the information systems for supporting those processes. Individuals in these roles may perform analysis and also serve as business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. They provide technical support in developing systems that are cost effective and meet users requirements.  This function works to create systems that work together in a cohesive manner, enforcing standards and methods consistently across the enterprise. Roles may support both current system improvements and maintenance along with new system development. Primary Responsibilities: Solid organizational skills and focus on accuracy and attention to detail.  Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities  Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment  Providing accurate and timely estimates for tasks  Provide support and leadership in critical production support issue resolution  Support the team for application availability, reliability and stability on a 7 by 24 by 365 basis  Conduct or facilitate root cause analysis on all in-scope incidents and recommend a corrective action plan  Work with team to achieve timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreements  Work with business to prioritize production issue resolution.  Work with business segments to better define project requirements for development and implementation  Assesses and interprets customer needs and requirements  Translate requirements into technical specifications  Work with external vendors to troubleshoot and resolve complex software issues.

Name: Junior Analyst (Trading)
Description: Location Las Vegas, NVContract type Full-timeJob descriptionOur Trading team has gone through rapid growth over the past few years and is looking to the future. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and have a passion for all sports, we’d like to hear from you!  As a Jr. Analyst (Trading) you will work within the William Hill US Trading Team, helping to manage risk and liability of events in line with WHUS Trading Policy.  Under direction from Trading team management, a Jr. Analyst’s day-to-day tasks will include: Administration and set up of pre-game markets and product via trading toolsRisk management of pre-game eventsApprove wagers in a timely manner in line with WHUS Trading PoliciesIdentify and highlight significant customersAssist with reporting requirements as directed by the management team MINIMUM POSITION REQUIREMENTS: 2+ years’ experience in the gaming/hospitality industryMust be a strong Excel user Must be passionate and knowledgeable about sportsCan learn new technology and is detail orientedStrong mathematical and analytical skills, ability to understand and calculate oddsCommercial acumen, analytical skills with the ability to identify and create opportunities for growthResults driven, thrives on improving results and profitabilityQuick thinking and decisive, ability to make trading decisions without hesitationAbility to rapidly build relationships and to work in collaboration with other teams and functions across the businessMust be able to work any day, any shift, including major sports events and holidaysAbility to take direction from Trading team managementExcellent communication skills both verbal and writtenAbility to obtain and be eligible for a Gaming License or Registration/Permit in any jurisdiction where one is required In addition, you will work alongside a team of experienced sports traders eager to share their knowledge, and they play a key role in the business. All traders/analysts have the potential to generate or lose income for our business.

Name: Fraud Risk Analyst III in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionOne of America's leading issuers of VISA® and MasterCard® credit cards located in Las Vegas Nevada is seeking highly qualified risk professionals. We provide credit cards to individuals who have been historically overlooked by other banks because of their less than perfect credit. With millions of people carrying our credit card, we pride ourselves on excellent customer service and an array of credit card products with innovative features.  This position is a part of the Risk Management department. You'll work with the Fraud Risk team and internal business partners to develop, implement and evaluate fraud risk management strategies that reduce fraud losses, improve profit, increase efficiency and improve the customer experience.  Responsibilities: Develop, implement and evaluate fraud risk strategies.Analyze and present data in easy-to-understand visualizations and recommendations appropriate to the type of activity under review.Perform analysis and define industry benchmarks.Applies industry best practices and provides standards for solution, execution and delivery approach.Utilizes analytical and quantitative skills by using data and metrics to test theories, confirm assumptions, generate insights/recommendations and measure success.Ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.Be responsible for scorecard validations and tracking.Provides Analytics and insights to organizational leaders in response to their business questions through the use of data, tools, technologies and discovery solutions.Partner and collaborate with Operations, Compliance and IT teams. Job RequirementsRequirements: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Decision Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related quantitative field. (advanced degree preferred)4+ years work experience in a similar role in a professional corporate environmentAbility to transform big data into recommended actions to prevent fraud loss.Proficiency in SAS, SAS EMiner and SQL or a similar programming language is required.Statistical modeling exposure including logistic regression, CHAID/CART analysis, and other general linear models.Machine learning algorithms.Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, analytical and quantitative skills.Ability to drive and influence business decisions based on metrics and data.Demonstrated ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences.Knowledge of fraud, credit risk analysis along with an understanding of profitable drivers, financial analysis and credit reporting.Experience in identifying and preventing transaction, identity and payment fraud and /or experience in developing and/or using fraud risk models algorithms or scorecards.Works well within a collaborative team environment.Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Preferred (Not Required): Advanced degree.Experience data mining large databases.

Name: Service Management Analyst – IT (Corporate)
Description: Job Description Grade:The Information Technology (IT) Service Management Analyst will be responsible for the management of the process of supporting all ITSM service management functions within the IT Operations department. The Service Management Analyst works independently to coordinate, facilitate, and lead change, problem, reporting and knowledge management in support of the ITSM and ITIL lifecycles. Manage the incident escalation process that may result from changes or recurring problems within the operating environment.Manage high severity incidents, problems from inception to resolution, ensuring quick and correct assessment of the issue, including identifying the impact to a specific Business Unit, Owner(s) and engaging the appropriate resolver group.Act as a service manager on call to support services in support of IT operations.Provide prompt periodic progress updates to the appropriate parties until detection of the root cause and issue closure.Provide metrics and hold post Incident Review Analysis meetings, detailing failings or concerns experienced during incident handling that will feed into continual service improvement plans, process and training.Coordinate resolution efforts across multiple applications and groups.Assists the IT Operations team to write, validate and distribute any required communication that sent to executive leadership, IT management, customers and lines of business as well as communications to external customers.Interfaces with Internal and external clients as well as vendors on an as needed basis to discuss problem assessment and to facilitate the coordination of client resources to resolve the problem and minimize the impact and drive problem management metrics and reporting.Regularly and accurately report on Key Performance Indicators for IT Operations and the IT organization as a whole.Drive organizational learning by extrapolating knowledge from service transitions, changes, incidents and/or problems.Monitor the efficiency and effectiveness of the Incident Management process and makes recommendations for on-going improvements.Must possess excellent communication and troubleshooting skills. Accuracy and poise are of the utmost importance to the success of this role.Other work related duties as assignedRequired:At least 5 years of experience in IT Operations and/or IT Project Management including coordinating an Change, Problem, Incident, Knowledge and Reporting Management (ITIL/ITSM).Thorough understanding of Incident, Problem, Event, and Alarm processes with proven experience supporting this process within a large-scale organization.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems/Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.ITIL Certification.Previous experience in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: • Prepare relevant analysis for the creation of monthly and quarterly analytics packages provided to Senior management  • Participate in the development/enhancement and maintenance of Service Center reporting packages  • Participate in the development/enhancement and maintenance of management reporting packages that meets the needs of the intended audience (CFO’s)  • Participate in the development/enhancement and maintenance of integrated reporting packages that meets the needs of the intended audience  • Participate in the monthly global accounting close ensuring completeness and accuracy of financial statements for relevant line of business or accounting service center  • Prepare analysis for relevant line of business or accounting service center of monthly financial results and summarize in financial analytics package presented to executive management  • Review and analyze monthly reporting package to be prepared by accounting operations to assist in preparation of financial analytics package  • Provide assistance to Technical Accounting and SEC Reporting as applicable  • Participate in global financial and accounting process improvement initiatives  Position Requirements  Experience A bachelors degree in accounting, finance or businessAt least 5 years of progressive experienceHands-on financial reporting experience in a global companyExcellent knowledge of US GAAP, FASB pronouncements and SEC rules and regulations preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills, a high level of attention to details and the ability to work in a productive environment with multiple prioritiesExperience with Hyperion, Oracle and Blackline preferred  Physical Requirements: Office environment

Name: ANALYST I DIRECT MARKETING
Description: Direct Marketing Analyst is responsible for the data & execution components of multi-property and property-specific direct marketing campaigns. Direct mail & email campaigns for campaigns for specific properties or regions, advertising for gaming, promotions, events, dining, and hotel offers. DM Campaigns begin with a business strategy, and the analyst will evaluate all the details needed for operational efficiencies, set up offer segmentation, query criteria from an existing database, and live data proofing and all respond to all inquiries.  This role requires the candidate to be highly analytical, a good communicator and have some marketing or analytical knowledge. Balancing a heavy workload with a strong attention to detail will be an ongoing challenge of the role. As a DM Marketing Analyst, responsibilities may also include assisting in compiling results of all customer offers, helping to ensure that DM programs continue to profitably influence customer behavior while also assisting in campaign build processes.  The ideal candidate will be able to: Understand how to model, manipulate and query large data sets needed for generating segmented marketing campaigns, as well as, formatting and delivering list and reports to appropriate parties.Quickly learn relevant industry database applications and software.Understand how to manage, query and manipulate large datasets.Communicate effectively (written and verbal) across multiple departments, adjusting message to audience and succinctly summarizing complex concepts.Demonstrate an understanding of general marketing principles and strategy componentsManage numerous projects simultaneously at various stages of development within specific timelines.Work in a deadline / detailed oriented environment, and regularly meet/exceed service level agreement requirementsWork independently with limited supervisionCollaborative across a large-scale organizationThink creatively and analyticallyBe highly detail oriented

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst - Procurement
Description: Job Specifications Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting preferred or other business related degree required.Four (4) to five (5) years of experience in related field.Project Management knowledge.Strong organizational, research, and analytical skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Must be detail-oriented.Proficient with various software applications, such as Excel, Word, Lawson, Stratton Warren, Cognos, etc.Must be able to obtain/maintain any necessary certifications and/or licenses as required by local gaming regulations. Proficient in the preparation of the monthly diversity and other operations reports. Responsible for Company energy program financial management, reporting and analysis. This includes current spend documentation, analysis of proposed bids/RFPs, and expected savings/increases.Works with key stakeholders and procurement team for contract performance reviews.Provides support related to P-card Administration and Vendor Master Maintenance.Ability to create reports using company business intelligence tools.Other duties as assigned by management.SDL2017

Name: Senior Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: Don’t just work. Work Happy. A career in gaming? At Penn National Gaming we think you’ll enjoy an exciting industry, fast-paced days and nights, diverse, enthusiastic co-workers, unlimited growth and support from one of the leaders in the industry.  An individual could be successful if they possess the following. SUMMARY The Senior Financial Reporting Analyst is responsible for assisting in the preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in both internal and external formatted financial reporting deliverables, inclusive of earnings releases, Form 10-Qs, 10-Ks, 8-Ks, Proxy Statements, state regulatory reports, and other filing documents. This role also assists in preparing various financial statement schedules necessary in the monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidation process. RESPONSIBILITIES The following and other duties may be assigned as necessary for the entire enterprise: Responsible for assisting in the preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in both internal and external formatted financial reporting deliverables, inclusive of earnings releases, Form 10-Qs, 10-Ks, 8-Ks, Proxy Statements, state regulatory reports, and other filing documents.Prepares the consolidation of financial statements in accordance with US GAAP, including other supporting documentation for both internal and external reporting. This includes but is not limited to state regulatory purposes.Prepares Form 10-Qs, Form 10-Ks, Proxy Statements, and other SEC filing documents in accordance with SEC regulations.Responsible for coordinating with various groups within the organization to complete assignments and projects as needed.Establishes and maintains productive working relationships with other groups within the organization including but not limited to, Accounting, Tax, Finance, and Legal.Assists in maintaining and communicating changes in financial accounting policies throughout the organization as needed.Ensures applicable documentation is developed in an organized format for both electronic and hard-copy retrieval.Develops and maintains communication vehicles to distribute key operating metrics and analytical findings.Performs special projects and ad hoc analysis as requested.Responsible for ensuring the compliance with all regulatory compliance within area of responsibility and reporting potential issues to Manager.Maintains strict confidentiality in all departmental and company matters.Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S.) from accredited four-year college in Finance, Accounting, or related field; two or more years’ experience in financial reporting or public accounting with publicly traded companies; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of general accounting policies and financial statement procedures, including US GAAP, related regulatory requirements, and SEC guidelines, required. Experience with SEC financial filings and XBRL preferred.Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to quickly learn and comprehend processes and new technology.Must have working knowledge of and current and new accounting pronouncements and/or SEC guidance that affect financial reporting.Must have technical proficiency and knowledge in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) and automated financial systems.Must be able to work under pressure and meet assigned deadlines.Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.Must have excellent organization skills and be detailed oriented.Ability to write reports and business correspondence.Must be able to meet deadlines, including projects that require a quick time frame.Ability to successfully work independently while balancing multiple projects.Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.Must have the ability to interact with colleagues and resolve problems and conflicts in a diplomatic and tactful manner. Penn National Gaming is more than you may realize. We have properties throughout the United States and Canada and are embarking on an aggressive growth mode. Our departments and areas of opportunity are ideal for just about any skill set. And our company-wide commitment to making sure our guests smile as much as we do means you’ll enjoy a fun working environment. Now that you have read about who we are, here is your opportunity to see what we're about!Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Senior Analyst HCMS Configuration (Corporate)-2
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will be a key partner with MGM Resort International’s HR Leadership team in providing Workday systems support to all other HR functions. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst is responsible for driving HR process improvements via system setup and maintenance of business processes within Workday. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will partner with other HR business units, Payroll, IT, and vendors to implement changes, enhancements, and new releases, ensuring data integrity, and developing processes to optimize capabilities of the system. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will partner with IT when necessary to troubleshoot issues with integrations to/from and between Workday and other systems.  Evaluates and delivers complex functional and technical solutions within Workday based on their own in-depth understanding of Workday’s object-oriented architecture and Workday’s integration with other systems.Actively seeks out new Workday functionality and/or enhancements to existing functionality and its possible use in the MGM Resorts International implementation of Workday.Configure business processes and corresponding business process and domain security for the following modules: Core HCMPayrollAbsenceCompensationTalent ManagementRecruitingBenefitsManage overall data integrity and accuracy of Workday, and work with the IT group to maintain the uptime of Workday’s service endpoints with downstream systems, while serving as HCMS expert in support of HR business processes and data integration.Maintain ongoing knowledge of Workday releases and changes. Partner with Release Manager to determine the effect of releases and changes to current or future use. Partner with HCMS Solutions team to create recommendations for functional area roadmaps based on upcoming Workday enhancements. Perform other job related duties as requested. Required: Must be 18 or older.Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.At least 6 years required experience in Human Resources Operations (i.e. Employment, Compensation, Labor Relations, HRIS, etc.) and with a Human Capital Management (HCM) system such as Workday, PeopleSoft, or Oracle.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred: Experience related to implementation of HR applications.Experience in Workday, Cornerstone Learning Management System and Kronos Time Tracking. Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Are you ready to level up your career? At Scientific Games, we are committed to making the best games, platforms and systems in the world. We are looking for smart, passionate and creative people to join our team and help us transform the gaming world. We are a global, industry-leading gaming technology company that embraces challenge, fosters an inclusive culture, values integrity, innovation and winning, and is committed to developing and supporting its people.Whether you are a member of our award winning game studios, our industry leading systems group, product management, manufacturing group, services or any of our other amazing Gaming teams, you will be creating compelling games played around the world. We are dedicated to being the industrys only COMPLETE global solutions provider with products that will enhance the entire gaming operation, both on the casino floor and behind the scenes.  If you are ready to playCome join us and lets make games! Job Summary: Assist in financial planning, analysis and forecasting for the Gaming division. Manage activities necessary to provide management with analytics including daily reporting, dashboards and KPIs to report overall business trends. Coordinate with finance to ensure all trending, monthly reconciliations and external reporting are aligned with the requirements of the business.  Position Requirements Essential Job Functions: Provide cross functional support across all product lines to assist in the forecasting process and the consolidation of forecasts into Hyperion Planning.  Coordinate with executive management to provide reporting dashboards and KPIs related to operational trends and regional analytics.  Forecast and monitor material planning needs in comparison to current and long range company forecasts. Identity key areas of concern and report back to operations.  Track trends and forecasts related to SHFL products with the ability to create new reporting as required.  Work closely with international offices to consolidate regional data, monitor forecasts and track operational efficiencies.  Support Commercial Finance team with deal analysis and tracking.  Review analyst reports and external data to gather insight into the overall business strategy and trends and prepare presentations as needed.  Requires the ability to grasp complex business requirements and translate them into new analytics to increase data visibility to the organization. Qualifications:Education: Bachelors Degree  3-5 Years experience with financial analysis, budgeting and forecasting.  Emphasis in Gaming or Finance preferred but not required. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: Proficient with all Microsoft products.  Advanced MS Excel skills required  Knowledge of Hyperion Planning / Smart View desired.  Database knowledge using Access or SQL preferred but not required.  Knowledge of Microsoft Power BI preferred but not required.  Ability to present forecasts, analytics and dashboards in a clear and concise manner.  Excellent oral and written communication skills across all levels of the organization.  Solid understanding of accounting principles and procedures.  Comfortable working under tight deadlines.  Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Physical Requirements:Work Conditions: Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, SG) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts.
