Description: Job Description  Grade: The Senior Analyst – Hotel & Retail Analytics works proactively within the Hotel & Retail Operations functional areas to identify optimization opportunities. Success in this position requires a deep analytical skillset combined with the ability to integrate and analyze divergent sets of data to better understand the drivers of value across the line of business and how those drivers can be leveraged to further MGM’s goals, strategies and opportunities for growth. Assist in leading the analysts on the team to create cross-property benchmarks, insights based on analytic techniques to remediate issues and improve financial and operational performance. Fosters relationships with business counter-parts and becomes a credible partner, who seeks to understand and identify business needs and is able to ensure implementation of analytics initiatives.All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts policies, practices and procedures.Identifies and performs due diligence around insight areas.Identifies business requirements and collaborates with Enterprise Analytics team in pass-off of requirements for execution and IM development.Manages new reporting and insight demands with currently in-progress projects.Contributes the building of analytics capability across aligned functional area(s) and properties.Drives the demand management process through reviewing, prioritizing, and reporting on Property/Corporate requests to Vice President – Hotel, F&B, Entertainment, & Retail Analytics and communicating key requirements to the Enterprise Analytics team for development.Reviews findings with and makes recommendations to the EA leadership, business partners, and other team members.Provide inputs to Value Measurement process to ensure business results are achieved.Proactively learns the business across functional areas in preparation for future specialization.Networks externally to seek innovation.Manages Human Resources responsibilities for the specifically assigned areas; create and maintain a work environment that promotes client service, teamwork, performance feedback, individual recognition, mutual respect, and employee satisfaction ensuring quality hiring, training, and succession planning processes that encompass the company’s diversity commitment.Perform other job-related duties as requested.Required: Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Finance, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or related field (e.g. Operations Research, Statistics).At least 3 years of experience in relevant subject area (e.g., industry or function) with experience driving business performance through operational insights and analytics.Previous experience leading teams.Excellent customer service skills.Able to lead and mentor a team.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred:Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or related field (e.g. Operations Research, Statistics).Experience in hospitality operations.Bilingual, English as the primary or secondary language.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.#LI-DR1

Name: VP,Business Consultant-Business Banking-Relocation Opportunity-San Jose, CA and Pasadena, CA
Description: Every day, we deliver innovative solutions at the forefront of fintech that help businesses better serve their customers, expand their business, protect themselves from fraud, and reimagine commerce. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we’ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We’re a leader with deep expertise and momentum.Bank of America Merchant Services is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Females, Minorities, Veterans and Disabled.Are you a driven sales executive with a successful track record in the merchant, bankcard, payment processing or financial services sectors? Do you thrive on helping businesses navigate rapid changes in consumer shopping behaviors? If so, consider a compelling career opportunity with Bank of America Merchant Services, a global leader in payments, eCommerce and security solutions.About UsEvery day, we deliver innovative solutions at the forefront of fintech that help businesses better serve their customers, expand their business, protect themselves from fraud, and reimagine commerce. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we’ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We’re a leader with deep expertise and momentum.About the RoleAs a Business Banking Business Consultant, you’ll work with medium-sized businesses on an array of interesting challenges. Surrounded by some of the best talent in the industry, you’ll help clients improve their customer shopping and payment experiences, optimize their online search capabilities, protect customer data, implement customer loyalty programs, launch dynamic mobile solutions, and turn big data into big opportunities.You’ll have complete ownership of both new and existing client relationships within an assigned portfolio of businesses that have revenues between $5 million and $50 million. You will use a solution-based, consultative sales approach to reach designated revenue growth goals. And you’ll have a variety of innovative, strategic partners to call on for everything from referrals to technical expertise.Work with a brand that opens doors for you and is recognized as a leader in payments, eCommerce and security. With outstanding opportunities for career advancement, earning potential and work/life balance, there’s no better place to grow, learn and succeed than Bank of America Merchant Services. We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of females, minorities, veterans and disabled.Key ResponsibilitiesAchieve client retention, margin and cross sale goals within an existing client portfolioProactively evaluate your clients’ business needs and recommend appropriate solutionsLeverage an assigned prospect list to establish new client relationships, meet those clients’ needs, and grow revenue for Bank of America Merchant ServicesMeasure success by portfolio revenue growth, cross sales and client satisfaction.Serve as a key resource to clients, using all of our relevant expertise and resources to deliver a positive experience.Understand the latest industry trends and effectively position our solutions and services to drive cross-sales opportunities.Influence and guide decision making within your clients’ organization.Develop routines that enable effective alignment, communication and collaboration with Bank of America Merchant Services’ partners, including Bank of America Treasury and Client teams and First Data technical/product experts.Own the resolution of issues, contract extensions and other important client matters.SkillsKnowledge and experience in payments, bankcard or related industry sales and consultation.Consultative mindset, with the ability to develop client and business strategies to maximize growth and development.Technologically savvy; comfortable with tablet and cloud-based solutions.Passion for continuously learning about and leveraging new technology.Strong prospecting and relationship building skills.Ability to close complex, high-profile deals and resolve client questions and concerns.Solution selling experience preferred.Ability to quickly establish and maintain productive relationships with senior executives.Highly motivated to succeed in a performance-driven environment.Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.Client-centric focus.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision toward the achievement of personal and team goals.Strong communication skills, including written, oral and presentation skills.Effective planning, prioritization and time management acumen.Outstanding sales/portfolio management, business development and negotiation abilities.Ability to multitask and change direction in fast-paced business environments.Ability to coach colleagues with less experience and/or knowledge, as necessary.ExperienceBachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience5+ years of sales/portfolio management experience, including C-level sales.ToolsProficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Ability to quickly learn various sales applications.Physical RequirementsWorks in varied environments involving sitting and standing. Ability to sit for prolonged periods of time, including as a driver or passenger in an automobile. Ability to utilize a tablet and telephone prolonged periods of time. Ability to visit and move around at client sites including the ability to maneuver in a variety of places. Ability to lift, carry, and otherwise transport work-related materials that may weigh up to 25 lbs. and that may occasionally weigh in excess of 25 lbs.TravelTravel is required to perform essential functions of the role.This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, performance standards, measurements, skills or requirements associated with this job. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require other or different tasks to be performed when circumstances change.5460#LI-SG1Bank of America Merchant Services ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.The employer will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the employer’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: SENIOR FINANCIAL SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description: The Senior Financial Systems Analyst role is responsible for the administration of the Company’s financial systems including Cognos, Timeline, Infinium, Great Plains, Blackline applications and other financial systems. This position will collaborate and interact within the finance, business and IT communities. The Senior Financial Systems Analyst must exhibit strong leadership, collaboration, accounting/financial acumen and communication skills, and effectively engage peers. This position reports to the Director of Financial Systems within the Accounting Organization.  Financial system management includes database validation and ensures data integrity and consistency between all financial systems for accuracy and completeness. Administers the financial reporting tools utilized by the company, which include Cognos and Timeline. Manages the general ledger chart of accounts, entity structure and period controls, and ensures all subsidiary systems are in agreement and properly maintained. Administers Blackline month end close Task, Journal Entry and Account Reconciliation modules. Administers the lease accounting software selected to comply with the FASB ASC 842 lease accounting standard.  The following and other duties may be assigned as necessary: Responsible for managing all functional components of assigned financial systems.Liaise with Internal Audit and the IT Departments to ensure compliance with user provisioning internal controls for the financial systems.Work collaboratively with internal and external resources to support and enhance the existing BI architecture.Develop and update security groups and roles as required to meet business objectives.Work with users to resolve a variety of customer issues for financial reporting and the general ledger.Develop and maintain documentation such as design documents, admin guides, etc.Application administration includes research and resolve issues with metadata, create and maintain hierarchies, write or modify basic calculation scripts or business rules, execute processes such as deploying data and updating variables, and maintain mapping of source data from local source systems to the financial reporting systems.Maintain the general ledger chart of accounts, time period controls and entity structure and ensure all subsidiary systems are kept in sync with one another.Provide support on all accounting and financial related systems, including collaborating with consultants and software vendors on projects.Assist with design, planning and testing of system upgrades and enhancements to accounting and financial related systems.Involvement in the implementation of new financial systems and upgrades/modifications to existing systems. This includes capturing business requirements, input data requirements, output requirements, input data acquisition, data governance, system controls, data validation and testing of the applications. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 21 years of age. Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management or equivalent.Accounting or Finance background and experience preferred.Strong understanding of OLAP concepts and financial business acumen.Working knowledge and experience with financial systems and operating systems is preferred (Cognos, Timeline, Great Plains, Infinium, AS400, Showcase).Experience with Blackline’s Account Reconciliation, Journal Entry, and Task modules preferred.Strong Microsoft Excel, Power Point, and Word skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to work in a high stress, fast paced environment managing multiple tasks, projects and personnel simultaneously. Must possess ability to prioritize conflicting duties for self and accounting department while maintaining timeline integrity for projects and tasks.Ability to multitask and meet deadlines under pressure.Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision/oversight by anticipating next steps.Able to communicate effectively in both verbal and written formats and present information appropriately based on the target audience; can take large volumes of complex information and present it in a meaningful and concise manner.Collaborates with colleagues across multiple disciplines and builds relationships to leverage information and insights.Ability to build trusting relationships and partner with end-users throughout the organization.Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams as well as in an independent setting.Attentive to details with ability to translate into the “big” picture.Regularly and proactively communicates work progress, concerns, and questions.Strong knowledge of finance and accounting concepts and experience supporting financial month end close.Creative problem solver who can provide both “tried-and-true” and “out-of-the-box” solutions.LANGUAGE SKILLS Ability to read and interpret documents in English, such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to read and communicate verbally in English. Written communication skills in in English may also be required. REASONING ABILITY Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS Employee must be able to qualify for licenses and permits required by federal, state and local regulations. Penn National Gaming, Inc. (Service Center)  3980 Howard Hughes Parkway  Las Vegas, NV 89169  Not the right job or location you’re looking for? Click here to submit your resume for general consideration!

Name: Fraud Risk Analyst II in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary Work with the fraud risk team and internal business partners to develop, implement, and evaluate fraud risk management strategies that reduce fraud losses, improve profit, increase efficiency, and improve the customer experience. Summary of Essential Job Functions • Perform tracking, reporting, and prepare presentations on key performance indicators. Analyze data for trends and recommend strategies to reduce fraud loss.Develop, implement, and evaluate fraud risk strategies.Manage projects under tight deadlines.Ad hoc analyses.Partner and collaborate with Operations, Compliance, and IT teams.Take initiative to improve reporting process and assist team.Be responsible for scorecard validations and tracking.Balance priorities to meet multiple deadlines. Job RequirementsPosition Requirements • Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business, Finance, Economies, Statistics or other quantitative area. Prefer 3-4 years of experience in fraud, credit or operational risk management or similar lending environment.Knowledge of fraud or credit risk analysis, and understanding of profitability drivers, financial analysis and credit reporting.Strong analytical skills advanced PC skills, the ability to think critically, as well as excellent communication and relationship-building skills. Modeling or CART analysis experience preferred.Proficiency in SAS, SAS EMiner and SQL or a similar programming language is required.Ability to transform big data into recommended actions to prevent fraud loss.Statistical modeling exposure including logistic regression, CHAID/CART analysis, and other general linear models. • Project management experience a plus. Experience in identifying and preventing transaction and payment fraud and/or experience in developing and/or using fraud risk models, algorithms or scorecards a plus. Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. Must possess the ability to effectively hear and communicate. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 2 pounds. Name: Operations Associate (Consultant)
Description: Job ID: 163356 Store Name/Number: NV-Miracle Mile (0046) Address: 3663 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV 89109, United States (US) Job Type: Part Time Hourly/Salaried: Hourly (Non-Exempt) Position Type: Regular Store Operations It takes a lot of behind-the-scenes effort to make sure our stores have the right products in the right place at the right time to fuel our clients' beauty obsessions. That’s where our operations team comes in, to keep our stores looking beautiful and running smoothly "backstage!" This team is the backbone of the store and essential in providing the best possible experience for every client that walks through our doors. Your role at Sephora: As an Operations Associate (Consultant), you help keep the store running smoothly “backstage” in partnership with the entire operations team. You will: In addition, you will: Complete daily processing and organization of damages, testers, and known theft productEnsure all shipping and receiving activities are completed and executed within the store in a timely mannerReview all visual elements in the store and communicate missing or damaged pieces to the Ops Manager or appropriate store leadershipMaintain and organize the backstage area as neededDemonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Work-Life Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, & InitiativeWe think you’d be a great for this role if you have:Minimum 1-year work experience, preferably in an operations capacityFlexible availability to work during “peak” retail hours such as nights, overnights, weekends, and holidays. In the ops role, you will be required to work early mornings, late evenings, and overnight stock shifts as neededStrong communication skills, ability to multitask, and comfortability with computer/store systemsYou’ll love working here because:The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work withThe product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product, often multiple times a month. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)The education. Sephora heavily invests in training for our store associates – not just product knowledge but building a personalized career plan with you so you can achieve your professional goals The perks. Sephora offers medical benefits, competitive 401k, gift matching, and a 'perks' program that includes various discounts at participating companies (hotels, rental cars, telecommunication, gyms, etc)The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 prestige brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Moet Chandon, Marc Jacobs, Dior, and so many moreOur legal team wants you to know what’s required:Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds and bend/stretch to stock shelvesAdherence to Sephora’s dress code and other policies in the Sephora Employee Handbook

Name: Management Analyst IV
Description: Job Summary The position provides fiscal and operational support for the Department of Employment, Training and Rehabilitation (DETR), Rehabilitation Division to ensure legal compliance by reviewing, interpreting and implementing federal regulations. The position provides program and fiscal input for the Divisions executive budgets, work programs and accompanying materials. The position monitors expenditures and internal controls. The position collaborates with various internal and external partners on programs, including Third Party Cooperative Arrangements (TPCAs), Pre-Employment Transition Services, and facilities management. The position prepares state and federal fiscal reports, as requested by the Administrator and/or Deputy Administrator. The position is responsible for preparation of work programs for the Divisions five budget accounts.  The position implements and evaluates operation procedures, and manages flow of workloads through various Division units within Accounting, Contracting and TPCA staff. The position monitors the Third Party Cooperative Agreements and ensures quality internal controls are followed. The position also participates in audits. Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university in public or business administration, finance, social sciences, mathematics or related field and four years of professional experience in the research, development, evaluation or revision of programs, organizations, methods or procedures; OR one year of experience as a Management Analyst III in Nevada State service; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience on a year-for-year basis.  Please let me know if you have any further questions.  Job Type: Contract  Salary: $59,236.00 /year  Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: data analyst functional
Description: Position Title:Oracle e-Business Suite (EBS) Senior Procurement Specialist (Data Analyst)Estimated start date:July 31, 2018Estimated end date:September 28, 2018This position is for a Functional Data Analyst within the Procurement Systems team.All applicantsMUST BE AN U.S. CITIZEN – NO EXCEPTIONS.Position Description and Specific Duties to be performed:This person will work closely with Oracle e-Business Suite professionals that work to support the Oracle Release 12.1.3 products, primarily Procurement, i-Procurement, and associated extensions and customizations. Currently Oracle Procurement, i-Procurement, General Ledger, Project Costing, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Cash Management, i-Expense and associated extensions are included in the Oracle Suite of products being utilized.Primary responsibility will include all tasks required to successfully report on data stored within Oracle. Responsibilities will include analyzing ad-hoc report requests, identifying data locations within Oracle table/view structure, writing reusable SQL commands to extract relevant data, creating reusable reports within Microsoft Excel utilizing both tabular and graphical representations. Additionally, candidate will work with the Procurement Systems team and Procurement Management to renovate and automate existing metrics utilizing Toad and Microsoft Excel. Other responsibilities include auditing existing reporting functions to ensure accuracy and documenting data structure/locations for future reporting use. Will also follow defined standards and processes, change management processes, and other company policies and regulations.The current e-Business Suite implementation includes many interfaces and enhancements within the Purchasing Module including wholly internally developed Just-In-Time (JIT) and Requisition Compliance Review (RCR) modules that must be understood to ensure any design solution will integrate with existing Oracle modules and interfacing applications. Shared HR is being used with PeopleSoft as the system of record.Required Skills:Documented ability to generate well-formatted reports (tabular and graphical) in Microsoft Excel utilizing SQL queries against Oracle data. Preferred, but not required, experience utilizing PowerBI and Noetix Views. Must be able to independently interpret and deliver on reporting requests.Must Possess:Must possess strong data analysis skills including data reporting, communicating with stakeholders, generating reusable queries, and writing documentation for future-use.Qualifications:Successful candidate should possess a Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent training and experience with at least 5 years relevant, progressively responsible experience.Excellent communications and interpersonal skills.Written communication skills including the ability to document functional requirements and specifications, technical design documentation, test plans and training materials.Demonstrated leadership qualities and the ability to exercise a high degree of judgment and discretion.Ability to establish and maintain strong and effective customer relations.Ability to multi-task and to work effectively in an independent and dynamic environment while balancing and prioritizing a heavy workload.

Name: Implementation Consultant, Utility Billing Software
Description: Tylers Incode Utility Billingsuite of applications are a perfect fit for both municipal and independent utility authorities for services such as water, gas, and electric with basic or tiered rate tables. Our applications also accommodate consumption, flat-rate, assessment, installation agreement billing, and miscellaneous charges.  The Implementation Consultant is responsible for delivering high quality knowledge transfer services to clients allowing them to use Tyler software products efficiently and effectively to achieve daily operations. The knowledge transfers services can be on-site, or via webinar. The incumbent consults and partners with clients to gain a comprehensive understanding of workflow, business/technical requirements and needs to ensure that the knowledge transfer addresses clients needs. The Consultant ensures that the transition to Tyler software is completed according to predetermined timelines and establishes a positive baseline for the new relationship between the client site and Tyler Technologies. Name: Business Consultant / Seasoned Executive
Description: Job DescriptionInternational Services, Inc. is looking for highly experienced management professionals who have owned or been an executive in a successful business and/or specialized in Turnaround and Improvement Consulting for small and medium-sized businesses in the US and Canada.  Our mission is clear and simple: we improve all aspects of our clients company by being directly involved in transforming the day-to-day behaviors of owners and employees and always delivering financially measurable results. International Services, Inc. has opportunities for individuals with demonstrated abilities and proven performance in all aspects of turning around a business: profit and productivity improvement, increasing sales, maximizing efficiencies, behavior modification and organizational development. If you have extensive executive management/business ownership experience in diagnosing, evaluating, and most importantly, implementing business solutions for value-driven results on a grassroots, hands-on level, this may be the opportunity for you.  This is a 100% travel position. You must be willing to fly from your home airport every Sunday night, and not return home until Friday afternoon. Clients tend to be privately owned, small to medium-sized businesses ($1-$15 Million). No sales or relocation required and travel expenses are either covered or reimbursed. Requirements · A minimum of 15 years of: successful business management experience and/or business ownership is required  · Proven ability to creatively increase sales  · Experience in implementing effective and efficient improvements to operations  · The ability to create from scratch and interpret Profit/Loss Statements, Balance Sheets, Budgets, and Cash Flow Forecasts  · Four year college/university degree required;  · Computer proficiency (MS Office, Internet, etc.) are mandatory We are recruiting for classes beginning inDecember. We have a very competitive compensation package ($75,000 to $98,000 first year), plus experienced Consultants and Project Manager earn well into the six (6) figure incomes. We also provide the opportunity to become an integral part of the continued growth of our organization. If you have the passion, confidence, and tenacity to change people's behavior and improve their lives and livelihood, this might be the position for you.  Please forward resume to the Selection Committee:Company DescriptionAt ISI our mission is clear and simple: we improve all aspects of our clients company by being directly involved in transforming the day-to-day behaviors of owners and employees and always delivering financially measurable results.

Name: Financial Analyst, Revenue - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Financial Analyst, Revenue Resident Shows DivisionRegular Position  Cirque du Soleil is much more than just a show: its also you. At the center of Cirque's creative energy are talented people with a passion for challenging their own limits. Life at Cirque is about creating wonderment with colleagues of enlightening talent and to do so, at nothing less than the speed of light. Together, we work hard, juggle priorities, sometimes shift trajectories, always have loads of fun and, above all, dare to reinvent ourselves, to reach for and to meet new challenges.  Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the Financial Analyst, Revenue will provide support and analyses to Resident Shows management to enable the efficient management of human and financial resources.  The ideal candidate will be viewed as a trusted business advisor and must demonstrate excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, be highly organized, self-motivated, and a solution-oriented problem-solver with the ability to handle a variety of tasks independently and efficiently. Additionally, this individual must be energetic, ethical, and desire a challenging work environment.  The primary responsibility of the Financial Analyst, Revenue is to assist in all phases of revenue forecasting and reporting, including daily-weekly-monthly reporting, dash-boarding of key metrics, and ad-hoc business analysis for Cirque du Soleil resident show division. You will be a champion at: Developing in-depth knowledge of show revenue and serving as a business advisor to management;  Developing the annual budgets (per show, per day revenue projections), and monthly forecasting of revenue for all shows;  Ensuring the accuracy and completeness of revenue results of the all shows;  Analyzing and reviewing periodic results with Resident Shows management;  Identifying opportunities to improve the consistency and accuracy of the financial information;  Producing strategic analyses and what-if business analysis to optimize management decision making;  Promoting compliance with the organizations financial policies and procedures  Monitoring and assuring Cirque and Partner compliance with the terms and conditions of the Performance Agreement;  Serving as a financial liaison between Cirques Executive team, the Shows, and the Partner;  Providing finance support for the development of new tools and methods to support internal customers;  Assisting in formulating and implementing new financial systems, tools, and methods;  Assisting in development and daily preparation of revenue related managerial reports used for tracking and analysis;  Preparing and distributing various daily, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports in accordance with established practices and procedures;  Preparing various managerial reports for executive review;  Performing all other job related duties as requested. Ideally, you will have: Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance or related field;  Four to six years of relevant business experience; 2 years in revenue analytics;  Detail oriented with an ability to see the larger picture in order to make decisions;  Strong working knowledge of Microsoft tools (Word, PowerPoint, Access);  Advanced Excel skills required;  Experience with an ERP or comparable business information system, (SAP an asset) and reporting tools (Longview is a plus);  Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to achieve results through proactive research;  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;  Excellent organizational skills to function effectively with attention to detail while meeting targeted deadlines;  Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills;  Experience with SQL Language and Tableau is an asset;  Fluency in English; French is an asset.

Name: Analyst I Direct Marketing
Description: Required:Bachelor's degree in computer science, economics, marketing or related field of study, or equivalent education and experience with a similar database roleQuantitative, analytical, and strategic skillsMust be technically skilled and have experience using data analysis tools.Advanced proficiency Microsoft Excel & Access.Strong interest in a career in marketing driven by analyticsMust be capable of adapting to a fluid environmentAbility to follow directions and produce requested outputs, with minimal errors, working with senior team members and management.Ability to work independently with minimal direction while also functioning and contributing as part of a teamAbility to plan, prioritize and organize effectively, handle multiple high priority projects concurrently and react quickly to shifting prioritiesMust be able to obtain/maintain any necessary certifications and/or licenses as required by local gaming regulations.Excellent written and oral communication skills, with comfort communication to all organization levelsExcellent communication, proofreading and organizational skills requiredPreferred Qualifications:Experience utilizing Cognos, Microstrategies, SAS or other similar database query tools.Experience in writing and executing SQL queries.Experience with casino/hotel database marketing systems and property CMS functions.At least 1 year of experience in relevant subject area expertise (e.g., industry or function). Name: Data Analyst II - Direct Marketing, Data Production in Las Vegas, NV at Credit One Bank
Description: Job DescriptionCredit One Bank is a technology and data-driven financial services company offering a full range of consumer credit card products. In addition to being one of the largest credit card banks in the United States, Credit One Bank is the exclusive issuer of the Official Credit Card of NASCAR and the Official Credit Card of the NHL’s Vegas Golden Knights.  We’re looking for highly qualified professionals at our new, state-of-the-art, corporate headquarters in Las Vegas, NV. In addition to providing our card members with superior value and service, we are dedicated to providing engaging and challenging career opportunities for our employees. Production/Quality/Reporting group is focused diligently on improving Credit One Bank’s current way of doing things through enhanced process design, implementation of new tools/technologies, data driven decision making, and laser focus on quality and accuracy. They will leverage their analytical, project management, and critical thinking expertise to provide data-driven decision making, while maintaining positive rapport with internal/external stakeholders. Name: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Other Locations: US-IL-Chicago  Job Number: 18212361  CTG is seeking a resource to support the ClairVia workforce application utilized for clinical staff scheduling and determining patient acuity. There are three programs in the ClairVia software suite: CVM Client, CVM Web and CVM Administrator. This resource should be familiar with NPAS Assessments imported from Cerner to measure patient acuity.  Responsibilities include all support such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This position is remote. Must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Will be part of on call rotation.  Census Mismatch  Due to workflow issues between Cerner and ClairVia, there will be instances where the census (i.e. patient list) in ClairVia will not be the same as the census in Cerner Millennium (i.e. PowerChart). This will present itself to users as ClairVia either having extra patients or missing patients. Resolution involves finding out the erroneous patient?s FIN (AKA encounter number) and checking Cerner records to manually transfer or discharge the patient accordingly.  Interface issues  There are interfaces between ClairVia and Clockwork, Banner / HR Front End, and the production ADT interface. The Clockwork and Banner interfaces deal with new users / employees being imported to ClairVia. The HR import file needs to be checked to ensure the new employees have their correct cost center coming across.  System Down  Multiple users cannot access ClairVia. Confirm if it is one or all ClairVia applications that cannot be accessed (Web or Client ). Ping the relevant servers and gather relevant information to engage the vendor and the sever team.  Patient Acuity? Manage patient acuity based on NPAS assessments? NPAS (Nurse Patient Assessment System) powerform data imported real-time from Cerner? Custom tool developed by UIMC in 2005? Not used by all units, some use Clairvia acuity (such as 8E Psych) while others use different acuity systems (such as Surgical Services and the Emergency Department) while others don?t use an acuity system? Acuity used for patient assignment of RNs and NTs  Common Requests  Access Request of various levels of access and New builds for nursing units/clinics based on user specifications Other applications supported include:Healthstream Morrisey MSOWAllscripts SCMSunquest LISGE MUSE/PowerScribe 360/Provation MDMcKesson EnterpriseRxCerner Millennium/TransChart/Teletracking XTMidas Plus/VizientOptum Computer Assisted CodingQualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran. Name: SENIOR FINANCIAL SYSTEMS ANALYST
Company: Penn National Gaming, Inc. (Service Center) - Las Vegas, NV
Description: What would I be doing?The Senior Financial Systems Analyst role is responsible for the administration of the Company’s financial systems including Cognos, Timeline, Infinium, Great Plains, Blackline applications and other financial systems. This position will collaborate and interact within the finance, business and IT communities. The Senior Financial Systems Analyst must exhibit strong leadership, collaboration, accounting/financial acumen and communication skills, and effectively engage peers. This position reports to the Director of Financial Systems within the Accounting Organization.  Financial system management includes database validation and ensures data integrity and consistency between all financial systems for accuracy and completeness. Administers the financial reporting tools utilized by the company, which include Cognos and Timeline. Manages the general ledger chart of accounts, entity structure and period controls, and ensures all subsidiary systems are in agreement and properly maintained. Administers Blackline month end close Task, Journal Entry and Account Reconciliation modules. Administers the lease accounting software selected to comply with the FASB ASC 842 lease accounting standard.ResponsibilitiesThe following and other duties may be assigned as necessary: Responsible for managing all functional components of assigned financial systems.Liaise with Internal Audit and the IT Departments to ensure compliance with user provisioning internal controls for the financial systems.Work collaboratively with internal and external resources to support and enhance the existing BI architecture.Develop and update security groups and roles as required to meet business objectives.Work with users to resolve a variety of customer issues for financial reporting and the general ledger.Develop and maintain documentation such as design documents, admin guides, etc.Application administration includes research and resolve issues with metadata, create and maintain hierarchies, write or modify basic calculation scripts or business rules, execute processes such as deploying data and updating variables, and maintain mapping of source data from local source systems to the financial reporting systems.Maintain the general ledger chart of accounts, time period controls and entity structure and ensure all subsidiary systems are kept in sync with one another.Provide support on all accounting and financial related systems, including collaborating with consultants and software vendors on projects.Assist with design, planning and testing of system upgrades and enhancements to accounting and financial related systems.Involvement in the implementation of new financial systems and upgrades/modifications to existing systems. This includes capturing business requirements, input data requirements, output requirements, input data acquisition, data governance, system controls, data validation and testing of the applications. What are we looking for?To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 21 years of age. Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management or equivalent.Accounting or Finance background and experience preferred.Strong understanding of OLAP concepts and financial business acumen.Working knowledge and experience with financial systems and operating systems is preferred (Cognos, Timeline, Great Plains, Infinium, AS400, Showcase).Experience with Blackline’s Account Reconciliation, Journal Entry, and Task modules preferred.Strong Microsoft Excel, Power Point, and Word skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to work in a high stress, fast paced environment managing multiple tasks, projects and personnel simultaneously. Must possess ability to prioritize conflicting duties for self and accounting department while maintaining timeline integrity for projects and tasks.Ability to multitask and meet deadlines under pressure.Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision/oversight by anticipating next steps.Able to communicate effectively in both verbal and written formats and present information appropriately based on the target audience; can take large volumes of complex information and present it in a meaningful and concise manner.Collaborates with colleagues across multiple disciplines and builds relationships to leverage information and insights.Ability to build trusting relationships and partner with end-users throughout the organization.Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams as well as in an independent setting.Attentive to details with ability to translate into the “big” picture.Regularly and proactively communicates work progress, concerns, and questions.Strong knowledge of finance and accounting concepts and experience supporting financial month end close.Creative problem solver who can provide both “tried-and-true” and “out-of-the-box” solutions.LANGUAGE SKILLS Ability to read and interpret documents in English, such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to read and communicate verbally in English. Written communication skills in in English may also be required. REASONING ABILITY Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS Employee must be able to qualify for licenses and permits required by federal, state and local regulations.What would it be like to work at this property?Penn National Gaming, Inc. (Service Center)  3980 Howard Hughes ParkwayLas Vegas, NV 89169  Not the right job or location you’re looking for? Click here to submit your resume for general consideration!

Name: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months
Description: Title: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months  Location: United States  Job Number: 18210817  CTG is seeking Epic Bridges Integration Analysts assist with an implementation and upcoming go-live for a client in TN. Analysts will work primarily remote, but may need to go on-site for occasional events.  The consultant will be required to coordinate the analysis, technical design, and all issue triage necessary to implement and support their assigned interfaces. The consultant will work closely with the application and technical teams to ensure that interfaces meet the needs of end users.  The consultant will be responsible for the following duties: Manage the entire cycle of interface application development, including analysis, design, specification, implementation, go-live, and support.Work closely with application teams, subject matter experts, and third-party application experts to determine the business needs for interfaces, document the requirements, and configure the interfaces per the requirements.Work to diagnose and resolve interface-related issues, and participating in their projects as needed.Coordinate various interface-specific tasks and activities like testing, build, cutover planning, and implementation by engaging subject matter experts and developers.Work with the team to develop methods to support Epic's and external systems' data and format needs.Provide proactive support by monitoring live interfaces and collaborating with experts to provide permanent resolutions to problems.Ensure that data coming across an interface into an Epic application meets the business need.Optimize the interface to provide more efficient processing of interface messages.Interface error analysis.Build/modify interface error work queues for application teams.Build and maintain translation tables.Manage Error work queues for trends in errors and working with the appropriate application team during go-live.Requirements:EPIC Bridges Certification with updated NVT'sA minimum of 3 years? experience with multiple Epic implementationsExperience working with HL7, SQL, Javascripting and other scripting languages is requiredStrong Excel experiencePrior consulting experience Location: Chattanooga TN & Remote  Duration: 5 months  Apply today or email your resume directly to kathy.moore@ctg.com Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran. Name: Developer Sr Analyst
Description: HMS makes the healthcare system work better for everyone. We fight fraud, waste, and abuse so people have access to healthcare?now and in the future. Using innovative technology and powerful data analytics, we help government and commercial payers reduce costs, increase quality, and achieve regulatory compliance. We also help consumers take a more active role in their own health. Each year, we save our clients billions of dollars while helping people live healthier lives. At HMS, you will develop new skills and build your career in a dynamic industry while making a difference in the lives of others.  We are seeking a talented individual for a **Senior Developer/Analyst** who participates in the full development life cycle of business software including design, development, unit/load testing, deployment and maintenance of a software system and implementation of business software for the enterprise. Provides expertise in one or more programming specialties such as server-side web presentation technologies. *Essential Responsibilities:** + Analyzes, designs, and builds component-based application in a Web/internet delivery environment.  + Designs and develops software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.  + Writes software programming applications working on new and existing applications along with enhancements to web sites, web applications, and infrastructure.  + Modifies existing software to correct errors, to adapt it to new hardware or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance  + Works with Business Systems Analysts to ensure programming code meets business requirements.  + Monitors functioning of equipment to ensure system operates in conformance with specifications.  + Consults with engineering staff to evaluate interface between hardware and software, develops specifications and performance requirements and resolves customer problems.  + Coordinates installation of software system. *Non-Essential Responsibilities:** + Performs other functions as assigned *Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:** + Ability to apply mastery level knowledge in at least one required programming language (Java, C ,.Net)  + Ability to apply mastery level knowledge of web architecture, design, development tools, and languages (JSP, JDBC, Java Servlets, Javabeans/EJBs, ASP, VB Script, SQL, Perl, UNIX, C , CORBA, Javascript, SOAP, XML/XSLT, FOP, HTML, Struts, ANT, CVS, CMP, Weblogic)  + Ability to apply mastery knowledge of relational data base (DB2, Sybase, SQL, Teradata, Oracle 8i/9i/10g/11i)  + Ability to apply mastery knowledge of data warehousing technologies (Informatica, MicroStrategy)  + Ability to demonstrate experience in distributed UNIX environments.  + Ability to demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio.  + Ability to demonstrate beginner level understanding of Microsoft Project.  + Ability to multi-task and work under pressure.  + Ability to be careful and thorough with detail.  + Ability to work both independently and in a collaborative environment.  + Ability to analyze information and use logic to address work related issues and problems. *Work Conditions and Physical Demands:** + Primarily sedentary work in a general office environment  + Ability to communicate and exchange information  + Ability to comprehend and interpret documents and data  + Requires occasional standing, walking, lifting, and moving objects (up to 10 lbs.)  + Requires manual dexterity to use computer, telephone and peripherals  + May be required to work extended hours for special business needs  + May be required to travel at least 10% of time based on business needs *Minimum Education:** + Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience required *Minimum Related Work Experience:** + 5 (or Master?s degree & 3 ) years related experience including application design, software development, maintenance and delivery  + 3 years experience with application servers  _Nothing in this job description restricts management?s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time._ *Title:** _Developer Sr Analyst_*Location:** _Nevada-Las Vegas_*Requisition ID:** _180010Q8_ EEO/Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

Name: Business Consultant Diversity and Inclusion (Corporate)
Description: Location:Las Vegas, NevadaBecome one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race.The mission of the Corporate Diversity and Community Engagement Department (the “Department”) is to implement and support the Corporate Social Responsibility (“CSR”) values, initiatives and programs of MGM Resorts International (the “Company”), in alignment with the Company’s general mission, vision and other core values. The Diversity & Inclusion Strategy Team is the Company’s primary business group for promotion of D&I as a core value in the culture and operations of the Company, including development and implementation of key D&I strategies, policy and programming; D&I analytics; and D&I as a key driver of employee engagement. Key focus areas of the D&I Team include design and installation of D&I policy, initiatives and programs in critical Company operations across business segments – with emphasis on the critical subject matter of D & I, Company culture and leadership development among all levels of management and front-line employees; leadership of the property/corporate division Corporate Social Responsibility (“CSR”) Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the enterprise-wide Employee Network Groups (“ENGs”); and central Company resource for D&I best practices – as well as other special events and activities as designated. This position is an integral part of supporting all strategies, initiatives and programs of the D & I Team.All Department positions serve as Company and Department ambassadors, and support enhancement of the Company’s profile and reputation as a major leader in CSR and its pillars: diversity and inclusion; giving, philanthropy, volunteerism and community engagement; and environmental sustainability.All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts International policies, practices, and procedures.Responsible for implementation of the leadership development initiatives/components of our CSR Councils and Employee Network Groups (“ENG”) – such as our Learning Experiences Accelerate Development (“LEAD”) Program and other similar programs – whose content includes subject matter related to Diversity & Inclusion, the Company’s mission, vision and values, Company culture, leadership and talent development and employee engagement, all in alignment with Company-wide goals, objectives and other subject matter (such as S.H.O.W. and leadership expectations).Takes independent, decisive action in managing the implementation of the LEAD development program and other similar D&I learning programs and initiatives.Drives the development of Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”) for the LEAD development program and other similar D&I development programs and initiatives.Designs, develops and delivers a strategy for use of Waggl and/or other comparable employee communications technology to deliver D&I messaging and gather employee feedback on the effectiveness of the development programs associated with our CSR Councils and ENGs – such as LEAD.Conducts surveys, and produces, compiles and evaluates data for measurement of KPIs, including content quality, participation, satisfaction, performance and business impact, pertaining to the development programs associated with our CSR Councils and ENGs – such as LEAD or other similar programs, and develops/recommends alternative training methods if expected outcomes are not seen.Develops evaluative reports based on KPIs and research data pertaining to the development programs associated with our CSR Councils and ENGs – such as LEAD or other similar programs – for D&I Team leadership, Department leadership, Company senior leadership and the Company’s Board of Directors CSR Committee. Leads and facilitates decision-making discussions with key stakeholders to determine changes and upgrades to the development programs, such as LEAD, associated with our CSR Councils and ENGs.Enhances the subject matter expertise of the D&I Team through research and analysis and external benchmarking of D&I leadership development best practices related to dedicated employee engagement groups such as the CSR Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the ENGs.Responsible for setting and maintaining timetables for projects; manages deadlines and resources; works with a wide degree of creativity and latitude as well as minimal supervision; and regularly updates his/her own skills through on-going training and formal education.Provides leadership/career development coaching and guidance on an individual basis to employees who may be participants in/members of the CSR Councils, the related Joint CSR Council and the ENGs.Engages in self-directed work; sets and maintains timetables for projects; manages deadlines and resources; works with a wide degree of creativity and latitude as well as minimal supervision; and regularly updates his/her own skills through on-going training and formal education.Acts as a mentor of other Company employees and models the competencies and standards of effective leadership; participates in Company-sponsored volunteer and other CSR opportunities.Supports other initiatives, programs and projects of the Department, as assigned.Other job-related duties as requested.Required:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, training and experience will be considered.At least 3 years of experience in a relevant Diversity & Inclusion role, or related experience.Ability to effectively communicate in English, in both oral and written forms.Excellent customer service skills.Able to lead and mentor a team.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred: Bachelor’s degree, with a concentration in Business, Human Resources, Organizational Development or subject matter related to Diversity and Inclusion or equivalent.At least 4 years of experience in the above-stated required competencies.Previous experience working in hospitality or a similar resort setting.Ability to conduct oral communications effectively in Spanish as well as English.#LI-DR1

Name: Global Gaming Analyst
Description: The primary responsibility of the Analyst is to correlate business data, perform analysis and represent findings in an insightful fashion to support data-driven improvements that maximize business insights and result in directing business strategies across the portfolio. Success in role will require effective collaboration and partnership with analysist, data experts and business leaders across the business.  If you are a critical thinker who excels in framing complex problems, able to design and analyze quantitative and qualitative information, and have a proven track record of developing and landing clear, defensible analytical insights, then this is the career opportunity for you.  The successful candidate will have a strong passion for technology and of demonstrated aptitudes in: Strong analytical skills that provide actionable outcomesData visualization skills and techniques to cohesively represent analysisMaintain expertise across several data areas and work effectively with business partners to ensure that the data is usable, accurate, and ready to meet the business needsWork with analysts and data warehouse teams to understand data structures and elements to effectively leverage and correlate dataKnowledge of databases, data integration, and Business Intelligence best practicesWillingness to learn new tools to access, analyze and visualize data First Year Goals Gain proficiency with back office reporting systems and data structureBecome familiar with stakeholders and partners within the businessEstablish efficient and effective product portfolio, R&D and KPI reporting tools Required QualificationsMinimum 5+ years' experience requiredBachelor's Degree with major in Business, Finance, or Information Systems requiredProficiency in data analysis, modeling and reporting toolsStrong interpersonal communication and presentation skillsAbility to travel on occasion Preferred QualificationsExpert with data analytical tools; Tableau, Power BI, SQL, other databasesExperience with SAP/Business Warehouse a plusGaming Industry experience advantageous Special requirements needed Security Investigation Ability to Travel  Keys To Success PassionatePioneeringResponsibleAuthenticCollaborative#LI-BI1 #di  ~cb~ IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted

Name: Resident: Storage Management Consultant
Description: Las Vegas, Nevada - Added 2018-10-18  Resident: Storage Management ConsultantWe want people, not paper. Your resume is great and all, but we want to know what drives you? Join TSP and become part of a team of empowered individuals that create award-winning solutions. We focus on, and successfully meet our clients’ needs with people like YOU.  We are looking for a NetApp Resident Consultant to support our customer in Las Vegas, NV.Scope of Work: CDOT OnTap management. Should have good understanding of OnTap cli, GUI, install and configurations of systems, creation of volumes/shares, host side configuration (mount, tests etc.). snap-mirror, snap vault and all associated tools. Should be able to troubleshoot cDOT from the network and Linux client perspective. CIFS cDOT understanding required also. NFS expertise everything related to NFS, mounting shares on LINUX clients and hosts, working with ACLS on OnTap and associated configs on the host. CIFS, SnapMirror replication and performance troubleshooting on NetApp controllers.As the next Storage Management Consultant, you’ll be taking on these responsibilities: cDOT Installation, Administration and MigrationsConsultant to handle daily NetApp storage tasks and troubleshoot escalated issues.Trusted advisor for the customer and for the Account teamMonitor performance related concerns We know you can handle these things because you have experience like: Expert knowledge of NAS/SAN EnvironmentsExpert knowledge of NetApp cDOT Core technologiesExpert working with SnapMirror & SnapVaultExpert with NFSExpert knowledge LinuxExpert knowledge of SnapCenterExpert knowledge GUI If you feel stuck in your current position, consider joining our team. Here are some awesome reasons why you should:Notoriety You get to work in and around some of the nation’s largest and most well-known brands. Nearly every business today has IT needs, and TSP loves to meet those needs for our clients. Training and Development We love to promote our #TSProckstars up through the ranks. Certification opportunities, online training curriculum, and hands-on experience all play a part in our training program. Our Benefits Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and 401(k) are just some of the benefits you get as a team member. Oh, and did we mention, you only have to pay a small portion of the health premiums. Everything else is 100% free!  We are thrilled that you’d like to join our team and look forward to speaking with you! All you have to do now is apply.  (*MON*) #DICE

Name: Senior Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: Don’t just work. Work Happy. A career in gaming? At Penn National Gaming we think you’ll enjoy an exciting industry, fast-paced days and nights, diverse, enthusiastic co-workers, unlimited growth and support from one of the leaders in the industry.  An individual could be successful if they possess the following. SUMMARY The Senior Financial Reporting Analyst is responsible for assisting in the preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in both internal and external formatted financial reporting deliverables, inclusive of earnings releases, Form 10-Qs, 10-Ks, 8-Ks, Proxy Statements, state regulatory reports, and other filing documents. This role also assists in preparing various financial statement schedules necessary in the monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidation process. RESPONSIBILITIES The following and other duties may be assigned as necessary for the entire enterprise: Responsible for assisting in the preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in both internal and external formatted financial reporting deliverables, inclusive of earnings releases, Form 10-Qs, 10-Ks, 8-Ks, Proxy Statements, state regulatory reports, and other filing documents.Prepares the consolidation of financial statements in accordance with US GAAP, including other supporting documentation for both internal and external reporting. This includes but is not limited to state regulatory purposes.Prepares Form 10-Qs, Form 10-Ks, Proxy Statements, and other SEC filing documents in accordance with SEC regulations.Responsible for coordinating with various groups within the organization to complete assignments and projects as needed.Establishes and maintains productive working relationships with other groups within the organization including but not limited to, Accounting, Tax, Finance, and Legal.Assists in maintaining and communicating changes in financial accounting policies throughout the organization as needed.Ensures applicable documentation is developed in an organized format for both electronic and hard-copy retrieval.Develops and maintains communication vehicles to distribute key operating metrics and analytical findings.Performs special projects and ad hoc analysis as requested.Responsible for ensuring the compliance with all regulatory compliance within area of responsibility and reporting potential issues to Manager.Maintains strict confidentiality in all departmental and company matters.Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S.) from accredited four-year college in Finance, Accounting, or related field; two or more years’ experience in financial reporting or public accounting with publicly traded companies; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of general accounting policies and financial statement procedures, including US GAAP, related regulatory requirements, and SEC guidelines, required. Experience with SEC financial filings and XBRL preferred.Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to quickly learn and comprehend processes and new technology.Must have working knowledge of and current and new accounting pronouncements and/or SEC guidance that affect financial reporting.Must have technical proficiency and knowledge in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) and automated financial systems.Must be able to work under pressure and meet assigned deadlines.Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.Must have excellent organization skills and be detailed oriented.Ability to write reports and business correspondence.Must be able to meet deadlines, including projects that require a quick time frame.Ability to successfully work independently while balancing multiple projects.Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.Must have the ability to interact with colleagues and resolve problems and conflicts in a diplomatic and tactful manner. Penn National Gaming is more than you may realize. We have properties throughout the United States and Canada and are embarking on an aggressive growth mode. Our departments and areas of opportunity are ideal for just about any skill set. And our company-wide commitment to making sure our guests smile as much as we do means you’ll enjoy a fun working environment. Name: Accounting Management Consultant
Description: As an Accounting Management Consultant, you will play an instrumental role in assisting clients in a variety of challenging projects to maintain accounting principles, practices and procedures and ensure accurate and timely financial statements.  ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP  Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues  A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues  Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues  Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents  A strong personal identification with RGP’s values – loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE  Lead month-end close process, including maintaining the general ledger and sub ledgers, prepare and review journal entries, balance sheet account reconciliations, and analyze account variances  Direct operational accounting, reconciliation and reporting, communicate and follow up with business partners to ensure that issues are resolved in a timely manner  Ensure appropriate accounting treatment in accordance with GAAP  Prepare and analyze monthly and quarterly reports as required by Client’s policies and procedures, identify and implement process improvements and system enhancements  Review client’s policies and procedures to ensure SOX compliance  DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor’s Degree of Accounting, Finance or related field required  Master’s Degree preferred  CPA or CMA preferred  8-plus years of public accounting, related consulting or industry experience  Experienced with general ledger accounting, month-end close, reconciliations, financial statements, variance analysis and strong knowledge of US GAAP  Experience with ERP systems and strong Excel  Excellent communication and facilitation skills to build relationships and foster trust at all organizational levels and a strong client service orientation.
