Name: Senior Analyst - SOX and Control Initiatives
Description: Position Overview  The primary responsibility of the Senior Analyst SOX and Control Initiatives is to assist the Director SOX and Control Initiatives in facilitating, planning and managing the finance group's internal control program across Las Vegas Sands Corp. (the Company) properties, focusing on compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX). All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Las Vegas Sands Corp.'s policies, practices, and procedures.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Implement, enhance and manage the Company's global SOX compliance program by continuously defining risks and key controlsImplement AS5 and other control rationalization guidance for both the business process and the general computer control environmentsAssist Director with process documentation, evaluation of processes and systems, process improvement, data analysis, teaming with project implementation teams, and investigations.Coordinate self-assessments with process owners and assist them in updating policies and proceduresCoordinate testing with internal and external audit teamsDevelop the annual reporting documentationAssist the Director SOX and Control Initiatives in completing the annual SOX risk assessment and annual reporting requirementsPerform and document walkthroughs and transaction flows of SOX and other business processes globallyAssist in the development of testing plans to assess compliance with SOX requirementsFacilitate contact with process owners, internal and external audit teams, concerning internal control testingTrack and validate internal control issues identified by audit teams, management, and self-assessmentsMonitor remediation of internal control issuesMaintain documentation of internal controls across domains (SOX) and assists operations and IT departments in updating policies and proceduresAssist other departments in process and control enhancements, remediation of audit findings, and various special projects, as needed, within Finance/Accounting.Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job.Performs other related duties as assigned. Company Standards of Conduct  All Las Vegas Sands Corp. Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company's standards, work requirements and rules of conduct. Team Members are expected to behave in a manner that supports a harmonious work environment to help us deliver unmatched service to our guests and customers. Minimum Qualifications21 years of age.Proof of authorization to work in the United StatesLas Vegas Sands Corp. is an E-Verify employerAdditional information regarding E-Verify can be found at http://www.uscis.gov/e-verifyBachelor's degree in accounting, auditing, business or information technologyGraduate degree in business or professional certification(s) related to internal controls (CPA, CIA, CISA, etc.) preferredMust be able to obtain and maintain a Nevada Gaming Control Board Registration and any other certification or license, as required by law or policy.2+ years of direct business process, auditing or information technology (IT) internal controls experience required, which must include working with large companies that have a significant number of applications and processesExperience working in the gaming industry preferredAbility to Travel as neededProficient in Microsoft Office 2013, including Visio and OutlookSkilled in process documentation and flowchartingBasic understanding of information security, operations and change management and the impact of IT controls on SOX complianceAbility to provide solutions to identified problems or process weaknessesTrained in gaming compliance and/or hospitality best practicesResourceful self-starter and problem solver in deploying the organization's initiatives relating to managing process change, executing internal control implementation, providing ongoing guidance and monitoring to ensure processes and controls are properly designed to maximize effectiveness and efficiency, educating business users responsible for business process, and maintaining compliance with SOX, COSO, and other internal control requirements.Strong project management skills in coordinating activities associated with the SOX program and control testing accomplished by the LVSC Audit Services Group and external audit firm. Strong relationship and inter-personal skills are also necessary in coordinating the requirements of the various process owners, across multiple departments and global jurisdictions, in the SOX program.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both in spoken and written form.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience.Must be able to work varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidays. Physical Requirements Must be able to:Physically access all areas of the property and drive areas with or without a reasonable accommodation.Maintain composure under pressure and consistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts.Ability to interact appropriately and effectively with guests, management, other team members, and outside contacts.Ability for prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneel.Work in a fast-paced and busy environment.Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke.SDL2017

Name: Product Performance Analyst
Description: IGT is setting up a new Data and Analytics organization with the mission to create a connected ecosystem of data, technology, tools, techniques, people, and processes intentionally employed to produce insights that help solve real business problems and empower the decision-making process  Summary  This position is responsible for mining large amounts of data, analyzing results, diagnosing the business and extracting meaningful and actionable insights to improve game performance and account profitability and translating in a way that is digestible by others  Makes recommendations to and work directly with the Sales team and individual Sales reps on a consultative basis to implement recommended changes and produce executive summaries regarding the health of the business and impact of recommendations  Increase the performance of assigned accounts based on knowledge and product analysis, working closely with the Sales group and the Casino Operators  Supports Sales group through the development and maintenance of casino information and reports  Work on a cross-functional Teams including Sales, Product Management, Services and Engineering  Install Base Analysis and Floor Optimization  Manage and Optimize our Recurring Revenue Assets  Support Key Stakeholders in Implementing Strategic Initiatives to Achieve Planned Sales & Product Management Objectives  Support external customers through sales team, as well as internal customers, departments throughout the IGT organization on their various requests around the performance data we are capturing Domestically and Internationally to support them in their initiatives to help achieve the overall companies' goals First Year Goals  Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Planning and implementing projects to improve the performance of IGT products.  Generate games rankings by product type to work on improving product mixtures on casino floors  Generate monthly KPIs through the generation of a dashboard and performance of games and machines  Dealing with customers to build trusting relationships that will produce performance information for analysis and follow up  Visit casinos to detect situations of performance improvement and opportunities for placement of new products or conversions  Analysis of competitive products to identify areas for improvement in our games and settings  Monthly meetings with the sales group to disseminate information about new games and review progress in performance improvement projects for each account.  Provide technical consultation to the Sales Team Required Qualifications  To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:  1-3 years experience required  Knowledge of Gaming Industry and Casino Operations  High analytical and numerical skills  Spreadsheets and database applications  Travel to Customers  Bachelor's degree or equivalent  Proactivity  Relationships and teamwork skills Additional Requirements: Experience with the following toolsets;  SQL Server  Tableau (Business Intelligence)  Power BI  Experience with SAP/Business Warehouse a plus Preferred Qualifications  It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:  Ability to effectively work with cross-functional teams  Possess excellent analytical, strategic, and presentation skills Special requirements needed Pass a background check Keys To Success • Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity. • Build collaborative relationships both internally and externally • Decision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve. • Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles. • Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneself • Foster innovation  ~cb~ #LI-KK1 * IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.SDL2017

Name: Senior Executive Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSenior Executive AnalystAmerican Management Services$150,000 - $250,000 a year$150,000 realistic 1st year earnings, top performers earning more American Management Services is searching for dynamic Senior Executive Analysts to join our team. You will be onsite with our client’s nationwide working with Presidents and owners of privately held small to medium sized businesses. We ultimately provide a blueprint of recommendations and solutions identifying measurable costs, savings, and profit improvements that can be implemented in real-time, guaranteeing profit gains. This role is ideal for the self-motivated person and is generously compensated by an uncapped commission structure and great bonuses.  We are not for everyone! If you have an edge, a competitive drive, and a good working knowledge of financials along with operational functions we will teach you the rest! Responsibilities of a Senior Executive Analyst:Working side by side with ownership to identify the REAL problems the client’s company haveFrom a P&L prospective, what the problems’ real cost areGetting business owners to disclose their shortcomings/weakness and need for assistanceMeeting a lot of “type A” personalities/driversGetting decision makers to open up and talk about the areas of their business they aren’t happy with or that need improvementAsking a lot of questions in your approach and holding the owner accountable to answering each question truthfully100% domestic travel (leave on Sunday nights return on Fridays) consistent for approximately 48 weeks a yearClear understanding of what makes a business tickRoll up your sleeves work ethicBeing comfortable challenging business owners on their shortcomingsAnalysts are provided with extensive training and the tools necessary to accomplish the task. Successful Analysts have attributes that cannot be taught. They are strong, dynamic and confident communicators.To succeed in this position you must have financial/operational skills as well as the ability to close high ticket clients. A TRUE RAIN MAKER!Sales skills are a plus, not afraid of closing six figure dealsDesired Experience, Skills, and Character of Senior Executive Analyst:At least 15 years’ business experience in one or more of the following areas – CEO,CFO,COO, sales/marketing, Business ownership, Senior managementDriven by uncapped commissions and potential to make $150,000-$250,000 your first year (Money motivated)Extreme confidence, even when confronted with uncomfortable conversationsWilling to ask owners tough questions and “stay in your chair”Thrive in a high paced, high pressure environmentExtensive analytical skills and ability to effectively communicate with business owners and senior management is requiredNeed to be continuously challengedRelentless, never give up – closer mentality. “Always Be Closing.”Dislike 2nd place, determined not to let anyone out work youHave a high degree of self-motivation and self-disciplineWhat we offer you as a B2B Sales Closer:Competitive uncapped commission – realistic six-figure income opportunity in your first year.Clients are provided to you from our qualifying sales process100% expenses paidKeep all your own frequent flyer miles and pointsNumerous benefits and incentives, including trips, luxury branded gifts and frequent financial incentivesThe opportunity to be surrounded by top new business closers with a winning mentalityOpportunities for internal promotionTime off is 100% at your discretionSubsidized healthcare401KInitial and ongoing training/support and clear objectives set by managementOpportunity to make a positive impact in your community & upon the lives of business ownersThis position is comparable to: Analyst/ Senior Executive Analyst / Consultant / VP of Sales / Financial Analyst / Business Executive / Operations Manager / Turnaround Expert / Sales / Business Ownership/ Rain Maker / Survey/ Analytical American Management Services, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.Who We Are Founded in 1986, American Management Services, Inc. is the leading provider of implementation-based profit improvement services. Our team of professional operating executives works directly with owners to implement the changes necessary to improve sales, profits, cash flow and ease of operation. These services, commonly available to only the largest companies, are exclusively offered to small and mid-sized privately owned businesses with annual revenues ranging from $4 million to $300 million through our unique system of Pre-Determined Profits™.Company DescriptionFounded in 1986, American Management Services, Inc. is the leading provider of implementation-based profit improvement services. Our team of professional operating executives works directly with owners to implement the changes necessary to improve sales, profits, cash flow and ease of operation. These services, commonly available to only the largest companies, are exclusively offered to small and mid-sized privately owned businesses with annual revenues ranging from $4 million to $300 million through our unique system of Pre-Determined ProfitsTM. We're a smoke-free environment.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Are you ready to level up your career? At Scientific Games, we are committed to making the best games, platforms and systems in the world. We are looking for smart, passionate and creative people to join our team and help us transform the gaming world. We are a global, industry-leading gaming technology company that embraces challenge, fosters an inclusive culture, values integrity, innovation and winning, and is committed to developing and supporting its people.Whether you are a member of our award winning game studios, our industry leading systems group, product management, manufacturing group, services or any of our other amazing Gaming teams, you will be creating compelling games played around the world. We are dedicated to being the industrys only COMPLETE global solutions provider with products that will enhance the entire gaming operation, both on the casino floor and behind the scenes.  If you are ready to playCome join us and lets make games! Job Summary: Assist in financial planning, analysis and forecasting for the Gaming division. Manage activities necessary to provide management with analytics including daily reporting, dashboards and KPIs to report overall business trends. Coordinate with finance to ensure all trending, monthly reconciliations and external reporting are aligned with the requirements of the business.  Position Requirements Essential Job Functions: Provide cross functional support across all product lines to assist in the forecasting process and the consolidation of forecasts into Hyperion Planning.  Coordinate with executive management to provide reporting dashboards and KPIs related to operational trends and regional analytics.  Forecast and monitor material planning needs in comparison to current and long range company forecasts. Identity key areas of concern and report back to operations.  Track trends and forecasts related to SHFL products with the ability to create new reporting as required.  Work closely with international offices to consolidate regional data, monitor forecasts and track operational efficiencies.  Support Commercial Finance team with deal analysis and tracking.  Review analyst reports and external data to gather insight into the overall business strategy and trends and prepare presentations as needed.  Requires the ability to grasp complex business requirements and translate them into new analytics to increase data visibility to the organization. Qualifications:Education: Bachelors Degree  3-5 Years experience with financial analysis, budgeting and forecasting.  Emphasis in Gaming or Finance preferred but not required. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: Proficient with all Microsoft products.  Advanced MS Excel skills required  Knowledge of Hyperion Planning / Smart View desired.  Database knowledge using Access or SQL preferred but not required.  Knowledge of Microsoft Power BI preferred but not required.  Ability to present forecasts, analytics and dashboards in a clear and concise manner.  Excellent oral and written communication skills across all levels of the organization.  Solid understanding of accounting principles and procedures.  Comfortable working under tight deadlines.  Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Physical Requirements:Work Conditions: Scientific Games Corporation and its affiliates (collectively, SG) are engaged in highly regulated gaming and lottery businesses. As a result, certain SG employees may, among other things, be required to obtain a gaming or other license(s), undergo background investigations or security checks, or meet certain standards dictated by law, regulation or contracts. In order to ensure SG complies with its regulatory and contractual commitments, as a condition to hiring and continuing to employ its employees, SG requires all of its employees to meet those requirements that are necessary to fulfill their individual roles. As a prerequisite to employment with SG (to the extent permitted by law), you shall be asked to consent to SG conducting a due diligence/background investigation on you.  This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The employee in this position may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities than those stated above.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If youd like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: EEOC Poster.  SG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. If youd like more information about your equal employment opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please click here EEOC Poster.

Name: SENIOR DATA MARKETING STRATEGY ANALYST
Description: Work with marketing, information technology, operations, and other departments to deliver reports and analysis that drive decision making. Provide in-depth insights and recommendations that drive business results. Provide highly consumable data to the organization. Support your assigned region and casino properties through monthly reporting and analysis that provides insights into business and marketing performance. Serve as a liaison for analytics team on intercompany initiatives. Develops analytical frameworks and repeatable models to support high-impact, corporate initiatives related to marketing.Develops and presents comprehensive presentations to senior leadership in order to articulate and depict best practice recommendations for implementation.Conduct ad-hoc analyses of marketing programs and customer trends.Write SQL to extract data from Boyd data warehouses.Support direct marketing, special events, and promotional activities through robust customer segmentation, performance analysis, test design and analysis, and predictive modeling.Analyze Marketing programs/processes and make recommendations for improvement of their timeliness, accuracy, and effectiveness.Work with data models, identify and utilize reporting tools, and aid in the development of solutions and decisions on managing and evolving the Regional database marketing function.Provide internal team members with training, including but not limited to, analytical best practices, relational databases, and support for analytical tools.Provide input into strategic analytical initiatives and represent the analytics team as needed for intercompany initiatives.Create job flows and maintain documentation of processes.Maintain all files of all completed jobs.Ensure all necessary approvals are obtained for assigned jobs.Adhere to program and department budgets.Assist properties with their marketing campaigns when needed.Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with outside vendors, the properties and other corporate departments.Other duties as assigned.

Name: Senior Credit Risk Analyst
Description: Job Information Work Experience 4 Job Opening ID 311 City Las Vegas Employment Type Direct Hire Job DescriptionMNCP Staffing has an exciting direct hire position for a Senior Credit Risk Analyst for one of National Clients. In this role, you will be analyzing portfolio performance with respect to consumer credit risk at origination. Your areas of focus include: the yield/risk balance of underwriting structure/credit policy and the business impact of new products and programs. Analyses support credit operations, sales and finance operations by providing clear and concise assessments used for decision making.  Responsibilities of the Senior Credit Risk Analyst: Analyze risk in the loan portfolio including, originations trends, credit quality, and default performance.Provide decision support to management team by querying, analyzing, and interpreting qualitative and quantitative data.Prepare reports summarizing findings with recommendations on underwriting structure/credit decisioning.Develop special financing opportunities to support strategic objectives. Partner with other departments to ensure effective implementation of select financing programs.Conduct ad hoc research projects incorporating project design, data collection and analysis, summarization of findings, and presentation of results for areas such as portfolio performance and new origination acquisition strategiesProactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to managementPromote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex dataWork directly with internal business partners to manage internal systems related to portfolio information and financing options Skill set Qualifications of the Senior Credit Risk Analyst:  Must have a Bachelors Degree or higher in Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics, MIS or Accounting  4+ Years of experience of proven portfolio, financial, operational, budgeting and forecasting analysis  Advanced MS Excel Is Required.  Experience in consumer loans portfolio performance, loan underwriting preferred  Understanding of credit analytics, credit scoring modeling preferred

Name: Senior Analyst HCMS Configuration (Corporate)-2
Description: Job Description Grade:Become one of the stars behind the show and become part of the world’s most powerful entertainment brands. Our Company has one exciting mission: To entertain the human race. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will be a key partner with MGM Resort International’s HR Leadership team in providing Workday systems support to all other HR functions. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst is responsible for driving HR process improvements via system setup and maintenance of business processes within Workday. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will partner with other HR business units, Payroll, IT, and vendors to implement changes, enhancements, and new releases, ensuring data integrity, and developing processes to optimize capabilities of the system. The Sr. Workday Configuration Analyst will partner with IT when necessary to troubleshoot issues with integrations to/from and between Workday and other systems.  Evaluates and delivers complex functional and technical solutions within Workday based on their own in-depth understanding of Workday’s object-oriented architecture and Workday’s integration with other systems.Actively seeks out new Workday functionality and/or enhancements to existing functionality and its possible use in the MGM Resorts International implementation of Workday.Configure business processes and corresponding business process and domain security for the following modules: Core HCMPayrollAbsenceCompensationTalent ManagementRecruitingBenefitsManage overall data integrity and accuracy of Workday, and work with the IT group to maintain the uptime of Workday’s service endpoints with downstream systems, while serving as HCMS expert in support of HR business processes and data integration.Maintain ongoing knowledge of Workday releases and changes. Partner with Release Manager to determine the effect of releases and changes to current or future use. Partner with HCMS Solutions team to create recommendations for functional area roadmaps based on upcoming Workday enhancements. Perform other job related duties as requested. Required: Must be 18 or older.Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.At least 6 years required experience in Human Resources Operations (i.e. Employment, Compensation, Labor Relations, HRIS, etc.) and with a Human Capital Management (HCM) system such as Workday, PeopleSoft, or Oracle.Excellent customer service skills.Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.Professional appearance and demeanor.Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.High school diploma or equivalent.Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. Preferred: Experience related to implementation of HR applications.Experience in Workday, Cornerstone Learning Management System and Kronos Time Tracking. Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.Previous experience working in a similar resort setting. #LI-DR1

Name: Senior PeopleSoft Developer/ Technical Analyst (Senior Applications An
Description: Job DescriptionIf you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place!At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We’re dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Name: VP,Business Consultant-Business Banking-Relocation Opportunity-San Jose, CA and Pasadena, CA
Description: Every day, we deliver innovative solutions at the forefront of fintech that help businesses better serve their customers, expand their business, protect themselves from fraud, and reimagine commerce. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we’ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We’re a leader with deep expertise and momentum.Bank of America Merchant Services is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Females, Minorities, Veterans and Disabled.Are you a driven sales executive with a successful track record in the merchant, bankcard, payment processing or financial services sectors? Do you thrive on helping businesses navigate rapid changes in consumer shopping behaviors? If so, consider a compelling career opportunity with Bank of America Merchant Services, a global leader in payments, eCommerce and security solutions.About UsEvery day, we deliver innovative solutions at the forefront of fintech that help businesses better serve their customers, expand their business, protect themselves from fraud, and reimagine commerce. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we’ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We’re a leader with deep expertise and momentum.About the RoleAs a Business Banking Business Consultant, you’ll work with medium-sized businesses on an array of interesting challenges. Surrounded by some of the best talent in the industry, you’ll help clients improve their customer shopping and payment experiences, optimize their online search capabilities, protect customer data, implement customer loyalty programs, launch dynamic mobile solutions, and turn big data into big opportunities.You’ll have complete ownership of both new and existing client relationships within an assigned portfolio of businesses that have revenues between $5 million and $50 million. You will use a solution-based, consultative sales approach to reach designated revenue growth goals. And you’ll have a variety of innovative, strategic partners to call on for everything from referrals to technical expertise.Work with a brand that opens doors for you and is recognized as a leader in payments, eCommerce and security. With outstanding opportunities for career advancement, earning potential and work/life balance, there’s no better place to grow, learn and succeed than Bank of America Merchant Services. We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of females, minorities, veterans and disabled.Key ResponsibilitiesAchieve client retention, margin and cross sale goals within an existing client portfolioProactively evaluate your clients’ business needs and recommend appropriate solutionsLeverage an assigned prospect list to establish new client relationships, meet those clients’ needs, and grow revenue for Bank of America Merchant ServicesMeasure success by portfolio revenue growth, cross sales and client satisfaction.Serve as a key resource to clients, using all of our relevant expertise and resources to deliver a positive experience.Understand the latest industry trends and effectively position our solutions and services to drive cross-sales opportunities.Influence and guide decision making within your clients’ organization.Develop routines that enable effective alignment, communication and collaboration with Bank of America Merchant Services’ partners, including Bank of America Treasury and Client teams and First Data technical/product experts.Own the resolution of issues, contract extensions and other important client matters.SkillsKnowledge and experience in payments, bankcard or related industry sales and consultation.Consultative mindset, with the ability to develop client and business strategies to maximize growth and development.Technologically savvy; comfortable with tablet and cloud-based solutions.Passion for continuously learning about and leveraging new technology.Strong prospecting and relationship building skills.Ability to close complex, high-profile deals and resolve client questions and concerns.Solution selling experience preferred.Ability to quickly establish and maintain productive relationships with senior executives.Highly motivated to succeed in a performance-driven environment.Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.Client-centric focus.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision toward the achievement of personal and team goals.Strong communication skills, including written, oral and presentation skills.Effective planning, prioritization and time management acumen.Outstanding sales/portfolio management, business development and negotiation abilities.Ability to multitask and change direction in fast-paced business environments.Ability to coach colleagues with less experience and/or knowledge, as necessary.ExperienceBachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience5+ years of sales/portfolio management experience, including C-level sales.ToolsProficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Ability to quickly learn various sales applications.Physical RequirementsWorks in varied environments involving sitting and standing. Ability to sit for prolonged periods of time, including as a driver or passenger in an automobile. Ability to utilize a tablet and telephone prolonged periods of time. Ability to visit and move around at client sites including the ability to maneuver in a variety of places. Ability to lift, carry, and otherwise transport work-related materials that may weigh up to 25 lbs. and that may occasionally weigh in excess of 25 lbs.TravelTravel is required to perform essential functions of the role.This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, performance standards, measurements, skills or requirements associated with this job. Name: FP&A Analyst
Description: About IGT  IGT enables players to experience their favorite games across all channels and regulated segments, from Gaming Machines and Lotteries to Interactive and Social Gaming. Leveraging a wealth of premium content, substantial investment in innovation, in-depth customer intelligence, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our gaming solutions anticipate the demands of consumers wherever they decide to play.  Through the PlayDigital division, IGT offers a complete portfolio of award-winning digital gaming products, platforms, and services supporting online interactive casino & slot games, retail & online sports betting, and emerging gaming such as virtual reality.  The PlayDigital FP&A Analyst will report to and work closely with the PlayDigital Senior Manager of FP&A to provide financial forecasting, variance tracking, and other strategic support to the executive team. This position has exposure to executive management and will include strategic analyses such as: board & CFO presentations, capital expenditure analyses, industry/peer group comparisons, new business opportunities, acquisition analyses, and other ad-hoc projects as requested. This function will drive multiple large strategic projects that provide insights and support optimal business decision making. Actions of the Senior Analyst frequently influence the work of other team members, other teams, and management decisions. First Year Goals Job Requirements Include:Work directly with the PlayDigital Senior Manager of FP&A to create monthly financial reporting packages to accommodate divisional and corporate executive teams. Reporting packages inclusive of financial results, KPIs, analysis comparisons to prior periods and budget, and select insights for PlayDigital organizationAssists with the multi-year, annual budget, and financial planning/forecasting processesEnsures driver based forecast system in SAP BPC is accurately reflecting internal assumptionsWorks with product management and sales organizations to understand market dynamics that could impact forecast assumptionsAbility to interface with executive management and effectively communicate financial data and reportsVariance analysis and research against budget/forecasts/prior yearMargin analysis to understand drivers of profitability between actuals and forecast comparesAnalyze trend analysis for all KPI's and financial drivers within the segmentDevelops and updates presentation schedules as necessary; including charts, graphs, PowerPoint slides.Manages data flow into corporate financial planning tool (SAP BPC) and understands the fundamentals of ERP accounting and reporting systems Required QualificationsMinimum 4+ years' experience required in finance, accounting or related fieldBachelor's Degree with major in Business, Finance, or Accounting requiredStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong financial / business systems experience, preferably SAP and BPCMust be a detail oriented self-starter with strong organization skillsAdvanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointAbility to travel on occasionAbility, if needed, to work outside of normal business hours, including weekends and holidays Special requirements needed Pass a background check Keys To Success • Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity. • Build collaborative relationships both internally and externally • Decision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve. • Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles. • Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneself • Foster innovation ~cb~ #LI-KK1 * IGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, state, or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.SDL2017

Name: Commercial Business Consultant
Company: Chapman Las Vegas Dodge Chrysler Jeep
Description: Looking for a job that combines competitive pay with good culture? Have you been considering the automotive industry but don't know how to break in? Chapman Automotive Group is one of the largest & best selling automotive retailers across Arizona and Nevada. We are seeking qualified and flexible candidates to apply for our growing sales team.Every employee with the Chapman Automotive Group is absolutely critical to its success. We have been family owned & operated since 1966, and we take great pride in our reputation. Our rapid growth and fast-paced environment make this an awesome place to work. Happy employees make happy customers, and we reward individuals who are ready to work hard and stay motivated.  Las Vegas Dodge, Chrysler, Jeep and Ram has been serving the business community in Las Vegas for more than 28 years. We have a large customer base and the substantial growth in our city allows us to expand our team of Business Consultants. This opportunity is opened to knowledgeable professionals or individuals from other industries who have experience servicing business clients. As a FCA BusinessLink Dealership, our team provides great service and strives to meet the needs of current and new clients. Professional appearance, organization and motivation are prerequisites. We consider our consultants successful when they have earned business and are viewed as a valuable asset in our client’s businesses. Outside sales calls and networking at specialized events, are a key portion of the consultant’s activities. Chapman will provide needed training and compensation is negotiable depending on experience training. Our standard pay plan for Business Consultants, generously rewards sales and the customer relationship building. If you meet these requirements and will take pride in becoming a member of dynamic team serving our local business community, we encourage you to apply. WHAT WE OFFER:Health & Dental Plan401(k) Retirement PlanPaid VacationsEmployee/Family Vehicle Purchase PlanClear Promotion Tracks & Flexibility to Growth Within ChapmanLong Term Job SecurityFriendly Working EnvironmentWe will provide excellent training and tools that will help hard working and motivated individuals establish a great career in the commercial automotive field.RESPONSIBILITIES:Build relationships with area companies and earn their business by offering attractive company and personal vehicle options.Be the vehicle expert. Know the in’s & the out’s of product offerings, optional packages & latest technologyPerform high-quality and professional demonstrations of new/used vehicles.Follow-up with buyers to ensure referral business.Learn to overcome objections and thrive in sales situationsDirect report to the Sales Manager regarding objectives, planned activities, reviews, and analyses.Bring your ‘A game’ & positive attitude with you every dayREQUIREMENTS:Professional customer contacts and the ability to organize and prepare specialized presentations.Available to work flexible hours & weekendsReady to hit the ground running on learning new product in’s & out’sFantastic communication skills with your customersProfessional, well-groomed personal appearance.Clean driving recordWilling to submit to a pre-employment background check & drug screen

Common tasks/requests:Access Requests (Create New User, Reset Password, Delete User)Update and Maintain the Discovery Data Spreadsheet (DDS)-(Financial Classes, DRGs, locations, Discharge Dispositions, Patient Types, Pend Attributes, etc.)Table maintenanceReview new enhancements with usersUpdate and maintain Billing DRGsGenerate ReportsUpdate and maintain documentsRequirements:3 Years of experience supporting Optum Computer-Assisted Coding (CAC)Experience supporting Optum Clinical Documentation Improvement: CDIPrevious legacy support experience preferredDemonstrated ability to effectively work from a home officeAbility to take call as needed Location: Chicago, IL (remote after 2-4 weeks onsite for knowledge transfer)  Duration: 2 years Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011). the creation, implementation and maintenance of a standardized requirements document.Responsible for planning and implementing thorough and effective QA processes to ensure the highest quality testing Name: SR. FINANCIAL ANALYST - PROCUREMENT
Description: Responsible for the preparation of reports and analyses utilizing spreadsheets and graphs. Analyze procurement bids, proposals, contracts and financial data including market and consumer indices and trends, historical events and special events. Proficient in the preparation of the monthly diversity and other operations reports. Responsible for Company energy program financial management, reporting and analysis. Serves as a resource to the sourcing and procurement teams in providing accurate analysis related to contract bids and/or performance review and measurement.  Job Functions Collaborate with sourcing team and buyers on contracts and prepares related financial analysis of spending and rationalizing pricing with underlying market conditions.Coordinate with all levels of management and buyers to gather, analyze, and prepare reports and/or recommendations regarding financial trends and operating forecasts.Manages Capital Project Budget tracking in SWS systems, coordinating information between Corp Finance, Property Finance and buyers as needed.Manages monthly natural gas nomination process and quarterly electric energy projections.Review and submit UEC tax refund applications.Manage utility contracts, third party consultants, bid reviews and analysis, coordinating efforts with energy consultants as required. Coordinates bill approval process and serves as property liaison.Works on projections related to pending rate cases for electric and eater utilities.Performs collection of monthly data, report creation and distribution of Property Diversity Reporting. Works with key stakeholders to identify errors and implement corrections.Develops and review analyses of costs, processes, and forecast data. This includes current spend documentation, analysis of proposed bids/RFPs, and expected savings/increases.Works with key stakeholders and procurement team for contract performance reviews.Provides support related to P-card Administration and Vendor Master Maintenance.Ability to create reports using company business intelligence tools.Other duties as assigned by management.

Name: Senior Financial Systems Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The Senior Financial Systems Analyst is a vital member of the team responsible for supporting the Global Accounting and Finance teams' use of Diamond Resorts financial accounting and reporting applications by providing senior level technical support on Hyperion Planning, HFM, Essbase, and FDMEE applications.  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSWorks closely with the Financial Planning & Analysis team to understand and develop Company budget and forecasting process and the applications needed to support it.Determines required drivers and calculations, recommends and creates driver dimensions, develops and tests driver based calculations, creates needed applications, security groups, and filters.Provides technical direction to the FPA team on creating planning forms.Helps develop a common dimensionality structure that can support external financial reporting requirements and assists in modifying FDMEE data load rules to support this structure.Determines impact of dimensionality changes across all Company Hyperion applications, modifies processes impacted by the dimensionality change, and ensures dimensionality remains consistent and in sync across all Hyperion applications.Maintains Diamond Resorts Essbase reporting applications and develops FDMEE data load rules to keep data current among them.Provides technical assistance in Company use of Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) as it relates to consolidation calculations, top-side adjustments, and report development.Provides technical assistance and training to junior team members; troubleshoots and resolves application issues raised by them, involving the team's manager and IT resources if necessary.Maintains and adheres to a change control process that ensures system stability and reliability.Completes all required Company trainings and compliance courses as assigned.Adheres to Company standards and maintains compliance with all policies and procedures.Performs other related duties as assigned. EDUCATIONBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in related field. EXPERIENCEA minimum three (3) years of experience in the implementing, maintaining, and administering Hyperion applications required.No supervisory experience required. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESThis position does not include any supervisory responsibilities. LICENSE & CERTIFICATIONSThis position does not require licenses or certifications. SKILLS & ABILITIES This position requires the capability to understand and follow both oral and written directions as well as knowledge and usage of correct business English and office practices. Must be able to communicate effectively with others, analyze and resolve problems, maintain effective working relationships, and interact successfully with internal and external customers.  Specific skills and abilities include, but are not limited to the following: Proven ability in building, deploying and supporting Hyperion Planning and Essbase applications for a large, multi-national company in a fast-paced, evolving environment.Working knowledge in maintaining Hyperion application dimensionality using EPMA.Working knowledge in developing member based formulas and driver based calculations using Hyperion Calc Manager.Familiar with Essbase best practices related to design and how dimensionality can impact application performance.Proven skills in Lifecycle Management (LCM) to migrate changes across multiple system environments.Working knowledge of a chart of account structure, currency translations, financial consolidations and high level accounting concepts; and how these impact the administration of Hyperion applications.Proven skills in developing complex financial reporting using HFM, Essbase, SmartView and Financial Reporting Studio.Must know how to build, troubleshoot, and load data using FDMEE.Working knowledge with Oracle R12's consolidation, accounting setups and FSG reporting.Able to communicate effectively, work independently, manage various demands and tasks in an organized manner and show an aptitude for problem solving.Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.Understands how to develop and implement business strategies.Ability to interpret and create policies, procedures and manuals.Excellent customer service skills.Proficient in time management; the ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.Ability to take initiative and effectively adapt to changes.Recognizes an emergency situation and takes appropriate action.Able to establish and maintain a cooperative working relation.Ability to interpret and create spreadsheets.Able to use sound judgment; work independently, with minimal supervision.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Competent in public speaking.Performs well with frequent interruptions and/or distractions.

Name: Senior Budget Analyst (Senior Accountant)
Description: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or in related business field and 5 years’ of professional level experience, or equivalent training and experience.Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment to resolve problems and accomplish goals where established procedures may not be specific.Must possess creativity, initiative, and ability to apply knowledge and experience to supply accounting data and analyses, secure information on operations and problems, to explore the possibility or need for obtaining additional data, and to provide advice on accounting matters.Excellent computer skills, problem-solving abilities, and good organizational skills.Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills. Must possess excellent interpersonal skills and ability to deal with all types of people in a tactful, professional, and effective manner while screening and maintaining confidentiality.Must be highly organized and able to prioritize and schedule multiple activities to accomplish work goals and objectives effectively.Ability to achieve high degree of accuracy in accomplishing work.Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing. MSTS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. MSTS is a background screening, drug-free workplace. Support budget development, justification, and execution with various organizations by coordinating, compiling, and tracking financial informationIncludes indirect and direct budget information, funding status, forecasting and variance explanations, and baseline change control requestsProvides regular assistance or independently resolves more difficult and complex accounting problems.Responsible for an assigned set of Work Breakdown Structures that will be issued with the Monthly Financial Review packages used in financial review meetingsPerform analysis, report budget performance progress, forecasting and variance reporting input for Indirect Budgets based at the NNSS, NLV, and offsite locationsMonitor and maintain accounting transactions such as accruals, vouchers, labor reports, metrics and other transactions as needed. Interface with CBA’s, PCE’s, Executive Mgmt staff, Directors and Business managersEnsure indirect performance analysis, forecasting and variance analysis is accurate and complete for each monthly reporting cycleProvide analysis that identifies and interprets financial findings linked to operational activities; translate operational information for variance reporting and use problem solving techniques to ascertain concerns, issues, and impactsCoordinate indirect budget forecasting and monitoring of Estimate to Complete and track Finance Indirect Budget performance metrics and management objectivesProvide support information necessary to assist management in business decisions related to Indirect Budgets, costs and variancesParticipate in baseline development for indirect budgets for the fiscal year including analysis to set targetsSupport implementing process improvements and advances for financial reporting toolsDevelop and maintain customer relations with management teams for the indirect organizations, serving as a liaison point of contact from Finance to them to provide prompt, accurate responses, special requests for information, special analyses, presentations or studiesAccept individual responsibility and accountability for environment, safety, health, and quality processes within personal control, personal safety, and the safety of co-workers.Comply with established regulations and procedures for environment, safety, health, and quality and perform duties in a way that will not cause personal danger, endanger other individuals, or violate environment, safety, health, and quality regulations.Promptly correct or report any hazard or potential hazard to supervision.Participate in and embrace MSTS environment, safety, health, and quality initiatives.If you’re looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you’ve come to the right place! At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we’re a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We’re dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Join us!  MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

Name: Business Manager
Description: U.F.P. owns and operates franchised restaurants featuring highly quality foods and customer experience by combining a commitment to quality, exceptional value and first class hospitality, all in a warm and inviting atmosphere. We are currently aggressively expanding our offerings to include event catering and mobile retail.  U.F.P.’s training and development of top talent is our foundation for success. U.F.P. provides a work environment that's team oriented, customer service driven, fast-paced and fun!  We are looking to partner with self motivated entrepreneurial minded individuals to join our catering team in delivering the best event catering and mobile food experience in Las Vegas!  The Partnership will allow you to grow your career and build equity ownership with a fast growing franchise group. We are currently experiencing tremendous growth and have an enormous amount of opportunities for Business Partners to grow within our organization.  Benefits:  Partnering with U.F.P. allows you to take advantage of an amazing compensation package. Benefits for our Business Partners include: $5,000 Signing Advance$1,250 Weekly Base SalaryMedical, Dental, Vision and 401K BenefitsProfit Sharing of up to 33% of Net Profits Generated by your Catering CenterUp to 100% College Tuition and Student Loan ReimbursementOngoing Training and DevelopmentSupportive Work EnvironmentPart-Time and Full Time OpportunitiesGrowth Opportunities Summary:  Our Managing Catering Partners are responsible for daily operations and maintenance of the catering and mobile retail operation in their assigned market segments. Managing Catering Partners are responsible for guest satisfaction, cleanliness, food and product quality. We pride ourselves on customer needs and experience.  Responsibilities: Work with team members to monitor the customization build of new mobile catering unit to insure customization is completed to plan specification and within specified time schedule.Work with team members to conduct interviews, hire and train staff members and volunteers.Maintain good personal credit and background historyParticulate in staff and daily pre-shift meetings.Work with team members to maintain overall operations of the catering unit, achieve daily and weekly goals and report profit and loss to stake holders.Ensure consistent delivery of guest experience.Build sales and profits while ensuring compliance with policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.Execute operations with passion, integrity and knowledge while promoting culture and values of the Company..Travel occasionally to attend meetings, conferences and trainings. If you think you have what it takes visit http://ufpcatering.com/ to apply.  ***The e-mail linked to this ad is not monitored. Please goto link above to apply.***

Name: Investor Reporting Analyst - Entry Level
Description: WE ARE GROWING!About the Investor Reporting Team We are looking for a few more Investor Reporting Analysts to join our team. We are looking for candidates that are flexible, able to work in a small team environment, passionate, energetic and hard-working. We all wear many hats and we play to each others strengths.  Our ideal teammate is someone who is fully invested in solving problems, curious, self-motivated and driven by quality and success. Weve built a fantastic environment to learn and grow. We love what we do, and you will too! We provide training and career advancement. PMSI participates in E-Verify to confirm work authorization. Please note: VISA SPONSORSHIP IS NOT OFFERED for this position.To all recruitment agencies: PMSI does not accept agency resumes. PMSI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency.About PMSI Preferred Mortgage Services, Inc. (PMSI) was founded in 2000 and is a leading provider of technology solutions, consulting and outsourcing to the $10 Trillion Mortgage-backed securities industry. Our ability to combine subject matter experts, analytics and our proprietary cloud-based platform into expert systems, enables PMSI to quickly deliver cost-effective business solutions to our Clients. We are SSAE18 certified in support of our regulated Clients' requirements for rigorous controls and compliance protocols.  To find out more about PMSI please visit www.pmsi.me

Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: As member of the Sales Operations team, the primary focus of the position is to provide opportunity management, sales analysis and reporting in support of the sales division. This position will work with Sales to manage the sales opportunity pipeline, create metrics, analyze sales, opportunity and order data to develop sales/demand forecasts and support our annual census. In addition, this position will develop management reporting and dashboards, help drive business process improvements and support the development of automated tools and applications to increase efficiency and accuracy of analyses and reporting. Analysis will include market share, product mix, funnel coverage, opportunity sales cycle, customer buying trends and sales trends. The position will also interact with key departments in support of the sales forecast including finance, operations, order management and product management. First Year Goals Collaborate with Sales Operations and key contacts to understand the products, markets, and customersWork with Sales to manage opportunity pipeline and develop sales forecastsProvide analysis and management reports to support weekly Sales reporting cadence and censusDemonstrate knowledge of Salesforce.com, SAP, Tableau and associated reporting tools.Drive development of key management dashboards Required QualificationsBachelor's degree required or equivalent experience in an analyst role3+ years of experience as an analyst preferably with a considerable sales focusAdvanced knowledge of Excel, data management and report development preferably using SAP, Salesforce.com and TableauStrong analytical skillsData accuracy, attention to detail, and ability to present data in a professional mannerHighly motivated and able to work independently and manage priorities effectively Special requirements needed Security Investigation Keys To Success • Drive results to achieve high-quality work results regardless of work complexity.Build collaborative relationships both internally and externallyDecision making to identify and understand situations; identify opportunities to proactively resolve.Personal energy to proactively address situations and adopt a positive approach; resilience in front of change and obstacles.Self-leadership to continuously learn and develop oneselfFoster innovation Posting Code: ~cb~ #LI-KK1

Name: Implementation Consultant, Accounting/Finance Software
Description: The Implementation Consultant is responsible for delivering high quality knowledge transfer services to clients allowing them to use Tyler software products efficiently and effectively to achieve daily operations. The knowledge transfers services can be on-site, or via webinar. The incumbent consults and partners with clients to gain a comprehensive understanding of workflow, business/technical requirements and needs to ensure that the knowledge transfer addresses clients needs. The Consultant ensures that the transition to Tyler software is completed according to predetermined timelines and establishes a positive baseline for the new relationship between the client site and Tyler Technologies.  The solution you'll deliver is called Incode. The Incode® ERP solution empowers our clients to do more with fewer resources by making daily financial management tasks easier and more efficient. This product provides market-leading budgeting, financial management, personnel, utility, and citizen service applications to the small-to-mid-size local government market and schools. Location Remote with Travel (available to anyone near a major airport) Travel Up to 100% annually ResponsibilitiesProvide professional services such as consultation, software readiness, and education to clients on Tyler software products.Design and conduct knowledge transfer sessions on site or through webinars.Educate users on software functionality as well as on data entry, system administration, user security, and user permissions.Perform consultation/analysis of client business model to identify and document client requirements regarding Tyler products and functionality.May recommend options for new approaches in client work processes as appropriate to ensure efficient software solution for the clients needs.May identify and document business/technical requirement specifications for specific software design/development, forms, reports, interfaces, process, configuration and other relevant changes.May consult with users to identify the proper data mapping process for the product conversion. Provide instruction to clients on proofing and analyzing data conversions from existing software to Tyler applications.May create custom reports or customize existing reports to satisfy client requirements. Play an active role in troubleshooting client issues, or work with the Support or Development departments to resolve.Keep up to date on administrative tasks such as documenting client issues, communicating agendas, submitting trip reports, timesheets and weekly expense reports, and updating systems-related client activity.May assist QA staff with product testing or modification testing as required.Notify management and appropriate organization/department of issues or unplanned events that could impact the effectiveness/schedule/budget of the implementation.Create both client-facing and internal documentation such as "quick tips" and "how tos".Act as liaison between the client and companys technical staff including conveying technical information so that non-technical individuals can understand.May participate in the annual User Conference. Facilitate user group discussion on assigned module/topic.Extensive travels to client sites (75-100% annually).Perform other duties as assigned.QualificationsBachelors degree, or comparable work experience.Typically a minimum of one year experience as an Associate Implementation Consultant or equivalent industry experience.Strong knowledge of principles and concepts in the discipline for which the knowledge transfer will be based is desired.Exceptional presentation and knowledge transfer skills.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Familiarity and ease with computer systems and Microsoft Office products.Strong problem solving and analytical skills.Ability to travel extensively (75-100%).Valid drivers license. Job Type: Full-time

Name: Accounting Management Consultant
Description: As an Accounting Management Consultant, you will play an instrumental role in assisting clients in a variety of challenging projects to maintain accounting principles, practices and procedures and ensure accurate and timely financial statements.  ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP  Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues  A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues  Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues  Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents  A strong personal identification with RGP’s values – loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE  Lead month-end close process, including maintaining the general ledger and sub ledgers, prepare and review journal entries, balance sheet account reconciliations, and analyze account variances  Direct operational accounting, reconciliation and reporting, communicate and follow up with business partners to ensure that issues are resolved in a timely manner  Ensure appropriate accounting treatment in accordance with GAAP  Prepare and analyze monthly and quarterly reports as required by Client’s policies and procedures, identify and implement process improvements and system enhancements  Review client’s policies and procedures to ensure SOX compliance  DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor’s Degree of Accounting, Finance or related field required  Master’s Degree preferred  CPA or CMA preferred  8-plus years of public accounting, related consulting or industry experience  Experienced with general ledger accounting, month-end close, reconciliations, financial statements, variance analysis and strong knowledge of US GAAP  Experience with ERP systems and strong Excel  Excellent communication and facilitation skills to build relationships and foster trust at all organizational levels and a strong client service orientation.

Name: Commercial Business Consultant
Company: Chapman Las Vegas Dodge Chrysler Jeep
Description: Looking for a job that combines competitive pay with good culture? Have you been considering the automotive industry but don't know how to break in? Chapman Automotive Group is one of the largest & best selling automotive retailers across Arizona and Nevada. We are seeking qualified and flexible candidates to apply for our growing sales team.Every employee with the Chapman Automotive Group is absolutely critical to its success. We have been family owned & operated since 1966, and we take great pride in our reputation. Our rapid growth and fast-paced environment make this an awesome place to work. Happy employees make happy customers, and we reward individuals who are ready to work hard and stay motivated.  Las Vegas Dodge, Chrysler, Jeep and Ram has been serving the business community in Las Vegas for more than 28 years. We have a large customer base and the substantial growth in our city allows us to expand our team of Business Consultants. This opportunity is opened to knowledgeable professionals or individuals from other industries who have experience servicing business clients. As a FCA BusinessLink Dealership, our team provides great service and strives to meet the needs of current and new clients. Professional appearance, organization and motivation are prerequisites. We consider our consultants successful when they have earned business and are viewed as a valuable asset in our client’s businesses. Outside sales calls and networking at specialized events, are a key portion of the consultant’s activities. Chapman will provide needed training and compensation is negotiable depending on experience training. Our standard pay plan for Business Consultants, generously rewards sales and the customer relationship building. If you meet these requirements and will take pride in becoming a member of dynamic team serving our local business community, we encourage you to apply. WHAT WE OFFER:Health & Dental Plan401(k) Retirement PlanPaid VacationsEmployee/Family Vehicle Purchase PlanClear Promotion Tracks & Flexibility to Growth Within ChapmanLong Term Job SecurityFriendly Working EnvironmentWe will provide excellent training and tools that will help hard working and motivated individuals establish a great career in the commercial automotive field.RESPONSIBILITIES:Build relationships with area companies and earn their business by offering attractive company and personal vehicle options.Be the vehicle expert. Know the in’s & the out’s of product offerings, optional packages & latest technologyPerform high-quality and professional demonstrations of new/used vehicles.Follow-up with buyers to ensure referral business.Learn to overcome objections and thrive in sales situationsDirect report to the Sales Manager regarding objectives, planned activities, reviews, and analyses.Bring your ‘A game’ & positive attitude with you every dayREQUIREMENTS:Professional customer contacts and the ability to organize and prepare specialized presentations.Available to work flexible hours & weekendsReady to hit the ground running on learning new product in’s & out’sFantastic communication skills with your customersProfessional, well-groomed personal appearance.Clean driving recordWilling to submit to a pre-employment background check & drug screen

Name: Senior Consulting Engineer Mobility (Microsoft, VMware, Citrix)
Description: CDW’s vision is to be the best national provider of Advanced Technology Solutions. We’ll achieve this reputation by continuing to delight our customers and being the employer of choice for Advanced Technology Solutions. Consulting Engineers at CDW are smart, hard-working Engineers who enjoy teaming with other best and brightest Engineers on highly visible, technically challenging projects and offerings. We’re looking for high-caliber, well-rounded professionals who are passionate about emerging technology, projects and consulting. Name: Joint Terminal Attack Controller (JTAC) Analyst
Description: R&K Enterprise Solutions (R&K) is a Certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business with an earned reputation for delivering best-value services in Information Technology, Program Security, Information Assurance, Cyber Security, Project and Program Management, Exercise Support and a variety of administrative services to Government agencies.R&K supports the 57th Operations Group (57 OG) to provide contract services to support Exercise GREEN FLAG. Title: Joint Terminal Attack Controller (JTAC) Analyst Location: 57th OG Nellis AFB, NV Duration: Permanent/Full-Time Clearance: Secret Clearance Requried Start Date: Immediately Upon Approval Duties: The successful candidate will provide analysis support to the Green Flag Support Element at Nellis AFB, NV as part of the 57 OG. The analyst will support the team with air ground expertise specifically focused on JTAC interaction during training events. This includes exercise planning/after-action support, Air Support Operations Center (ASOC) emulation, Air Tasking Order ATO production, and SME personnel throughout exercise battle cycle.  Additionally, the successful candidate will assist adjudicating air-to-ground delivery and ground-to-air (air defense artillery (ADA), surface to air missile (SAM)) battle damage assessment (BDA). Coordinate with Airspace Command and Control section to deconflict fixed wing assets with Army aviation assets and counter-fire missions. Process airspace plans from the Tactical Air Control Parties (TACPs) and also develop airspace plans. Track active Restricted Operating Zones (ROZ) and create CAS ROZs for Airspace Control Order (ACO) inclusion. Facilitate low altitude requests from the TACPs to allow CAS assets to fly under the coordinating altitude. Process both immediate and preplanned 1972 CAS requests. Use the Air Tasking Order (ATO) and Master Air Attack Plan (MAAP) to track tasked missions and monitor missions available for tasking. Required Knowledge Skills and Abilities (KSA): The Contractor must have the following qualifications: Requires Secret Security ClearanceExperience as a Joint Terminal Attack Controller (JTAC).Experience with DoD Form 1972s.Experience with Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) and Global Area Reference System (GARS).Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).Ability to multi-task, and work within a team construct.Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills.Possession of excellent interpersonal skills.Preferred Qualifications:4+ years of experience as a JTAC2+ years of experience in Air Support Operations Center (ASOC) or similar C2 node.Completed Joint Firepower Course.Completed ASOC Qualification Course.Experience with tactical radios (e.g. PRC-117)Experience with Individual Combat Aircrew Display System (ICADS).Experience with ASOC Gateway.Experience with Tactical Air Control Party Close Air Support System (TACP-CASS).Experience with Command Post of the Future (CPOF).Experience with Combat Training Center-Instrumentation System (CTC-IS). Job Type: Full-time  License: Secret Security Clearance (Required)
